events.id: Christmas in the Quarters--Wellington NZ
events.name: Christmas in the Quarters
events.long_description:
All your favourite Christmas traditions play out across four Saturdays in November and December. The Wellington festive season has a suitably summer flavour with a host of fun activities brought to you by Wellington City Council. 
Christmas in the Quarters kicks off with Christmas crafts in Midland Park on Saturday, 22 November. There are five craft activities to enjoy, plus face painting. Kids can also post a letter in Santa’s letterbox. On Saturday, 29 November, the whole family can enjoy Christmas music and performances. There will be choirs, hip-hop dance, ukulele playing, and more. Chill out and absorb the sounds and sights of Christmas.

events.id: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The impact of colonisation and urban drift are themes in a theatrical reboot at the next Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. ‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992. Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated. It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future. Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their  tīpuna , the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging, and survival. 
Waiora Te Ūkaipō was conceived, written and directed by Hone Kouka (Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kahungunu). The multi-award-winning writer/director has penned 13 plays. Many have been staged in Aotearoa and further afield in Canada, South Africa, New Caledonia, and the UK. Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.

events.venue: Sky Stadium | Porirua Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The beautiful game is back in Wellington, and you won’t want to miss a moment of the action. Since rising from the ashes of the New Zealand Knights in 2007, the Wellington Phoenix has become a must-watch sport in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Now, both the men’s and women’s teams are ready to ignite the 2025/26 A-League season, bringing world-class football to the capital. 
This season promises electric matchdays, three thrilling double-headers, and two home New Zealand derbies. Whether you’re cheering from Sky Stadium in the central city or out at Porirua Park, get ready for passion, energy, and unforgettable football moments. Round up your friends and whānau , grab your tickets, and be part of the action as the Wellington Phoenix take the field.

events.id: Heathers the Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Heathers the Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s Westerberg High, where popularity is a matter of life and death. Welcome to ‘Heathers the Musical”. Based on a movie with the same name, the show is a coming-of-age story dealing with love, heartache, defying expectations, and being true to yourself. It originally premiered in Los Angeles in 2013. Since then, the musical has had record-breaking seasons across the globe. It now makes its professional New Zealand debut in 2026, and Wellington is in line to join the school assembly. Described as a high-octane, black comedy rock musical, Heathers is packed with a mix of ballads and showstoppers. The catchy tunes are written by Kevin Murphy (Desperate Housewives) and Laurence O’Keefe (Legally Blonde: The Musical). 
The 1989 film starred Winona Ryder and Christian Slater. It quickly achieved cult status among audiences. Both the movie and musical follow high school student Veronica Sawyer. Veronica is just another nobody until she’s unexpectedly taken under the wings of the beautiful and cruel Heathers. When mysterious teen rebel J.D. arrives, Veronica learns that it might kill to be a nobody, but it's murder being a somebody. 
This special production will feature a stellar Australasian cast. So grab your scrunchies, break out the Corn Nuts and wait for the bell to ring.

events.id: 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model-41 Percy Cameron Street-All Events In
events.name: 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
events.venue: 41 Percy Cameron Street
events.long_description:
5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
The immediacy of the model’s presence encourages close observation and instinctive decision-making leading to work that is expressive and real. This hands-on interaction brings a sense of movement and authenticity that’s hard to achieve otherwise.

The sculpting process typically starts by analyzing the model’s proportions and pose. A wire armature is built to support the structure and clay is gradually applied to develop the form to a one-third life size 750mm tall figure. From there the artist refines the shapes focusing on anatomical accuracy and expressive detail that give the sculpture its final character.

With nearly 30 years of experience in traditional sculpture and the film industry Javier is not just a sculptor — he’s a mentor. Trained in classical techniques he studied fine arts and took anatomy courses at medical school developing a rare combination of artistic and anatomical knowledge. He spent over five years at the world-renowned Weta Workshop contributing to major films and exhibitions and has worked across materials scales and digital technologies.

Material is included in the price.
Armature is supplied during the workshop.
You can buy our tools during the workshop if you like.
Tea

Also check out other Workshops in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt, Fine Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun, safe, relevant, and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in, your PADI qualification will be recognised.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend, we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive, so we can go at your pace, no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend, you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed, you will be ready for the sea dives.

Once you are a certified diver, you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification on-line. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course, and our regular Dive Days.

We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call, email or stop by our Dive Store.

Kind regards,
Tony Howell
PADI Course Director
Tel: 04 233-8238 Email: nzsa@scubadiving.co.nz Web: www.scubadiving.co.nz
9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua 5026


PADI Open Water Diver course at a glance:
•Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
•Practical: One weekend pool training, one weekend with four sea dives
•Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
•Start Time: Please be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am daily.

Location:
We are located at 9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Check our website for location.

Prerequisites:
•Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
•Be able to swim 300m (no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
•Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts, a visit to your doctor is required.
•Elearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
•Complete the RDP Tables Quiz and Exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring:
•Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
•If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
•A pen, swimming costume, towel and a snack for the breaks.
•Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
•The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost:
•Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
•Includes: PADI eLearning Course, Dive Gear Rental, Pool Sessions, and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased
•10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
•$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When:
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.
Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course:
•Course bookings can be made in-store, via email, online or over the phone
•The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
•Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
•Elearning courses, once redeemed, cannot be transferred.
•Before we can send you the eLearning link, we require your full name, date of birth, a valid personal email address and phone number.
•Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

events.id: How to Really Relax - Know your Mind, meditation class-Te Matapihi - Bulls Community and Events Centre,20 Criterion St, Bulls 4818, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: How to Really Relax - Know your Mind, meditation class
events.venue: Te Matapihi - Bulls Community and Events Centre,20 Criterion St, Bulls 4818, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
How to Really Relax - Know your Mind, meditation class
How to Really Relax - Know your Mind, meditation class
with Kelsang Phunwang

On the surface of a stormy ocean, there are waves and there can be a lot of turbulence.
But the deeper we go below the surface, the more still waters become regardless of the weather at the surface.
By looking within our own mind, we can find similar stillness and refuge from the stress and chaos of our modern life and learn to really relax.

We’ll set off on a gentle voyage of exploration of our mind, developing our understanding of the way in which our mind is the source of our awareness, how thoughts and feelings arise from but always dissolve back into our minds.
We will become more familiar with the deep and profound sense of clarity and peace that arises when our minds are still and undistracted, and which discover our inner potential for peace, happiness and real relaxation.

During this course we will learn and practise meditations that will help us to experience mental clarity and inner peace by meditating of our mind.
We will explore how meditating on our own mind offers us the ability to let go of stress and worry by enabling us to get a clearer, more dispassionate view of our own thoughts and feelings.

DETAILS
Our general programme classes include Dharma teachings along with guided meditations. Each class is self-contained and is also presented as part of a series. Drop into any class you like. These classes are suitable for both beginners and more advanced meditation practitioners. No special clothing is required. Most people sit on chairs. Everyone welcome!

events.long_description:
We’re celebrating an amazing 11 years at 4 Queens Wharf before our big move to Te Matapihi ki te Ao Nui, Central Library.
Join us in our play space for special activities each day during our last week (Monday 8 December - Friday 12 December):
The Great Kiwi Scavenger Hunt | Every day
Collect an activity sheet from the front desk and begin your adventure through the forest. Hand in your completed sheet for a reward.
Memories box | Every day
At the craft table, draw or write your special memories of our play space that you’d like to share with our PlayHQ whānau.
Parachute | Every day
Our parachute will be out in PlayHQ all day every day for rainbow fun, let one of our kaitiaki know if you want to play.
Tamariki yoga | Monday 8 December
Join Aria for tamariki yoga, stretching and movement at 11.00am-11.30am
Storytime | Tuesday 9 December
Gather around for storytime at 11.00am-11.30am, where we'll read some favourite stories together.
Waiata Māori and poi | Wednesday 10 December
Bring your singing voice to PlayHQ for waiata Māori at 11.00am-11.30am. Pick up a poi and try out simple movements as we all sing along.
Crafts | Thursday 11 December
Join us at the craft table 11.00am-11.30am and make a PlayHQ souvenir to take home.
Hākari, kōrero and photos | Friday 12 December
For our last ever day at Queens Wharf, bring in your favourite soft toy for a PlayHQ friends hākari. Bring your own lunch and help yourself to free fresh fruit (please remember PlayHQ is a nut free zone – please do not bring in items with peanuts or tree nuts).
Free photos! Our photobooth will be free all day on Friday so you can take a last photo at Ngā Tūrua Kiwi.
As a last day treat, we’ll have goodie bags for the first 50 tamariki to visit on our final day (Friday).

events.id: Messengers-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Messengers
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
‘Animals first entered the imagination as messengers and promises,’ John Berger.
Messengers explores the enduring gaze shared between humans and other animals. The exhibition title is inspired by a line from John Berger’s seminal 1977 essay ‘Why Look at Animals?’ Berger argued that the relationship between humans and animals – ‘our unspeaking companionship’ – has been transformed by capitalism.
Messengers brings together historical and contemporary ways of looking at animals in photography and art. It features archival photographs from the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Collections, first taken by newspaper photographers in the mid twentieth century. The images capture everything from the polar bears once housed in Wellington Zoo, to an elderly gentleman standing amongst the life size concrete animal sculptures in his garden. These images are at once tender and loving, sentimental and silly, kind and indifferent.
Messengers places these archival photographs in proximity and conversation with contemporary sculpture and moving image works by four Aotearoa-based artists: Denise Batchelor, Brit Bunkley, Jane Dodd and John Ward Knox. From eerie AI and computer-generated animals to the hypnotic stare of a real live Ruru; from carved wooden godwits you can hold in your hand to ‘hominoid’ brooches, each artist’s work speaks to the ‘unspeaking companionship’ between humanity and other animals.
IMAGE Brit Bunkley, still from Transit, single channel video, 2025

events.name: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.description:
Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.
Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse.
Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.
Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.
------ Set Menu (Includes one of each item per person) Cheery Cherry Curator A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet Mint to Be Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together Madeleine Moment A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist Sweet William’s Dish Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan.

events.long_description:
Join us and our doggy guests from Canine Friends Pet Therapy for Read to Kurī at the library. You can book a 15-minute session to sit with one of our friendly dogs and read your favourite book, or one you've found at the library.
Read to Kurī aims to help children improve their literacy, self-confidence, and self-esteem in a relaxed, non-judgemental environment. This programme is perfect for tamariki aged 5+ who would like to practice their reading skills while making a new canine friend at the library.
To book your session, please call the library on 04 477 6151, or email johnsonville.library@wcc.govt.nz with your preferred date and time.
Bookings are for 15 minutes only. After you have booked, library staff will be in contact informing you what time to arrive for your session.

events.id: Unspoken Rules of Japan-100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Unspoken Rules of Japan
events.venue: 100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you planning to visit, study, or work in Japan? Worried about Japan’s unspoken rules? Let’s clear them up together!
All attendees must register at https://forms.office.com/r/edXwdDsAhX
Register online to join us for a fun and interactive session with JETAA and MEXT Alumni as we uncover the unspoken social rules that shape daily life in Japan from how to behave on a train to what not to do in a supermarket!
In this relaxed, Q&A-style event, we’ll share funny and insightful stories about real-life etiquette in Japan:
Whether you’re a soon-to-be traveller, a university student preparing for exchange, or a future JET participant, this event will give you the insider knowledge (and a few laughs) to make your time in Japan smooth and enjoyable.
Date & Time: December 8th (Monday) 5:30pm to 6:30pm
Venue: L18, The Majestic Centre, JICC, 100 Willis St. Wellington
Format: Talk + Open Q&A
Language: English
Audience: NZ university students, Japan-bound travellers, and anyone curious about Japanese culture
Admission: Free (registration required)

events.id: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking-Boatshed Apartments, 22 Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Boatshed Apartments, 22 Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We're joining up with Pedal Ready for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay.
Build your confidence and skills to ride safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike), explore the latest cycleway improvements, and learn practical tips for night-time commuting.
The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay. You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park. Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.
Monday 8 December
5.30pm - 7.30pm (arrive 30 minutes early if renting a bike)
Meet at Switched on Bikes HQ, near Waitangi Park
Free event. E-bike hire available for $10.
These rides are suitable for people who:
Know how to ride a bike but aren't yet travelling by bike in the city; or
Those travelling by bike in the city but would like to gain confidence; or
Those who want to learn how to use new infrastructure.
Open to riders aged 18+ (or 13+ if accompanied by an adult). Families are also welcome to bring younger children on cargo bikes or bike seats provided themselves. Please enquire directly with Switched on Bikes if you'd like to borrow a bike seat for the tour.
Spaces are limited, so make sure to register here: https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/.../welly-on.../wellington
events.description:
The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay.

Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.
Monday 8 December 5.30pm - 7.30pm (arrive 30 minutes early if renting a bike) Meet at Switched on Bikes HQ, near Waitangi Park Free event.
E-bike hire available for $10.

events.id: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking-Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay. Build your confidence and skills to ride safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike), explore the latest cycleway improvements, and learn practical tips for night-time commuting.

The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay. You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park. Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.

Duration: Please allow around 2 hours for the ride.
Arrival: Arrive 30 minutes early if you’re renting a bike.
Preparation: Bring clothing suitable for changing weather conditions.

These rides are ideal for people who:
- Can ride a bike but haven’t yet started biking regularly in the city.
- Already ride in the city but want to gain confidence.
- Want to learn how to use Wellington’s cycleway network safely and efficiently.

Who can join: Open to riders aged 18+, or 13+ if accompanied by an adult. Younger children are welcome on cargo bikes or bike seats provided by participants. If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.

Bikes and bookings:
An electric bike is strongly recommended. Thanks to Switched On Bikes and Wellington City Council, you can rent one for only $10 if you don’t have access to your own. Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels

After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic! You’re welcome to return the bike before 9am the next day at no extra cost or hold onto it for the following day at a discounted rate of $39.

If you’d like to learn to ride a bike away from traffic, check out the free Pedal Ready courses on their website.

For any pātai (questions) about the tours, please email info@pedalready.org.nz.

Privacy Statement:
Information collected for this ride is used for booking and safety purposes. Your name and emergency contact details will be deleted within 14 days after the tour. Other provided information may be stored anonymously to support project evaluation. Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

You have the right to request access to or correction of your information. To do so, please email tours@wcc.govt.nz.
events.description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay.
You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park.
If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.
Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic!
Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

events.name: Yoga in the Park
events.venue: Waikanae Park, Park Ave, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Join us for the 7th year of Yoga in the Park at Waikanae Park on Park Ave!

Our classes focus on balance and stability, incorporating breathing exercises, longer holds, and plenty of options to modify poses based on your fitness level. We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. This is your practice, so if you’d rather spend the hour in Child’s Pose, soaking in the sounds of the birds, that’s perfectly fine!

What to bring: A mat or towel, a hat, and some water. I’ll take care of the rest.

Payment Options:
Cash
Bank transfer (online)

Pricing:
$15 for a single class
$150 for an Outdoor Pass (covers the whole season: Nov to March, 21 classes + additional beach yoga sessions starting in 2026)

I can’t wait to see familiar faces and welcome new ones this season! Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions.

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - Piha Sunset-The Borough, 162/168 Main Road, Tawa, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - Piha Sunset
events.venue: The Borough, 162/168 Main Road, Tawa, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Tawa, Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.long_description:
Stitch & Butch @ Blondini’s!
A casual meet up of crafters within the rainbow community
New members welcome.
Bring your knitting/crochet/cross stitch/embroidery/crafting/art or just come and have a chat.
Feel free to come partway through the time or leave early as needed.
Stitch and butch is a playful twist on the stitch and b!tch name to reflect the queerness of the group. Attendees do not need to be in any particular subset of the queer community to be welcome.
Usually gathered around one of the tables in the lounge area upstairs. Often near the walls for the brighter lights to better see our stitches.
There is a lift as well as stairs and Courtenay place bus stops across the road.
Held on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of the month with a summer break.

events.id: Deep dive - OPEN level - Hip Hop styling-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Deep dive - OPEN level - Hip Hop styling
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Across five immersive sessions at 7pm (no class on Monday 17th Nov), we’ll explore the fusion of Zouk’s fluidity with the grounded rhythm and groove of Hip Hop. This isn’t just about choreography — it’s also about embodying attitude, texture, and expression through movement that feels raw, connected, and alive.
Through isolations, foot work, and rhythm play, you’ll learn to bring hip hop’s strength and intention into Zouk’s softness and flow. We’ll explore how to shift energy, contrast smoothness with sharpness, and find your own unique flavour within the dance.
These concepts will be anchored in Zouk’s foundational movements, helping you integrate Hip Hop styling in a way that enhances connection, musicality, and body awareness.
This is an OPEN level deep dive, welcoming both newcomers and experienced dancers. Whether you’re looking to expand your styling or reconnect with your groove, this series invites you to move with rhythm, express with confidence, and dance with authentic flow.
Prepaid 5 week block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- If you are also doing another level class with us then the cost will be reduced to the unwaged/student cost for all classes (saves you a bit of $$)
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukDeep16
Location:
Classes are in the Footnote NZ Dance Studio, 60 Dixon street

You are invited to our Village Festival ✨

We are proud to officially open the very first Our Whare Our Fale homes in Porirua and we would love for you and your family to join us as we celebrate this historic moment.

Bring the aiga, enjoy an evening of community, culture, and celebration, and be part of this milestone for Pasefika homeownership.

📍 18 Castor Crescent, Porirua (Our Whare Our Fale site, entrance also via Hazard Grove)

If you would like to have a free stall at the event, please contact:

We cannot wait to see you there 🤎

events.id: 9th December | Mental Health First Response Training - 1 Day-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: 9th December | Mental Health First Response Training - 1 Day
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Book now at hello@coliberate.co.nz
Do you feel equipped to respond to someone in the moment they are in distress?
Mental Health First Response is a 1 day training that delivers key understandings, skills and practices so people can provide first response and co-care support for your wider community or workplace. This succinct and robust training enables them to respond quickly and effectively.

"All New Zealanders would hugely benefit from this training. No one is immune to mental illness and this training allows us to be better equipped to deal with it early and effectively. At the most basic level, this course teaches us how to better communicate with each other, something we have lost and something that has the power to be lifesaving. The skills learned through this course are priceless and much needed by everyone in every walk of life." Jessica Jane Harnett, MHFR Course Participant.
---
This one day course is made up of four modulesL:
1. Mental Health Support Platforms - this session creates a strong foundation for all understandings of best support practices.
2. CRISIS Response - this session develops confidence to respond to mental health crises.
3. CONVOS Support Framework - this session guides you through a conversational framework to help you provide mental health support early.
4. Practice - build confidence by practicing the skills and applying it to your context in this session.


All sessions have:
∙ Participatory learning approach
∙ Individual workbooks
∙ Visual, game-based and participant-led learning environment
∙ CoLiberate’s acclaimed group experience model
--> Certificate valid for 1 year on completion.
----
Keen to do this training but these dates don't work for you? Please fill out our Expression of Interest form and we will be in touch with future training dates. https://tinyurl.com/fuy55y6n

Please don't hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions about this training at hello@coliberate.co.nz

events.id: Karori Friendship Club-St Ninian's Uniting Church, 208 Karori Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Karori Friendship Club
events.venue: St Ninian's Uniting Church, 208 Karori Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Looking for community, connection, and a good cuppa?

Come and join us at the Karori Friendship Club — a friendly weekly gathering where you can:
- Meet new people
- Share stories over morning tea
- Try your hand at a puzzle or join a chat group
- Simply enjoy time together in a relaxed space

Where: St Ninian’s Church, 208 Karori Road, Karori
When: Every Tuesday, 10am–12pm
Koha for morning tea

Although many who come are seniors, the club is open to anyone — whether you’re new to the area, a recent migrant, or just looking to make some new friends. People join us from all over Wellington, not just Karori!

Why not come along this Tuesday and see for yourself? You might leave with new friends, a full heart, and maybe even a completed puzzle.

events.id: Throwing Muses - Wellington, New Zealand-San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Throwing Muses - Wellington, New Zealand
events.venue: San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Throwing Muses - Wellington, New Zealand
Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed and beloved US indie bands - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.

The band's first NZ tour in 31 years features concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.

Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.

Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.

Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.

events.name: Baby Rock & Rhyme
events.venue: 4 Queens Whrf, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us in PlayHQ for these Tuesday sessions.
Baby Rock & Rhyme with Wellington City Libraries & Nōku te Ao Capital E.
Ideal for babies and tiny tots, Baby Rock & Rhyme is a weekly drop-in programme for you to spend quality time with your baby through rhymes, fingerplays and stories.
Delivered by an experienced facilitator, you and your baby will have fun exploring their first introduction to literacy and music, set inside the inspiring and ever-changing PlayHQ.
Best suits ages 0-2, Baby Rock & Rhyme is part of our E Tipu E Rea term-time programme.
Free, donations appreciated.
Located at Nōku te Ao Capital E, 4 Queens Wharf, Wellington. Pram parking and accessible bathrooms available.
Learn more at: https://www.capitale.org.nz/event/baby-rock-n-rhyme/

events.id: TED-Style Talks (9 Dec) — Quiz night + pot luck 🥘🎉-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: TED-Style Talks (9 Dec) — Quiz night + pot luck 🥘🎉
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
✨ Join us in celebrating another year of educational, inspirational, and entertaining TED-Style Tuesday Talks with a quiz night and pot luck ✨

Get your pay-what-you-feel ticket 🎟 and don't forget to bring along some food to share and some curiosity 🧐
Plan
5:15pm - Doors open, registration, and mingle
5:40pm - Intro and welcome
5:45pm - Quiz begins
6:30pm - Pot luck and catch up
7:15pm - Karaoke (optional)
Tea will be available at the venue and a cash bar will be operating. Bring a plate to share with everyone 😋
How to find us: Take the "high rise lifts" in Majestic Centre to level 28. We'll also put up signs at the lift. Building entrance is from Willis Street (till 6pm) and from Boulcott Street (till 7pm).
We take pictures to document the events. If you don't want to be photographed, simply let us know on arrival.
You may also click "follow" on Humanitix to be notified of future events.
See you on the 9th!
---
About the group
We are a group of curious people from all walks of life who want to learn and get inspired from each other. Everyone is welcome to join, as long as you are curious and willing to share and learn.

events.id: 8 week Pre Xmas Beginners Yoga Course-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: 8 week Pre Xmas Beginners Yoga Course
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice as well as plenty of time for guided relaxation. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.
This course called "part 1" will cover the second half of Level 1 from the System of Yoga in Daily Life.

events.id: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block D-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block D
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
Please note that there will be no class on 18th November, but we may run a practica
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Soltinho
Week 4: Body Roll, and Snake
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukFunD

events.id: Hypnosis for a Manifestation Mastermind-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Hypnosis for a Manifestation Mastermind
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

This workshop invites you to explore the deeper roots of abundance, beyond effort, beyond control. Together, we’ll look at how inner clarity, energetic alignment, and conscious detachment open the flow of true prosperity.

Instead of chasing outcomes, you’ll learn to move with life, to act from purpose rather than pressure. We’ll reflect on how attention shapes reality, why stillness restores vitality, and how joy itself becomes a magnet for success.

This experience isn’t about manifesting more things, it’s about aligning with the movement of life, where fulfillment, freedom, and natural abundance unfold with ease.

Meet Gopi, your host

Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity and overcome challenges on their path through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

6.15pm Tuesday 9th December

End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

events.id: Men's Group Tuesday 9 Dec-Central City, Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Men's Group Tuesday 9 Dec
events.venue: Central City, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

events.id: Robin Hood - The Pantomime-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Robin Hood - The Pantomime
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Adventures of the original working-class hero and man in tights!

Robin Hood steals from the rich and gives to the poor in an oldie timey place where people are struggling and homeless and the landed gentry hoard the money all for themselves – Wellington 2025.

Robin must stop the Evil Sheriff from running roughshod over the citizens! But this quest is far from easy… there is archery, swordfights, and a lot of dance numbers to get through. Our hero is grateful for help from spies on the inside: Maid Marion, and her bolshie Nanny (Pantomime Dame Jthan Morgan).

Come one and come all to see the slings and arrows of outrageous panto!


Written by Simon Leary & Gavin Rutherford
Directed by Gavin Rutherford
Musical Direction and Arrangements by Michael Nicholas Williams

events.id: Altum Academy Open Day-66 Albemarle Road, Wilton, Northland 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Altum Academy Open Day
events.venue: 66 Albemarle Road, Wilton, Northland 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Altum Classical Academy’s upcoming open days are an invitation to discover what a quality education could mean for your child. There will be two information sessions. One on a weekday evening and one on a weekend afternoon. Families interested in understanding more about classical education, and Altum, are invited to join.
You’ll find it’s 90 minutes well spent.
30 minutes will be spent sharing information about the school, curriculum and ethos.
The following 30 minutes will consist of a question/answer time; where the principal, school board and teachers field questions from parents and interested parties.
The last 30 minutes will be spent touring the grounds and viewing Altum’s school facilities.
Altum Classical Academy is starting next year in Wellington. It’s a charter high school that believes that every student should be given a chance to excel, whatever their circumstances. Take the chance. Make a change.
Dates:
Sunday 7th December, 2:00-3:30pm
Tuesday 9th December, 7:00-8:30pm
Free to attend, but please register so we know you're coming.

events.id: Brazilian Zouk - Head Movements - Rotisserie-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Brazilian Zouk - Head Movements - Rotisserie
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block F (5 weeks).
Please note that there will be no class on 18th November, but we may run a practica
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.
In Improvers Block E you will get an Introduction to Head movements - Rotisserie, as well as some exercises on Creativity.
===Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week Block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukImpF
===Location:
Classes are in Footnote dance studio, 60 Dixon Street
===Housekeeping:
- You should have completed the 4 beginner Class blocks before joining Improvers classes
- Drop in or new students, please get in contact before the start of class to let us know you are interested so we can assess your level and organise a private class if necessary to catch you up. If you just show up on the night, you are welcome to watch the class but will not be able to join in (this is to respect the learning of our regular students as the classes are progressive)

events.name: Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Christmas Bauble
events.venue: Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: First drink is NOT included in the ticket price

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.name: 9 December Whisky Tasting
events.venue: 16 Dundas Street, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Whisky Tasting: 9 December 2025
Hosted by Matt Mueller
On Tuesday, December 8th, the Seatoun Clubhouse will host our annual "Christmas Whisky Tasting" where every sample of "whisky" is an unexpected holiday treat!
What should you expect?  A blend!  Whiskies from countries other than Scotland. A whisky that costs more than $300 per bottle! A whisky that we've tried before (kinda), and some twists and turns along the way. This tasting will be served up completely blind, where the bottles are hidden, and whatever is in the glass must speak for itself.  It WILL be interesting.
Please join me for a lively end-of-year tasting on Tuesday, December 8th at the Seatoun Clubhouse.  Tickets are $60 per person.
See you then,
Matt
*** Please note you need to be a member or a guest of a member to attend. Details on how to pay subs is below***
Membership subscriptions
Subs details: $50 for social membership, $100 for family social, $120 for playing membership. Pay direct into the club bank account:
Account Name: Seatoun Bowling Club Inc  
Bank: Westpac Kilbirnie  
Bank Account #: 030521- 0101368 - 00 
Please include your name in one of the boxes on the bank payment form.

events.id: Dark Matter-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Dark Matter
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
Written and directed by Chris Robertson. Produced by Aimee Dredge.

A crew of six journeys millions of miles away to the planet of Obiteria, in search of the unknown.
However, at the halfway point on their mission, they stumble upon something that could change their lives forever.

The disjointed group has to face the biggest decision of their life. Should they keep what they found a secret, or let everyone on Earth know the truth? Terminal illness and religion are the driving factors for opposing views, but what secrets will be revealed about the rest of the unlikely astronauts?
With only a day before they descend home, a choice has to be made. And it has to be now!
After a successful Playreading in 2024, ‘Dark Matter’ is now ready for the stage.

“LEFT THE TABLE READ BUZZING. WOULD DEFINITELY LINE UP TO SEE THIS AS A SHOW.”
NATHANAEL MITCHELL (AUDIENCE)

“DARK MATTER IS A REFRESHING PIECE THAT DEMONSTRATES THE EXCITING POTENTIAL OF A CRIMINALLY UNDER-UTILISED GENRE IN THEATRE. I WANT MORE OF THIS.”
BROCK OLIVER (AUDIENCE)

“DARK MATTER WAS A BRILLIANT AND TENSE SCRIPT THAT HAD ME ON THE EDGE OF MY SEAT. IT HAD ME EAGER TO LEARN EACH NEW PIECE OF INFORMATION ON THE CHARACTERS.”
SAM LEWIS (AUDIENCE)

Follow @aadredge_ to keep up to date on Instagram.

AADredge presents a new play written and directed by Chris Robertson.

Our Crewmen:
Kit Marsh as Alice "the scientist"
James Bayliss as Liam "the captain"
Maea Shepherd as Eva "the doctor"
Kealan Schmidt as Peter "the pilot"
Legion Kelly as Adam "the sergeant"
Georgia Woodrow as Liz "the engineer"

With only a day before they descend home, a choice has to be made.
And it has to be now!

events.id: Every Kind Of Weather-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Every Kind Of Weather
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A theatrical double-shot from an iconic playwright and one of our greatest actors.

Bruce Mason is perhaps the most significant playwright in Aotearoa New Zealand’s theatrical history. Writing with courage and insight, he was a lover of language and a champion of the underdog.

Between 1959 and 1978, Bruce toured the country, telling uniquely Kiwi stories about emerging identity, cultural cringe and social difference. From church halls to country shearing sheds to the Edinburgh Festival, Bruce would play anywhere, in any circumstance, to any audience.

To celebrate his extraordinary legacy, Brilliant Adventures and Circa Theatre are collaborating to make two of his greatest solo works resound for a new age.

Two plays: timeless, universal, distinct. Following their critically acclaimed, sold out run of THINGS I KNOW TO BE TRUE, actor Stephen Lovatt and director Shane Bosher return to Circa for a not-to-be missed theatrical encounter with a master craftsman.

THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER
“I invite you to join me, in a voyage into the past, to that territory of the heart we call childhood.”

Bruce Mason’s quintessential Kiwi classic chronicles the friendship between a 12-year-old boy and Firpo, a social outcast who dreams of winning an Olympic medal.

Through the boy’s eyes we see the wonder of life on a perfect beach, in a perfect 1930s New Zealand, during a perfect summer. It’s a world of magic and transformation, where anything can happen and miracles seem possible.

When the boy sets out to help Firpo make his athletic dream a reality, ignoring his father’s rebukes and community ridicule, a battle rages between the eternal optimism of childhood and the harsh pragmatism of adulthood.

Gliding effortlessly between flights of poetic fancy and blunt everyday speech, THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER is New Zealand storytelling at its very best.

NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES
An adolescent boy tries to find his place in an adult-dominated world. A young man retraces an intensely felt boyhood experience of bullying. A playwright in his last days reconciles the value of an artistic life and challenges the idea of New Zealand identity.

Comic disasters and confronting your own hubris. NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES is a richly autobiographical search for self-expression. Profound and true, it is a set of variations about over-reaching, cheekily confronting our very own Tall Poppy Syndrome.

Celebrating Bruce Mason
Directed by Shane Bosher
Performed by Stephen Lovatt

Thursday 20 November to Saturday 13 December
Preview Night: Wed 19 Nov – The End of the Golden Weather
Preview Night: Fri 21 Nov – Not Christmas, But Guy Fawkes
Sunday Special: Sunday 23 November – The End of the Golden Weather
Q&A: Tuesday 25 November
Choose Your Price Night: Wed 26 November – Not Christmas, But Guy Fawkes
Circa Two
Tues – Fri 7.30pm, Sat 4.30pm & 7.30pm, Sun 4.30pm
$30 – $60 Early Bird Tickets Available

Productions play on alternate nights with an opportunity to see both productions in conversation with each other on Saturdays

events.id: Throwing Muses-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Throwing Muses
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed US college bands of the 1990s - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.


The band has announced concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.
Throwing Muses' Aotearoa tour is part of New Zealand promoter Plus1 Touring's 25th anniversary celebrations.
These are Throwing Muses' first shows in New Zealand since 1994.
Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.
Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.
‘Moonlight Concessions’ goes back to basics, a return for Throwing Muses to their esoteric off-kilter best courtesy of Kristin’s pin-sharp sketches and their suitably abrasive musical arrangements. The album follows ‘Sun Racket’ from 2020, a heady set filled with tough and tender tales spiked with surreal imagery.
Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.

events.id: Chit Chat with a Kit Kat (Free Event)-Johnsonville Library,34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Chit Chat with a Kit Kat (Free Event)
events.venue: Johnsonville Library,34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Chit Chat with a Kit Kat (Free Event)

Chit Chat with a Kit Kat and Coffee!

This is for 'all women' of all ages and from all walks of life who just need to be heard, and to share their worries, burdens, stresses, grief, sadness, loss etc.. and my friend and myself are realising there are alot of us out there experiencing these emotions for a myriad of reasons, be it loss, be it menopause, be it grief, stress, anxiety, depression, financial, family stuff, so my beautiful friend and I thought it would be a great idea to extend our little sessions that we have been having to more women who are in need of just being free to feel what we feel, to be honest, raw and open and not feel judged for our thoughts and emotions in a safe, loving, caring, understanding space, where we can support each other to be "Brave Bold and Beautiful" under pressure

We are human beings doing the best we can with what we have in a world that has sort of gone a bit pear shape hey, so this 'Beautiful Woman', is about allowing you and me to speak our truth amongst like minded women in a safe space who are experiencing similar feelings and emotions with no judgement, just love and understanding

The positive of this, is when we vocalise and communicate our worries, concerns, hurts, disappointments, sadness, anger, frustrations, annoyances, we actually let go toxic energy from our mind, body, soul which actually improves our health and wellbeing mentally and physically, fact and truth!

Studies and Statistics have proven that 80% of illnesses are caused by STRESS, so let's just do something kind, caring, loving and healing for us, and let's get together and get raw, real and natural, and chit chat about whatever it is you want to chit chat about, no judgement of course within reason lol :)

What do you think? Sounds fab? :)
If so then Direct Message me or email to confirm, and i'll book you in on the 3rd of December or if you are just one of those bizzy Lizzy's like me and you forgot to book, then just feel free to rock up or text me, which i will give you access to when you email ,but prefer confirmation due to space being free to use

Where:
1.Johnsonville Public Library
2.Upstairs in a Private space
3.10am -12pm Just ask person at the desk where to go if you are unsure

p.s Great coffee shop next door on the same level :) or bring your own coffee or tea in a flask if that's what you prefer as I know some people are particular with their drinks like I can be sometimes lol :)

events.id: Plant and Learn in the WELLfed Garden-WELLfed,54 Hampshire St, Cannons Creek, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Plant and Learn in the WELLfed Garden
events.venue: WELLfed,54 Hampshire St, Cannons Creek, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Plant and Learn in the WELLfed Garden
ALL WELCOME! Join us for "Plant and Learn" in the WELLfed Garden

Join the WELLfed Garden crew each Wednesday morning to spend some time gardening and learning!

No experience or skills are necessary - our awesome team can teach you about when and how garden tasks need doing and lots of skills you can use in your own garden.

Garden tasks include composting, seed starting, seed sowing, plant health, biology first gardening (working with nature).
Sharing morning tea (delicious WELLfed snacks provided!) is also a great chance to connect with other awesome humans in our community.

Pre-schoolers are welcome during term time and during the school holidays you are welcome to bring school-aged kids. They can get stuck in and connect with Papatunuku as well, or there is space for outdoor play. Children must be supervised by their caregivers whilst onsite.

Plant and Learn session are weather and staffing dependent - we will post in the event if we won't be gardening due to rain or sickness.

🌱 Newtown Seeds to Feeds: Planting, Potluck, and Community Cheer! 🥗

Nau mai, haere mai! Join the Seeds to Feeds Newtown Crew for a joyful evening of hands-on gardening, shared kai, and connecting with your neighbours.

Whether you're a seasoned green thumb, a complete beginner, or just someone who loves good food and great company, this is the perfect opportunity to get involved in our local food journey!

What's Happening?

Hands-on Planting: We'll be rolling up our sleeves to get some beautiful summer seedlings into the ground at the Mornington Golf Club. It's a fantastic chance to learn a new skill or share your existing knowledge.

Delicious Pot Luck: Bring a plate of your favourite food to share!

Community Connection: Meet the passionate people growing, cooking and sharing kai right here in our community.

Event Details
📅 Date: Sunday, 10th December

⏰ Time: From 4:00 PM

📍 Location: Mornington Golf Club

Everyone is welcome! Come and see what all the fuss is about. We can't wait to meet you!

Arohanui! The Seeds to Feeds Newtown Crew

Gin Rummy! Tournament
Come play Gin Rummy!
In this Inaugural Tournament, The Beer Engine is feeling out the game and how it works to have a fun and friendly tourney that doesn't take too long and you might meet some fun folks!

We have 3 more dates for this first season, theres a nightly prize and a season end prizes, special cocktails and a general atmosphere of communal good times! You don't have to commit to them all, just turn up!

events.id: Chit Chat with a Kit Kat (Free Event)-34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Chit Chat with a Kit Kat (Free Event)
events.venue: 34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Chit Chat with a Kit Kat and Coffee!
This is for 'all women' of all ages and from all walks of life who just need to be heard, and to share their worries, burdens, stresses, grief, sadness, loss etc.. and my friend and myself are realising there are alot of us out there experiencing these emotions for a myriad of reasons, be it loss, be it menopause, be it grief, stress, anxiety, depression, financial, family stuff, so my beautiful friend and I thought it would be a great idea to extend our little sessions that we have been having to more women who are in need of just being free to feel what we feel, to be honest, raw and open and not feel judged for our thoughts and emotions in a safe, loving, caring, understanding space, where we can support each other to be "Brave Bold and Beautiful" under pressure
We are human beings doing the best we can with what we have in a world that has sort of gone a bit pear shape hey, so this 'Beautiful Woman', is about allowing you and me to speak our truth amongst like minded women in a safe space who are experiencing similar feelings and emotions with no judgement, just love and understanding
The positive of this, is when we vocalise and communicate our worries, concerns, hurts, disappointments, sadness, anger, frustrations, annoyances, we actually let go toxic energy from our mind, body, soul which actually improves our health and wellbeing mentally and physically, fact and truth!
Studies and Statistics have proven that 80% of illnesses are caused by STRESS, so let's just do something kind, caring, loving and healing for us, and let's get together and get raw, real and natural, and chit chat about whatever it is you want to chit chat about, no judgement of course within reason lol
What do you think? Sounds fab?

If so then Direct Message me or email stessak@gmail.com to confirm, and i'll book you in on the 3rd of December or if you are just one of those bizzy Lizzy's like me and you forgot to book, then just feel free to rock up or text me, which i will give you access to when you email stessak@gmail.com,but prefer confirmation due to space being free to use
Where:
1.Johnsonville Public Library
2.Upstairs in a Private space
3.10am -12pm Just ask person at the desk where to go if you are unsure
p.s Great coffee shop next door on the same level
or bring your own coffee or tea in a flask if that's what you prefer as I know some people are particular with their drinks like I can be sometimes lol

events.id: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Explore Stonehenge Aotearoa at Your Own Pace

Our self-guided tour includes a map and a 12-minute audio-visual presentation to help you uncover the secrets of the henge. Afterward, head down to the stone circle and try out its unique acoustics — clap your hands and hear the echo respond, or whisper and see how far your voice carries.

A self-guided tour typically takes around 30 minutes, but many visitors stay longer simply because it’s so much fun. The bigger your group, the better the experience!

Please arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time.
Available during our opening hours: 10 AM – 4 PM.

events.id: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Join a Shared Guided Tour and experience Stonehenge Aotearoa through the eyes of an expert. In this 90-minute journey, you’ll uncover how ancient cultures measured time, tracked the Sun and Moon, and connected the heavens with life on Earth.

Your experience begins with a captivating introduction and a 15-minute audio-visual presentation explaining how the Henge works. Then, step outside with your guide for a detailed tour of the stone circle, where astronomy, archaeology, and mythology come together in one unforgettable setting.

Perfect for visitors seeking a deeper understanding of the stars and stories that shaped human history.

events.name: Resonance Choir – A Carol Celebration
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description: Join us for this annual and joyous event - carol singing with the Resonance Choir, led by Simon Christie. Resonance is an all-comers choir formed in 2007 by a group of parents from Kelburn Normal School. The choir has grown to around 60 members and is now based in Karori. It includes members from across Wellington. Our aim is to enjoy singing and have fun. Resonance sings a wide range of repertoire in SATB which includes classical, choral, popular and world music. Our St Andrew’s concert will include much loved and popular Christmas Carols to kick the festive season off! Audience participation is welcome!

events.id: Chinese footprints: A walking tour of Chinese Wellington history-126 Vivian Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Chinese footprints: A walking tour of Chinese Wellington history
events.venue: 126 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Oral History Advisor Lynette Shum on a walking tour exploring the rich history of the Chinese in Wellington. The tour will also draw on images, ephemera, and oral history from the collections of the Alexander Turnbull Library.
Sites of significance for early Chinese communities
Chinese footprints, led by Lynette Shum (Oral History Advisor, National Library New Zealand), will take attendees on a walking tour exploring the rich history of the Chinese in Wellington.
This two-hour tour highlights sites of significance for Wellington’s early Chinese community, including businesses, eateries, and Haining Street’s ‘Chinatown’. Much of this has been erased and is now largely invisible to passers-by. The tour will also draw on images, ephemera, and oral history from the Alexander Turnbull Library's collections.
The tour starts at the Wellington Trades’ Hall Building (124-128 Vivian Street) with a brief introduction, and concludes there with a pot of Chinese tea.
A koha of $10 is suggested to help cover the cost of running the tours.
*** RSVP now for your spot — Spots are limited, so book your place now by emailing ATLOutreach@dia.govt.nz ***
About the speakers
Lynette Shum, third-generation Poon Yue Chinese New Zealander, is Oral History Advisor for the National Library of New Zealand. Her first home was on the fringes of Chinatown, yet she was unaware of its existence until researching what would become the Haining Street Oral History Project. She has completed an MA on the topic.
Image: Poon Fah Association, Wellington. Photo by Lynette Shum.

events.long_description:
The Scale of Mean IPA is BACK! After winning Malthouse's 2025 West Coast IPA Challenge, our first batch of The Scale of Mean VERY quickly quaffed by you old school hopheads.
This is your chance to experience why it was judged the best of 35 WCIPAs, so be there on day one to make sure you don't miss out again!
Best of all, if you're not in Wellington you can order 440mL cans online! https://www.meandoses.co.nz/shop
Hops: Columbus, Mosaic, Simcoe
Malts: Ale, Lager, Munich, Supernova
When the End comes there shall be a reckoning. All will be counted, all will be weighed.
Every film you hearted on Letterboxd. Every Gram you have shared. Every joke you have ever retweeted, every video where you smashed "like" or "subscribe". Every Untappd review you have written, whether it be written in haste, or in distemper, or in earnest consideration.
All will be counted, in this Greatest of Reckons.
All will be weighed.

events.name: Christmas at Katherine Mansfield House & Garden
events.venue: 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get into the festive spirit with a guided tour of Katherine Mansfield House & Garden that highlights Victorian Christmas traditions and Katherine Mansfield’s own love of Christmas.
The tour will be followed by a performance of some Christmas favourites by members of the Wellington City Chorus while you enjoy a glass of Hunter’s Wines MiruMiru (or non-alcoholic option) and nibbles. Our small but carefully curated giftshop might also provide some gift inspiration!
“I hope you have a happy Christmas and Joy in the New Year, real, real Joy.” – Katherine Mansfield in a letter to Dorothy Brett, 1919
Tickets $30 / $25, book via the Katherine Mansfield House & Garden website

events.id: Harcourt Park spring league (Santioned)-49 Akatarawa Road, Porirua-Facebook
events.name: Harcourt Park spring league (Santioned)
events.venue: 49 Akatarawa Road, Porirua
events.long_description:
Spring League at Harcourt park is returning
Mark Wednesday the 29th October - 17 December 2025 on the calender, as this is the start of the next PDGA sanctioned league at Harcourt park, Upper Hutt brought to you by the Greater Wellington Disc Golf Club.
The league will be for 8 weeks til 5th and offer divisions by PDGA rating. If you don’t have a rating TD will assign you to a ratings group based on level of skill and experience.
Costs for the league is preferred to pay in advance or at first round and priorty will go to club members if the league reaches greater than 45 participants.
League Entry Fee:
$10 for Greater Wellington disc golf club members
$20 for Non club member (required to pay in advance of league or on first day of play).
$5 for casual play (required to pay on day of round).
League fees can be paid in cash on the night or direct into the club league account (preferred). Please use Spring25 & your last name as reference.
Kiwi Bank: 38-9016-0650973-03
Prizes - Divisional Winners will receive braging rights, two prizes will be provided to the 2 participants that shoot the most points above their rating in a single round (every one has a change at taking this one out)
Also there will be an optional extra jackpotting ace kitty. For the league. How to enter - gold coin entry each week. To be in the running for the week need to have paid in. Eg so week one pay $1 and in if hit an ace, week 2 not pay in therefore no entry into ace kitty, week 3 pay into ace kitty. Hit an ace week 2 can’t claim the kitty as did not pay in, hit an ace week 3 collect the ace kitty (shared if others also hit an ace that week).
You say what happens if no one hits an ace - keeps jackpotting throughout the clubs PDGA sanctioned leagues until an ACE is hit.
Current ACE Kitty sitting at $xxx

events.id: The Man Whose Mother Was A Pirate - The Musical-Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Man Whose Mother Was A Pirate - The Musical
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Man Whose Mother was a Pirate – The Musical is a brand-new musical theatre voyage, with songs and sea-shanties crafted by Te Whanganui-a-tara’s own Nino Raphael. Inspired by Margaret Mahy’s much-loved children’s tale and authorised by the author’s estate, this rollicking production breathes new wind and adventure into one of Aotearoa’s favourite stories.

“I would fight off crews of pirates to watch it again.” -Regional News

Landing at the Hannah Playhouse this December, the production marks the debut season of this high-spirited show right here in Wellington. Sure to have the young and young-at-heart singing along, The Man Whose Mother was a Pirate – The Musical promises swashbuckling fun wrapped up with a heartfelt message.

Tickets go on sale this September - don’t miss out on a seat upon the maiden voyage of this sure-fire hit!

“A perfect treat for kids who want an evening of joyous pirate-y entertainment.” -Wellyott

“Rambunctious chaos across the high seas” -Theatreview

events.id: DJ NOIZ, KENNYON BROWN & DONELL LEWIS live in Wellington-Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: DJ NOIZ, KENNYON BROWN & DONELL LEWIS live in Wellington
events.venue: Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
FutureNow Presents
DJ NOIZ
KENNYON BROWN
DONELL LEWIS
Live in Wellington
Wednesday 10 December 2025
San Fran
Supported by
J.Tajor
A.R.T
This December, DJ Noiz, Kennyon Brown and Donell Lewis bring their signature island sound for a long-awaited New Zealand tour, hitting Wellington, Rotorua, Auckland and Hamilton. Known for hit records 'Senorita', 'Chill', 'Amelia', 'Island Girl' and more, the trio have become global ambassadors of modern Pacific R&B — blending smooth vocals, island grooves and soulful production that’s earned them millions of streams and loyal fans worldwide.
Joining them on the road is special guest and viral superstar J.Tajor known for his hit record ‘Like I Do’. Together, they promise an unforgettable celebration of Pacific music, culture and connection — a summer tour that captures the soul of the islands.
Buy tickets via futurenowmusic.com
Doors 7pm • 18+ Only • ID Required
171 Cuba Street, Wellington 6011

events.name: Distilled Comedy
events.venue: The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Distilled Comedy at The Bond Store, the home of "The Jar" is back for October.

12 comedians from far and wide will be putting their name in the jar and you, the audience, will get to pick at random who is up next.

5 minutes of hilarity will follow and then it's back to the jar to find out who is next.

A 10 minute ask the comedians anything will round the night off ... will it be a cacophony of laughter or a car crash ... that's the fun.

So grab your mates, buy your tickets and book a table. Come early for some great food and cocktails.

The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!
Join us for a creative evening of drinking
and painting
in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!
Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

events.id: WellyForge#6, 10th Dec 2025 (Christmas Edition)-118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: WellyForge#6, 10th Dec 2025 (Christmas Edition)
events.venue: 118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up. The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
Focus of the night is the KiwiNet award winners who are from Wellington. KiwiNet funds the commercialization of public research across 19 universities in NZ. So, your show will be:
1st Speaker: Dr Ben Mallett from the MacDiarmid and Robinson Research Institute (part of Victoria) who won the Breakthrough Innovator Award, and is a co-founder of JxB Space Systems.
Quickfire Speakers:
Maci Libby, Massey Design Graduate, founder of Wise Gear NZ, passionate about outdoor adventure
Suse Reynolds, KiwiNet Commercialization Icon Award Winner, and big start-up fan (investor & Director)
Lachlan Mead, Young Enterprise Scheme Award Winner, and founder of the Christmas Chaos card-game, yes, copies will be available!
2nd Speakers: Prof Rob Weinkove who leads the Malaghan Institute's CAR-T cell program which won the KiwiNet PwC Breakthrough Project Award, and John Robson CEO of BioOra, a spin-out from the Malaghan which recently raised $15m to accelerate roll-out of its cancer treatment.
The venue is bohemian bookstore, Undercurrent, a perfect venue for story telling but tickets are limited - so please reserve yours, but if you do end up not being able to come please return the ticket!
Join WellyForge

events.id: Climbing Film Tour 2025 - Wellington-205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Climbing Film Tour 2025 - Wellington
events.venue: 205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
NEW DATE DEC 10th
———
NZAC Wellington is partnering with Vertical Life to bring you the annual Climbing Film Tour screening:
The Climbing Film Tour is back for its 6th season, featuring an impressive selection of short films that celebrate the global climbing community.
The Climbing Film Tour is a unique platform that allows climbers and filmmakers from around the world to share their stories with the community. Each year, films are submitted and selected by our Vertical Life climbing team to go on tour with screenings in hundreds of gyms, cinemas and other locations around the world. Films may vary between screenings.
The films are exempt from classification as sports documentaries, but are suitable for general audience viewing.
A huge thank you to our 2025 Tour Partners for their incredible support in making this tour possible: Wild Earth, Petzl, Scarpa, Nalgene, Arc'teryx, Cotopaxi, Suunto, Capital Brewing, The Crag and Vertical Life Magazine.
