events.id: Sunset Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Sunset Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking

events.id: Not Christmas, but Guy Fawkes-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Not Christmas, but Guy Fawkes
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A theatrical double-shot from an iconic playwright and one of our greatest actors.

Bruce Mason is perhaps the most significant playwright in Aotearoa New Zealand’s theatrical history. Writing with courage and insight, he was a lover of language and a champion of the underdog.

Between 1959 and 1978, Bruce toured the country, telling uniquely Kiwi stories about emerging identity, cultural cringe and social difference. From church halls to country shearing sheds to the Edinburgh Festival, Bruce would play anywhere, in any circumstance, to any audience.

To celebrate his extraordinary legacy, Brilliant Adventures and Circa Theatre are collaborating to make two of his greatest solo works resound for a new age.

Two plays: timeless, universal, distinct. Following their critically acclaimed, sold out run of THINGS I KNOW TO BE TRUE, actor Stephen Lovatt and director Shane Bosher return to Circa for a not-to-be missed theatrical encounter with a master craftsman.


THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER
“I invite you to join me, in a voyage into the past, to that territory of the heart we call childhood.”

Bruce Mason’s quintessential Kiwi classic chronicles the friendship between a 12-year-old boy and Firpo, a social outcast who dreams of winning an Olympic medal.

Through the boy’s eyes we see the wonder of life on a perfect beach, in a perfect 1930s New Zealand, during a perfect summer. It’s a world of magic and transformation, where anything can happen and miracles seem possible.

When the boy sets out to help Firpo make his athletic dream a reality, ignoring his father’s rebukes and community ridicule, a battle rages between the eternal optimism of childhood and the harsh pragmatism of adulthood.

Gliding effortlessly between flights of poetic fancy and blunt everyday speech, THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER is New Zealand storytelling at its very best.


NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES
An adolescent boy tries to find his place in an adult-dominated world. A young man retraces an intensely felt boyhood experience of bullying. A playwright in his last days reconciles the value of an artistic life and challenges the idea of New Zealand identity.

Comic disasters and confronting your own hubris. NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES is a richly autobiographical search for self-expression. Profound and true, it is a set of variations about over-reaching, cheekily confronting our very own Tall Poppy Syndrome.

Celebrating Bruce Mason
Directed by Shane Bosher
Performed by Stephen Lovatt

Please note The End of the Golden Weather and Not Christmas, but Guy Fawkes tickets need to be purchases separately, see the Circa Theatre website for full dates and ticket details.

Papakowhai School End of Year BBQ
NEW DATE DUE TO WEATHER: 11 Dec. All scheduled timings will remain the same except for the performances – unfortunately these will not be taking place on this new date. We have re-opened Kindo so you can pre-purchase food for those that can now come on 11th. Pre-orders now close at midnight on 9 Dec. Our annual end-of-year celebration is even bigger and better this year. Join us for an evening of food, fun, and entertainment.

events.name: Young Photographer Award 2025
events.venue: Lower Hutt Little Theatre,2 Queens Drive, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Young Photographer Award 2025
On 11 December I invite you to join us for the first ever Young Photographer Award 2025 in Aotearoa! It will take place right here in Wellington, in Lower Hutt.

The event is free and you can RSVP here ->
https://events.humanitix.com/young-photographer-award-2025

At The Art of Seeing Academy we run photography workshops for kids aged 7 to 18 with our wonderful tutors and volunteers. Since 2023 we have run more than 80 workshops across weekends, schools, homeschool groups, after school sessions and private groups. More than 180 kids have joined us and many now see photography as part of their everyday life!

We could not be prouder of their creativity, effort and talent. This awards night is our way of honouring them and creating a moment they will remember. We will also have fantastic speakers sharing their journeys, careers and inspiration in photography.

We would love you to join us, support the kids and share in a night filled with creativity, joy and inspiration. 💖

The event is brought to live thanks to the support from Hutt City Council and local businesses and communities. 💖

events.id: The Control Room by The Carpark Society-145 Victoria St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: The Control Room by The Carpark Society
events.venue: 145 Victoria St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Control Room is the Phase Zero Rupture of The Car Park Society. It is a modest urban tenancy that functions as both public portal and member hub, seeding the Watcher Network and testing prototypes.
APOLOGIES THIS EVENT DOES NOT RUN ON THURSDAYS AS MENTIONED HERE...
The Car Park Society is about reclaiming forgotten or overlooked spaces, places where histories have been buried or distorted. The public are invited to interact with the four public activations in the central Te Aro location, uncovering these complex layers of our history. Join a stream of internal wānanga, using low-resource but high-impact methods - projection, sound, QR glyphs, symbolic ritual acts.
Activation 1 – 31 Oct: The First Rupture: The Exchange Projection overlays of colonial maps and glyphs. QR glyphs unlock File #1. “The burial is broken. You are observed.”
Activation 2 – 14 Nov: The Battle Archive: Manners St 1846 Projection overlays of “riot vs refusal.” Soundscape of haka, musket fire, colonial orders dissolving into static. QR glyphs unlock File #2. Oracle declares: “They called it riot. We call it refusal.”
Activation 3 – 28 Nov: The Drowned File: Reclaimed Land Projection of lost shoreline. Soundscape: waves + Harbour Board minutes. QR glyphs unlock File #3. “The sea still waits beneath. You are reclaimed.”
Activation 4 – 12 Dec: The Veins Beneath: Te Aro Pā / Waimapihi Projection of rippling water textures. Soundscape: awa + glitch static. QR glyphs unlock File #4. Oracle: “Ko te awa ahau. Ko te awa ko au. The memory flows.”

events.id: Thoughts That Make Us Think – Hugo Van Dorsser and Catarina Correia Arnhold-26 Constable St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Thoughts That Make Us Think – Hugo Van Dorsser and Catarina Correia Arnhold
events.venue: 26 Constable St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Twentysix is pleased to present the last show of the year by Ōtautahi based artist couple Hugo Van Dorsser and Catarina Correia Arnhold. With a sense of play and punchy, evocative colour at the centre - ‘Thoughts That Make Us Think’ is a meeting of material worlds. Gallery walls are met with a bold expression of life and an unapologetic exploration into how the artists’ materials can perform on behalf of their intuition and imagination. At times looking back in nostalgia, while others look inward toward the spirit and self.
Van Dorsser works, predominately in oil paint, in thick strokes. Drawn with a confident hand in building block shapes, he references childhood with toy cars and little houses, as well as employing the symbol of the butterfly to explore hope and change - all collaged together with a blurry face hidden at the side. They are dreamlike, the surreal spelt out with each canvas, Van Dorsser piecing together - and thus inviting his viewers - into an emotional landscape of shared nostalgia.
Correia Arnhold’s gritty clay shapes are a visualisation of emotion - created quickly, roughly - following her at the height of feeling. Spanning both three dimensional and wall bound, each piece is an exploration of the artist’s central symbols of the subconscious, religion and memory. Rough clay is layered in glossy, bright pastel glazes, set against deep, matte finishes - working in juxtaposition to expose conflicting narratives. Her use of the lone rider, priests, a crowd and holy figures throughout, asks of reality versus imagination, sentimentality versus fantasy, day to day versus the preternatural. An ongoing balance between a welcomed freedom of material and a language of myth, memory, and personal narrative.
The two artists sidestep together into a landscape of play. Testing boundary lines between material and reality, between fantasy and a blurred memory - all lit in vivid colour. ‘Thoughts That Make Us Think’ asks us to pace along after them, indulged in their two worlds.
Join us for the opening celebration on Friday, 28 November at 6pm – both artists will be present.
The exhibition runs from 29 November – 20 December 2025 at Twentysix Gallery.
Opening Hours:
Thursday 12pm - 6pm
Friday 12pm - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 4pm
Or by appointment

Twentysix is pleased to present the last show of the year by Ōtautahi based artist couple Hugo Van Dorsser and Catarina Correia Arnhold.
With a sense of play and punchy, evocative colour at the centre - ‘Thoughts That Make Us Think’ is a meeting of material worlds.
At times looking back in nostalgia, while others look inward toward the spirit and self.
The two artists sidestep together into a landscape of play.
Join us for the opening celebration on Friday, 28 November at 6pm – both artists will be present.

events.id: Young Photographer Award 2025-2 Queens Drive, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Young Photographer Award 2025
events.venue: 2 Queens Drive, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for an evening of inspiration, creativity and photography
Join us for the inaugural Young Photographer Award, the first event of its kind in New Zealand celebrating young creative talent aged 7 to 18.
Over the past year we have run more than 80 workshops and inspired over 180 kids to try photography. Many arrived with no previous experience and discovered a new way to express themselves. Some even chose photography as their future career. Our workshops are fully inclusive and also support kids who may need extra learning help, giving them a space to slow down, focus and build confidence through creativity.
Held in Lower Hutt, Wellington, this evening is all about creativity, wonder and community. Students who took part in our photography workshops will have their work displayed at the event, and our nominated young photographers will receive special awards recognising their talent, effort and unique way of seeing the world.
A creative evening for everyone
The event will be inspiring not only for young photographers but also for adults, families and anyone who loves creativity and photography. It is a great chance to support young talent, enjoy beautiful images and be part of a welcoming creative community.
Bring your friends and whānau. The more support we show our young photographers, the more their creativity shines and inspires others.
Guest speakers
We are excited to welcome two inspiring speakers:
Tushar Sharma

Landscape and nature photographer, conservationist and founder of IMAGEn8, an Auckland-based charity offering photography workshops for kids. Tushar’s work focuses on connecting young people with the natural world through the lens.
Chris McKeown

Chris is a Wellington photographer whose images have been nominated for multiple awards and published widely. His work appears in calendars, fine art prints, canvases and magazines. His photos are also licensed for annual reports, websites, branding, headshots and large public-space murals. Chris photographs events, family gatherings, performances, sporting events and weddings, bringing a warm and thoughtful approach to every project.

Etanah Lalau Talapa

The evening will open with a talk by Etanah Lalau Talapa, a multi-disciplinary artist and curator of Afega and Sa’anapu heritage from Samoa. Etanah holds a Bachelor of Design in Spatial Design from the College of Creative Arts at Massey University. Her work spans public installations, digital art, mixed media and photography. She often explores themes of motherhood, family lineage and the lived experiences of the Pacific diaspora in Aotearoa. Her practice focuses on discovering new visual languages that connect traditional and contemporary creative forms while honouring her Samoan cultural heritage.


Chris McKeown

Chris is a Wellington photographer whose work has been nominated for multiple awards and published widely. His work appears in calendars, prints, magazines, exhibitions, and large murals at Wellington Hospital, and he shoots the night sky, landscapes, and performance events. By day he is an executive, leadership mentor, and public speaker, with a passionate belief in compassionate leadership. Chris will share his journey to realising that slowing down and looking up can shift how we feel, think, and see the world and each other.


Miro Kennett

Miro Kennett (she/her) is a teen underwater photographer from Aotearoa NZ. Her work centres on capturing the underwater world and our connection to it. She spends most of her time photographing in Te Whanganui a Tara at Taputeranga Marine Reserve, exploring the coast and noticing how the ocean shifts each day. She has also captured images in the Poor Knights and Fiji. Through her photography she aims to share the beauty and life beneath the surface and inspire others to care for our marine environments.


Gareth Davies

Originally from Gloucester in the UK, Gareth has been passionate about photography since borrowing his grandparents’ Kodak film camera as a kid. He trained as a darkroom tech and photographer in the Royal Air Force, later becoming a photography instructor. After moving to Aotearoa, he went on to spend many years teaching forensic photography with NZ Police. Gareth now spends his spare time exploring Kapiti’s beaches and marine reserves, sharing his love of photography with anyone keen to learn.
events.description:
Students who took part in our photography workshops will have their work displayed at the event, and our nominated young photographers will receive special awards recognising their talent, effort and unique way of seeing the world.
It is a great chance to support young talent, enjoy beautiful images and be part of a welcoming creative community.
The more support we show our young photographers, the more their creativity shines and inspires others.
After moving to Aotearoa, he went on to spend many years teaching forensic photography with NZ Police.
Gareth now spends his spare time exploring Kapiti’s beaches and marine reserves, sharing his love of photography with anyone keen to learn.

events.id: Neural Calm Reset: Tapping for Your Nervous System-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Neural Calm Reset: Tapping for Your Nervous System
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
If moments of calm slip away as the day goes on, this workshop is designed to change that.

You’ll discover how to take control of your nervous system and cultivate a calm state that feels natural — all through a clear, 3-step framework.

This is not mindfulness. But a practice drawing on principles of memory biology and cognitive reconsolidation to help you interrupt stress signals at their source - the meaning level, where your nervous system responds to life’s challenges.

Calm becomes repeatable, a reliable part of everyday life.

You’ll walk away with a simple, 15-minute daily sequence built around three key steps:

* Tapping to deactivate the stress signal — a gentle, evidence-based technique to reset your nervous system.

* Bright-Side Rewrite Journal — shift your perspective and build empowering mental patterns.

* Inner Dialogue Reframe — transform the way you talk to yourself, supporting lasting calm and clarity.

Plus - your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert

Meet Krishnaloka, your host

Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and psychology. As a mind technician trained in autaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

events.id: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Take an evening to slow down and reconnect. This session weaves together the meditative stillness of yin yoga with the restorative vibrations of sound healing — an immersive experience that invites both body and mind to unwind.

Through long-held yin postures, you’ll be guided to soften rather than strive, creating gentle openings and space for deeper release. The live sound journey adds another layer — resonant frequencies that ripple through the body, calming the nervous system and encouraging inner stillness.

Emma offers a trauma-informed yin practice grounded in compassion and self-awareness, drawing on her own personal growth and understanding of what it means to truly rest. Paired with Alex’s soundscapes, the evening becomes a tender exploration of presence and renewal.

We’ll close with a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert — a simple way to share warmth, grounding, and connection after the practice.

All levels are welcome.

Meet Emma, your yoga teacher
Emma holds a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga teacher certification, blending her corporate experience with a deep understanding of self-care. Emma's classes are designed to help create a safe space where you can relax and connect with your body. Her approach to teaching yin is purposeful, driven by a strong desire to empower students through mindful and compassionate practices. Her journey is rooted in self-growth and connection, with a strong focus on nourishing the body as an essential part of this.

Meet Alex, your sound healer
Alex is a sound healing practitioner devoted to nurturing healing in both mind and body. She believes that sound vibration holds the power to expand consciousness and restore harmony and balance in our lives. Her journey into sound healing began with the realization of how deeply sound vibration was affecting her psyche—making her more mindful of the music she listens to and the intention it carries. Along the way, she has drawn inspiration from artists such as Deva Premal, The Flying Mystics, Stevin McNamara, and the Bhakti Lounge Kirtan. Their music has profoundly influenced her own sound healing practice, inspiring her to explore sound as a tool for transformation, connection, and inner peace.

events.id: Dungeons and Dickens: A Crit'mas Carol-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Dungeons and Dickens: A Crit'mas Carol
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
Bah, Humbug!

For better or for worse, the holidays are upon us, and this year the Last In Initiative team is making a list and checking it twice.

Join your fellow naughty listers for three nights of very merry mischief, magic, and mayhem.

Each night brings new antics as our four festive adventurers encounter ghostly apparitions, search for the perfect gift, and maybe, just maybe, warm their cold, cold hearts as they learn the true meaning of Christmas... the non-denominational, apolitical, Christmas-coded holidays.

So, don’t be a Scrooge.

Grab your dice, don your gay apparel, and shake off any festive blues.

Your DnD game might be on holiday hiatus, but for these elves, the rolls never stop.

Merry Crit’mas to all, and to all a good night!

events.id: Capital Blues Presents: Jamie and the Numbers-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: Jamie and the Numbers
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jamie and the Numbers are a Wellington soul‑funk outfit fronted by powerhouse vocalist Jamie Musuvā.
What began as a one‑off recording project quickly grew into a passion for Northern Soul, funk, and inventive covers, all delivered in their own unapologetically loud and soulful style. The band mixes original songs with cleverly re‑imagined classics, drawing praise for their debut album and earning airplay across New Zealand and even the BBC. With Jamie’s voice and a tight line‑up featuring Elliott Fuimaono and the Lerwill brothers, their live shows are renowned for energy, groove, and connection. Collaborations with producer Lee Prebble at The Surgery Studios and releases through Deltaphonic Records have cemented their reputation as one of Wellington’s most compelling soul‑funk acts.
It’s hard to describe how good this band is. You will just have to come and find out.

events.id: Diabetes NZ: Connect with Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth (Marlborough)-22 Queen Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Diabetes NZ: Connect with Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth (Marlborough)
events.venue: 22 Queen Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
An evening for everyone in Marlborough living with type 1 diabetes: Let’s connect, share ideas, and build our community.
Join Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth for a relaxed and friendly evening, supported by the Diabetes Nursing Team, open to all people in Marlborough living with type 1 diabetes - children, teens, young adults, and adults.
Whether you or your child is newly diagnosed or you’ve been navigating type 1 diabetes for years, we’d love to meet you.
Parents, carers, spouses, and other support people are welcome to attend alongside those living with type 1 diabetes.
We’ll chat about what Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth offers including social events, peer connections, and support for the whole family. Meet together with others at the Health Hub, with our Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth & Type 1 Coordinator joining online via Teams.
This is a great opportunity to talk about the kinds of activities or support you’d like to see and how we can work together.
Have questions? Email amanda@diabetes.org.nz.

Northern Soulsters Jamie and the Numbers have wowed audiences around New Zealand. They have even been discovered by the BBC and played on their Funk and Soul Show!

Jamie, the singer, is an outstanding performer, and what a voice! She’s backed by a fabulous band.

They released a tremendous album in 2022. Can you imagine a soul version of The Seeker by The Who? It’s incredible. The band will be worth seeing for that tune alone.

And when they do “The Letter” (the Joe Cocker hit), it’s simply astonishing.

It’s hard to describe how good this band is. You will have to come and find out.

Tickets are $20 or $10 for members.
Dec 11th, 7pm. The Underworld Tavern, Pirie St.

events.id: The Hectet - Live And In Performance-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: The Hectet - Live And In Performance
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Hectet bring you a night of melodious and grooving electroacoustic jazz music, to celebrate the release of their debut album, Here Comes The Hectet, off the back of their recent Australian album release tour.

They will also be playing unreleased selections from their recently recorded follow-up album, French Politics, across two sets of original compositions by Hector McLachlan. The music of The Hectet draws from a wide pool of influences, reflecting an open and ambivalent attitude to genre that has given it a unique and broad appeal.

Hector (piano, synth) is a pianist and composer from Te Whanganui-a-Tara who has played across Aotearoa and the world with acts like Revulva, Salvia Palth, Rachel Andie, The Unknot, and The Teskey Brothers. He has also released an album of electronic music on US cassette label Become Eternal.

Joining him are three Pōneke demons: Phoebe Johnson (double bass), Jasper Holloway (guitar), and Abe Baillie (drums), as well as very special guest Lily Shaw (saxophone).

The Hectet aims to please, and they can't wait share their soulful and expressive stylings with you.

events.id: Henry Sherris Quintet-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Henry Sherris Quintet
events.venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Catch the Henry Sherris Quintet as they bring to life a set showcasing all original works, plus a few reimagined standards. Led by trumpet and alto, the group features Henry and Nicholas—musical partners since high school—alongside a fantastic rhythm section to perform a varied night of music from high-energy, bebop-inspired tunes to introspective ballads.

The compositions were first shaped during Henry’s time studying in New York, but have continued to evolve and grow as the band lends unique blend of swing, lyricism, and improvisation.

Featuring: Henry Sherris (trumpet), Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell (alto sax), Ayrton Foote (piano), Hikurangi Schaverien Kaa, (drums), Elijah Mulheron (bass).

events.id: KITA - Love Lives Here **revival + OHIMESAMA BREAKS-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: KITA - Love Lives Here **revival + OHIMESAMA BREAKS
events.venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
KITA 
Bass-heavy psych-pop

- KITA - lands on MOON for the first time in a few years, with live projection from Lucy Mila, and lights from The Doc Cave-Lynch! opening + closing BY OHIMESAMA BREAKS! Punctual departure, don't miss the take-off. A preview of their TWISTED FREQUENCY show.

8pm Doors / Opening by OHIMESAMA BREAKS
8:45pm - KITA -
10:15 Closing by OHIMESAMA BREAKS

Since releasing and touring their LOVE LIVES HERE EP in late 2023, the last two years have seen front-woman Nikita Tu-Bryant shoot and wrap her debut film featuring - KITA -
This summer, they are reviving their LOVE LIVES HERE Tour show with some added spice** in anticipation of their upcoming release of Tu-Bryant’s film.
Inspired by their EP LOVE LIVES HERE, the trilingual art-house film [ LOVE LIVES HERE ] is to be screened in 2026 on the film festival circuit around the globe.

Melding inspirations of folk, soul and psychedelia with the guitar and spirited storytelling of musician-actor Nikita Tu-Bryant (Avatar 2, Far North TV Series); the thick lushness of Moog bass synth and Fender Rhodes from Ed Zuccollo (Zuke); and the filthy drive and barking drums of Rick Cranson (Little Bushman) - KITA - have long-since solidified themselves as a must-see live band with a massive sound.
Over the years, you may have seen - KITA - main-stage with sets at SPLORE and WOMAD to the Wairarapa coasts at Tora Bombora and 121 Festival. Since their inception - KITA - have released 2 EPs and a debut album produced by Grammy-award winning Italian producer Tommaso Colliva (MUSE, RAZORLIGHT).

“ • KITA • are a vision straight from a synth-pop dream…the self-titled album • KITA • is a masterpiece ” - Muzic.net.nz

“To experience a • KITA • gig is to witness a stellar example of 3 strong musical identities ... fusing together to create a synergy and oneness unparalleled on the scene today.”
— Adam Page (WizardTone Studios AUSTRALIA)

The upcoming film is to be translated for a live cinema-stage show in late 2026 featuring live music from • KITA • playing a whole new original soundtrack, alongside a chorus of performers that echo the action and music on screen.

“ • KITA • have firmly established a reputation for their exceptional live performances, and their ability to connect people through music and storytelling.” - Ambient Light

events.name: Make friends & BlaBla Language Exchange Wellington - Every other Thursday - Recurrent event
events.venue: 8 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Meet new people - Make international and local friends - Speak languages (mingle) - Have fun

................
Any question or request? Reach out to us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/blablalanguage
................
Join Our BlaBla Whatsapp Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/LFeNVmzCnaG1BrHYpgBnqU
................
Stay updated via our Telegram channel: https://t.me/+n6e00r9ByRw0MmNk
................
Some guidelines for a delightful experience:
-
Our events are GRATIS, we will not charge you anything but You are asked to order a drink directly upon arrival to participate
(Mandatory).
-
Outside food and drinks are not allowed.
-
Please respect the venues staff and make sure to leave the place clean and tidy before you leave.
-
Be polite and respectful.
Please kindly note that venue staff or our organizers will ban you from our events and community without any warning if you don't respect it. We offer you opportunities to make friends and improve your language skills for free. Be nice enough to make things easy for us.
................
How it's working:
We are working with a mingle setup and we usually don't have designated language tables or areas.
English and the local language are typically spoken.
If you would like to speak other languages, please ask the organizers or seek participants who meet your language expectations.
................
Things to keep in mind before joining:
-
By attending our events, you consent to being photographed or filmed. Photos and videos taken during the events will be shared on our social media. If you do not wish to appear in the photos, please send us a private message as soon as possible on Instagram (@blablalanguage).
-
Remember to keep an eye on your belongings and prioritize your own well-being. We are not responsible for any lost items or personal issues.
................
/
Make a Difference with BlaBla: Volunteer as an Event Organizer (volunteering)!
These gatherings are brought to you by BlaBla Language Exchange, spanning over 150 cities across 5 continents. We are always looking for new organizers. More information and application here: https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/event-organizers
................
/
Share your photography / video skills: Volunteer as photographer (volunteering)!
Are you a photo virtuoso or a video wizard?
Whether you're a pro or a passionate newbie, we want YOU!
No cash, but lots of laughs and fame (well, sort of). We'll even give you a virtual high-five!

Presented by: Banished Music "[Nadia] embraces a full-bodied sound halfway between Haim’s sophisticated pop sparkle and Sharon Van Etten’s full-throated songcraft" — The Guardian This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.
“There’s a questing robustness to these songs, a sense of somebody finally having the perspective to seek out answers to long-hanging questions.” ★★★★ — MOJO Enter Now feels different.
It is an album, she says, of departure and questioning, that has reminded her how songwriting can be “the most useful thing to do with pain and joy and thoughts and feelings and anger.” That through music we can find great change.
“I’m so much better off now that it exists,” she says.
“Now feels like a new time.”

events.long_description:
Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast
Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.


Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Kapiti Coast to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.


So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want.


Contact Meredith Dyer for more information:
| 027 808 3947

events.name: Kiwi Christmas in Battle Hill
events.venue: Battle Hill Farm Forest Park,Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kiwi Christmas in Battle Hill
🎄🎄Celebrate the season at Battle Hill Regional Park – Christmas carols and movie night in the park 🎄🎄

Gather the whānau and head to Battle Hill Regional Park for a magical evening of festive fun on the farm.

Join us for Nick Tansley’s Pop Up Carols Caravan, bringing joyful live music to the park.

Stay later for a screening of the movie Kiwi Christmas on the big screen—a funny, whānau-friendly movie about Santa turning up for a summer holiday as far away from the North Pole as possible – Aotearoa!

Carols: 5.30pm - 6.30pm

Movie: 6.30pm - 8pm

Warm up with marshmallow toasting and grab a bite from the Riding for the Disabled fundraising food stall (cash only). If conditions allow, join a guided walk to see glow worms later that night.

Why not make a weekend of it? Come camp at the Battle Hill campground and enjoy everything the park has to offer—from swimming holes and forest walks to peaceful picnic spots and farm animals.

Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Battle Hill Farm Forest Park is more than just a beautiful place—it’s a hub for ecological restoration and history. Greater Wellington’s work here restores native bush, showcases farm animals for children, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our mana whenua partners, farmers, and volunteers play a vital role in keeping this park a special place for everyone.

events.name: A Very Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas
events.venue: Abandoned Petone,38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
A Very Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas
NAUTICAL GAMES /// BEST DRESSED PRIZES /// SINGALONG SHANTIES /// XMAS-TYPE STUFF

Your work Xmas-party is going to be lame or cancelled so put a 2-dollar shop Santa's hat on 2025 and have a sing with Aotearoa's Most Seaworthy Shanty crew.

Prepare to be hit by a wave of joy and merriment as the Full Wellington Sea Shanty Society Experience transform the Abandoned Taproom into a shanty wonderland.

We got shanty booklets for all ye faithful and merch for Xmas presents.

If there's one thing we can all agree on in this country, it's that Xmas needs more sea shanties!

Only Te Upoko o te Ika show for 2025. New EP out in March 2026.

🎅🎅🎅

WELLINGTON SEA SHANTY SOCIETY

Aotearoa New Zealand's Most 'Sea Worthy' Shanty Group™ have been belting out traditional and original sea songs from Aotearoa, France, Spain, the UK and more, since time immemorial (2012).

The W.S.S.S have toured Aotearoa and France multiple times and are known for their rowdy and participatory live shows. They've performed at Paimpol (one of the world's largest shanty festivals), Splore, Albany Folk Festival (Aus), Quebec Sea Shanty Festival (Canada) and a shipload of other festivals in NZ, France & Canada. Their new EP 'Sea Shanties of the 70s, 80s, & Today!' has just recently surfaced to complement their 'Now That's What I Call Sea Shanties' series. Another must-listen is 'Ahoy!' - a French/English album made with Nantes amis Croche Dedans.

Also check out other Festivals in Lower Hutt.

events.name: JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 2
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 2
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

Sesssion - 7pm -8.30pm on Fridays
in 2025 - 28/11, 12/12,
in 2026 - 30/1, 13/2. 27/2, 14/3, 28/3

events.long_description:
Nadia Reid - Enter Now Brightness Tour - Wellington
"[Nadia] embraces a full-bodied sound halfway between Haim’s sophisticated pop sparkle and Sharon Van Etten’s full-throated songcraft" - The Guardian

This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.

Presale 10am (NZST), Wednesday 16th April
General on sale 10am (NZST), Friday 18th April
Register for presale at banishedmusic.com/subscribe

The Manchester-based expatriate New Zealander is known for her ruminative and well-crafted folk-inflected songwriting, and with Enter Now Brightness she presents a record of poise and great beauty, the sound of a cellular shift, of pain giving way to tenderness and joy.

events.long_description:
Vox Ethno
The Undercurrent presents Vox Ethno!

Vox Ethno has evolved out of a small but strong civic Serbian choir, Vox Serbica, from 2002. “Born” in 2019, Vox Ethno has 12 members – a six-voice female vocal group with a five-piece band under the steady musical and artistic direction of Mima Nikolić.

The band performs traditional (ethno) folk music from the Balkans and Europe in both à capella and accompanied formats. We perform mostly original arrangements of traditional (ethno) folk music from the Balkans and across Europe.

Join us for an unforgettable night of fiery Balkan folk music dancing, laughing and singing

Friday 12th Dec
Doors open 7:30pm
Gig at 8pm
$20

events.id: Toi kōrero / curator talk: Jasmine Arthur and Te Rauparaha Horomona-PATAKA Art + Museum, Cnr Parumoana and Norrie St, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Toi kōrero / curator talk: Jasmine Arthur and Te Rauparaha Horomona
events.venue: PATAKA Art + Museum, Cnr Parumoana and Norrie St, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
Ngāti Toa curators Jasmine Arthur and Te Rauparaha Horomona will share their insights and vision behind the new exhibition Mutumutu ki Mukukai: Freshwater to Saltwater.

Developed by Pātaka Art + Museum and Ngāti Toa Te Rūnanga o Toa Rangatira, the exhibition aims to share the cultural values, knowledge and enduring relationship of Ngāti Toa, as kaitiaki mana whenua, to the interconnected water sources of this region. The exhibition is open from 6 December.

Use this link to learn more about the exhibition: https://pataka.org.nz/whats-on/exhibitions/mutumutu-ki-mukukai

events.long_description:
Join us for an afternoon of festive elegance and indulge in the spirit of the holidays with a selection of holiday-inspired treats, perfectly paired with bottomless T.W.G. Tea.

Available Fridays, Saturdays & Sundays | 14th November - 21st December
$65 per person

MENU
Santa's Turkey & cranberry finger sandwich
Ham, cheese & basil pinwheel
Smoked salmon mousse choux 'bauble'
Batata vada with spiced date chutney
Chocolate and berry delice
Mini Christmas 'tree' cake
Gingerbread macaron
Sticky date pudding with caramel sauce
Brandy-soaked cherry & orange scone with vanilla cream

A children's menu is available for under 12's and is priced at $25 per child.

Please note that our Festive High Tea menu cannot be adapted to accommodate dietary or allergy restrictions.

Our Classic High Tea menu can be adapted to vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free diets. Please select the appropriate menu for each guest when making your booking.

Terms & Conditions

Our Festive High Tea cannot be modified for dietary requirements. However, our Classic High Tea is available in a Vegetarian, Vegan and Gluten Free version.
Please note, we are unable to accommodate dietary requirements without prior notice.
If not already stated and confirmed at the time of reservation, guest numbers must be confirmed 48 hours prior to arrival.
A credit card must be provided at the time of reservation to secure the booking.
High Tea reservations cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival will incur a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
No-shows will be charged a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
Decreases in attendee numbers will not be accepted within 24 hours before arrival, and charges will apply based on the confirmed final count.

events.id: Final Call. An End of an Era-264A Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Final Call. An End of an Era
events.venue: 264A Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
FINAL CALL to Heyday's "A Lager & Sour Series"
12–14 December 2025
Heyday Beer Co | Cuba St, Wellington
After two years of monthly First Pour Fridays, the Lager & Sour Series is coming to its Final Call, a weekend-long celebration to toast the beers, the art, & everyone who’s been part of the ride.
Since February 2024, we’ve tapped something new on the first Friday of every month, from crispy lagers to wild sours, all wrapped in some of our favourite art. There is two more left to come, we’re asking you to SAVE THE DATE for one last round before a brand new chapter begins.
Join us December 12–14 as we say goodbye to an era & celebrate the start of another.
Expect:
5 Lager & 5 Sours from the series
DJs (TBC)
A sneak peek at what’s coming for First Pour 2026
Keep an eye on socials as we celebrate these beers & fear not, we are still doing First Pour Fridays around NZ in 2026. We are working hard behind the scenes for 2026 & will be giving you some sneak peaks over the coming weeks.

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.id: Human Rights: Our Everyday Essentials, Our Shared Responsibility-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Human Rights: Our Everyday Essentials, Our Shared Responsibility
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
As the United Nations marks its 80th year, join us for a special end-of-year event exploring why human rights remain essential in our daily lives and how each of us plays a role in protecting them.
“Human Rights: Our Everyday Essentials, Our Shared Responsibility” brings together community voices, regional perspectives, and global context to reflect on the state of human rights in Aotearoa, the Pacific, and beyond.
This event is designed to be welcoming, thought-provoking, and empowering, offering space for meaningful dialogue and shared understanding. Whether you're deeply involved in human rights work or simply curious to learn more, this evening is for you.
✨ Panelist lineup to be announced soon. Watch this space!
✨ Free entry
✨ Open to all
✨ Followed by light refreshments
Come be part of a conversation that matters and help shape the next chapter of human rights in our region.

events.id: Kiwi Christmas in Battle Hill-Battle Hill Farm Forest Park, 608 Paekakariki Hill Road, Paekakariki , Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Kiwi Christmas in Battle Hill
events.venue: Battle Hill Farm Forest Park, 608 Paekakariki Hill Road, Paekakariki , Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
Celebrate the season at Battle Hill Regional Park – Christmas carols and movie night in the park
Gather the whānau and head to Battle Hill Regional Park for a magical evening of festive fun on the farm.

Join us for Nick Tansley’s Carols Caravan, bringing joyful live music to the park. Stay later for a screening of the movie Kiwi Christmas on the big screen—a funny, whānau-friendly movie about Santa tuning up for a summer holiday as far away from the North Pole as possible – Aotearoa!

Carols: 5.30pm - 6.30pm

Movie: 6.30pm - 8pm (PG)

Warm up with marshmallow toasting and grab a bite from the Riding for the Disabled fundraising food stall (cash only). If conditions allow, join a guided walk to see glow worms later that night.

Why not make a weekend of it? Come camp at the Battle Hill campground and enjoy everything the park has to offer—from swimming holes and forest walks to peaceful picnic spots and farm animals.
Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Battle Hill Farm Forest Park is more than just a beautiful place—it’s a hub for ecological restoration and history. Greater Wellington’s work here restores native bush, showcases farm animals for children, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our mana whenua partners, farmers, and volunteers play a vital role in keeping this park a special place for everyone.
events.description:
Celebrate the season at Battle Hill Regional Park – Christmas carols and movie night in the park Gather the whānau and head to Battle Hill Regional Park for a magical evening of festive fun on the farm.
Join us for Nick Tansley’s Carols Caravan, bringing joyful live music to the park.
Stay later for a screening of the movie Kiwi Christmas on the big screen—a funny, whānau-friendly movie about Santa tuning up for a summer holiday as far away from the North Pole as possible – Aotearoa!
If conditions allow, join a guided walk to see glow worms later that night.
Why not make a weekend of it?

events.long_description:
Benjamin Britten composed his 'A Ceremony of Carols' whilst aboard the SS Axelrod en route to England in 1942. It is a brilliantly set collection of a number of medieval English carols, bookended with plainsong sung in procession.

events.id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
Please contact for booking: indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

So just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

events.id: The Kava Experience-20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Kava Experience
events.venue: 20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bula Vinaka and Welcome to Kava Culture, New Zealand’s newest destination for authentic Fijian Kava!
We are thrilled to invite you to another relaxing Kava Experience night. Whether you're a curious newcomer or a seasoned kava enthusiast, our dedicated team will warmly guide you through every step of this unique journey.
At Kava Culture, we offer a premium, traditionally brewed kava experience designed for wellness-focused individuals seeking natural relaxation. We pride ourselves on sourcing our kava directly from small Pacific Island farms, ensuring unparalleled quality and authenticity.
Immerse yourself in the rich traditions of the Pacific as you enjoy our exquisite kava in our calm, serene location at Kaitahi, beautifully illuminated by ambient lights. This is more than just a drink; it's an opportunity to connect with others, promote genuine stress relief, and celebrate ancient island culture with modern comfort.
Join us for a night filled with community, connection, and tranquility. Let Kava Culture transport you – no passport required!
Choose your journey:
* Mini Experience: $30 (1.5 hours)
* Full Experience: $50 (3 hours)
We can’t wait to welcome you!

events.id: Journey to Serenity: Yin Yoga and Sound Healing-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Journey to Serenity: Yin Yoga and Sound Healing
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are monthly on the second Friday of each month and are held temporarily in the Meeting Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

These events sometimes sell out - so please book early 

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

Open to all: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

and please confirm your payment by email to bryony@heartsonghealing.life. Thank you.

Policy:
Depending on booking numbers, if you need to cancel your place you may be able to transfer ticket to the next month once. We reserve the right to refuse transfer or refund if cancelled within 48 hours

events.venue: Frank Kitts Park, Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kick off your weekend with us!
Join us every Friday evening this summer for a casual West Coast Swing (WCS) social dance under the sunset at the beautiful Frank Kitts Park.

Curious about learning? If you like what you see, we will have registration forms available on-site for our 2026 Swing Central classes. It’s the perfect time to sign up and start your dance journey!

Note: This event is weather-dependent. If it’s raining or too windy (it is Wellington, after all!), we will post an update here.

events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
"[Nadia] embraces a full-bodied sound halfway between Haim’s sophisticated pop sparkle and Sharon Van Etten’s full-throated songcraft" - The Guardian
This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.
Presale 10am (NZST), Wednesday 16th April
General on sale 10am (NZST), Friday 18th April
Register for presale at banishedmusic.com/subscribe
The Manchester-based expatriate New Zealander is known for her ruminative and well-crafted folk-inflected songwriting, and with Enter Now Brightness she presents a record of poise and great beauty, the sound of a cellular shift, of pain giving way to tenderness and joy.

events.id: The Napier Escape-Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: The Napier Escape
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Napier Escape
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in December 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.

Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.

Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.

The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.

Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.

- A Deco Deep Dive - a look into Napier's Art Deco history and culture and a tour of the city!

- Sip and Savour - Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.

- Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace.

Ticket pricing start at...

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $159
Child 2-12yrs - $139

Departing Palmerston North/Woodville
Adult 13+ yrs - $139
Child 2-12yrs - $119

More info and tickets available at www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

You may also like the following events from Steam Incorporated:
This Saturday, 13th September, 10:30 pm, Daffodil Express 2025 in Wellington
This December, 5th December, 09:05 pm, Heartland Flyer in Paekakariki
This December, 6th December, 12:10 am, The Festive Flyer in Wellington
Also check out other Arts events in Paekakariki , Food & Drink events in Paekakariki .
events.description:
The Napier Escape Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in December 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes.
Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
- Sip and Savour - Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.

events.id: Fruitcake: A Jolly Good Christmas Cabaret-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Fruitcake: A Jolly Good Christmas Cabaret
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
What’s festive and fruity and sleighs the chimney down?!
Fruitcake: A Jolly Good Christmas Drag Show!

This December, come all ye faithful to The Fringe Bar, and get ready for a Drag Spectacular to wipe off that resting grinch face and jingle your bells!

A Mistle-toast brought to you by Willy SmacknTush and featuring a sleighful of naughty and nice performers from across the snowglobe, who are ready to shake it like a pole-ariod picture and make it rein!

Two shows over two nights! Double the presents!

Starring Selina Simone, Ginger Velour, Robin Yablind, Velma Cherry (Friday 12), Ms Weeds (Saturday 13) and hosted by Willy SmacknTush.

So treat yo’elf this silly season, don thee now your gay apparel and grab your tickets on Eventfinda.
With tickets starting at just $20 or splash out on a Front Row or VIP ticket and get right in the action.

Presales essential or yule be sorry.

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($35.00 per ticket)
GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up.

Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

You can contact us at willysmackntush@gmail.com

events.name: Nadia Reid Enter Now Brightness Tour
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington
events.description:
This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.
December 12 / Wellington / Meow Nui Presale 10am (NZST), Wednesday 16th April General on sale 10am (NZST), Friday 18th April Register for presale at banishedmusic.com/subscribe The Manchester-based expatriate New Zealander is known for her ruminative and well-crafted folk-inflected songwriting, and with Enter Now Brightness she presents a record of poise and great beauty, the sound of a cellular shift, of pain giving way to tenderness and joy.

events.id: PROSA 'IDLE STATE' EP RELEASE WELLINGTON w/ Western Haikus-13 Garrett St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: PROSA 'IDLE STATE' EP RELEASE WELLINGTON w/ Western Haikus
events.venue: 13 Garrett St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
As part of their EP release tour of the North Island, Tāmaki Makaurau punks Prosa are playing a show at 13 Garrett Street on December 12th in Wellington.
Prosa's debut EP 'Idle State' is releasing on December 11th, containing their singles 'Decline' and 'Disconnected' alongside three other songs. Mixing the best of post-punk and post-hardcore, Prosa are a force to be reckoned with.
Joined by Wellington screamo band Western Haikus, this is bound to be an underground alt punk extravaganza!

events.name: Phantastic Ferniture - Dare to Fern in Love
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
This summer, join Phantastic Ferniture on their Dare to Fern in Love Tour of Australia and Aotearoa/New Zealand. In celebration of the release of their first new material since their 2018 critically acclaimed debut album, the ferns are heading to Aotearoa/New Zealand for their very first international shows in Wellington, Auckland and Lyttelton before bringing their famous Christmas Extravaganza to Melbourne, Sydney and Blackheath. Known for their live and loose garage pop, Phan Fern will be playing new singles Dare to Fall in Love and Change My Mind, as well as favourite’s F*ckin N Rollin, Gap Year, and Dark Corner Dance Floor.

Dec 11 - Double Whammy
Dec 12 - Meow
Dec 13 - Loons

Tickets available 9am Monday 15th September via Undertheradar and Flicket (Meow).

events.id: Vox Ethno-Garibaldi Club, 118 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Vox Ethno
events.venue: Garibaldi Club, 118 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Undercurrent presents Vox Ethno!
Vox Ethno has evolved out of a small but strong civic Serbian choir, Vox Serbica, from 2002. “Born” in 2019, Vox Ethno has 12 members – a six-voice female vocal group with a five-piece band under the steady musical and artistic direction of Mima Nikolić.
The band performs traditional (ethno) folk music from the Balkans and Europe in both à capella and accompanied formats. We perform mostly original arrangements of traditional (ethno) folk music from the Balkans and across Europe.
Join us for an unforgettable night of fiery Balkan folk music dancing, laughing and singing
Friday 12th Dec
Doors open 7:30pm
Gig at 8pm
$20
Tickets on the door & online (ticket links soon!)
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/99896/Vox-Ethno.utr

events.id: Joffa Tryalls Party-The Hop Garden, 13 Pirie St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Joffa Tryalls Party
events.venue: The Hop Garden, 13 Pirie St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Mikejoffa welcome you to a local celebration for our latest album release Tryalls. Come and check out live tracks from the album and get your hands on some Joffamerch, including a copy of Tryalls!
Joffa's eclectic sound expresses a wide range of influences from punk, grunge, psychedelic and metal. Joffa's raw, emotive and raucous style will excite listeners to venture towards their new release.
‘The fine line of presenting ‘90’s style grunge attitude while not sounding repetitive and stale is walked successfully with plenty going on to capture listener interest.’
- Stu Edwards (NZ Musician)
featuring guests:
The Blue Summer:
The Blue Summer are a five-piece surrounding themselves with wisps of funk, post punk, alternative rock, and pop. Like a wave crashing upon the rocks, chaotic and multi-faceted, only to pull back exposing the calm of the depths below. Gracefully twisting and changing shape from ballads to bangers.
Hadees Drudge:
Hard rock to Thrash Metal with a few nice songs in between.
Doors @ 8pm, Start time @ 8.30pm
Door sales: $20.00
Tickets via Undertheradar
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/.../Joffa-Tryalls-Party.utr
Bandcamp:
https://theadventuresofmikejoffa.bandcamp.com/album/tryalls
https://bluesummerband.bandcamp.com/album/vice-city-demos
https://hadeesdrudge.bandcamp.com/

Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/mikejoffa

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61577368685539
https://www.facebook.com/WellingtonHardRockMetal

events.id: FLOWTEK-63 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: FLOWTEK
events.venue: 63 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
VORTEK
The fusion of deep bass music, out of this world visuals, and intricate stage design, all connecting together to form the Vortex of all art in a unique audiovisual experience. As inspired by the ''Lemon Tek''; inside the Vortek all is one.

Enter your first psychedelic journey into Flotex, where you can heal yourself with the flowing energies of the tree of life. With the sounds of Dubstep, UKG, and Drum and Bass, immerse yourself into the heart of the forest where you’ll be welcomed by the spirit of bass music and dance the pain away.

Flowtek’s experience goes further than a bass party — it is the full psychedelic experience that will leave you breathless the moment you step inside.

Lineup:
9pm - SPAM B2B TOY PURPLE |OPENING DUBSTEP
10pm - AMIRA |DUBSTEP
11pm - SKULLI |DUBSTEP
12am - SQUEAKZ. |DUBSTEP- DNB- UKG
1am - BEN-JAMMIN B2B CROOKED MIND |UKG-DNB
2am - DJ BY ACCIDENT |DNB-JUNGLE
VJ: SPAM

Location: Garden Hotel, 63 Courtenay Pl
Time: 9pm - 3am
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
This event is R18. Valid photo ID will be required for entry.
Respect each other and the venue.
We will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
Consent is key – always.
Lighting & Visual Effects: Please be aware that strobe lights, lasers and other flashing
visuals may be in use throughout the night. These effects may not be suitable for everyone.
Photos & Video: Our crew will be capturing the energy of the night through photos and videos. By being here, you’re part of that magic and may appear in content we share to celebrate and promote future events.
Have fun and please find the crew if you have any issues.

events.name: Carols in Mahara Place from Kāpiti Chorale
events.venue: Mahara Pl, Waikanae 5036
events.long_description:
Carols in Mahara Place from Kāpiti Chorale
🎄 Carols in Mahara Place

Come and enjoy an hour of Christmas music in the heart of Waikanae! ✨

Kāpiti Chorale will be singing in Mahara Place on Saturday 13 December from 10am to 11am, in collaboration with the Waikanae Business Association. It is a free and easygoing event, lovely if you are spending your morning in Waikanae.

Ann-Marie Stapp will be directing and Wes Brown will be accompanying the choir on keyboard. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. Last year people gathered around the square, children wandered closer to listen and the whole place felt warm and festive.

Stay for a song or stay for the whole hour. We would love to share a bit of Christmas cheer with you and hope to see you there! 🎶

events.id: Clean Up The Hutt 2025-Petone Beach,Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Clean Up The Hutt 2025
events.venue: Petone Beach,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Clean Up The Hutt 2025
👉 Register over at www.cleanupthehutt.org

Sustainable Coastlines and Conservation Volunteers NZ have partnered up to deliver a huge community clean-up day across Te Awa Kairangi ki Tai Lower Hutt, thanks to Hutt City Council. Join us for the inaugural Clean Up The Hutt event on Saturday, 13 December 2025!

Come along to be part of this massive community day spanning the coastline, as well as inland sites to stop the litter getting to the beach in the first place. We’ll provide everything you need to clean up, plus prizes, kai, and good vibes.

Everyone is welcome to this free, weekend event — families looking for a fun day out with the kids, individuals wanting to meet likeminded people, colleagues looking to use that volunteer day, or groups of mates keen to get their hands dirty. We’re all there for the same reason: to protect the places we love.

Pick out your clean-up location and register on our official event page: www.cleanupthehutt.org

events.name: Fundraising for Kāpiti Chorale at Paekakariki Christmas Market

events.long_description:
Fundraising for Kāpiti Chorale at Paekakariki Christmas Market
🎄 Support Kāpiti Chorale at the Paekākāriki Christmas Market! 🎄

Kāpiti Chorale has been described as “a jewel of the Kāpiti Coast,” and we’re proud to keep bringing interesting and imaginative music programmes to audiences across the Kāpiti Coast and Wellington region.

As with many community groups, we occasionally run fundraising efforts to help keep our concerts accessible and enjoyable for everyone.

This year, we’ll be at the Paekākāriki Christmas Market on Saturday 13 December, from 10am to 2pm, and we’d love to see you there.

Our stall will be full of festive treats: homemade goodies, jams (including delicious lemon curd), hand-knitted colourful hats and crowns, tissue boxes, and more, all generously donated by talented members and friends of the choir.

💛 Come say hello, pick up something lovely, and help support what we do. Every dollar makes a difference.

Would you like to contribute to the stall?
We welcome donations of baking and distinctive craft items.
If you’d like to help, please contact Bill Gebbie at 027 677 0180.

events.long_description:
HBJ Shield in Palmy • CENTRAL HINDS v Otago Sparks
The Central Hinds are back in Palmy for a big fifth game of the season - free admission for a fun Saturday at the park against the defending one-day champions, the Otago Sparks!

Catch an exciting game of one-day cricket in the historic NZC Hallyburton Johnstone Shield, you're free to sit anywhere to enjoy the action up close. This is the first of two matches against the Sparks this weekend with the stars on show.

Follow along with official hashtags #hbjshield #centralhinds

FREE admission to see the Central Hinds in Palmy
FREE livestream on www.cdcricket.co.nz + livescore updates

Follow the @CentralHinds on Instagram for the very latest matchday info. Spectator T&C's and info on what you can bring into the ground is in the Fanzone on www.cdcricket.co.nz

Toss is 10am

Bring a picnic. Sorry, team merch is not available at this game, but you'll be able to buy our Stags and Hinds merch online - at www.cdcricket.co.nz - this summer

#CENTRALHINDS
#HBJSHIELD

events.id: 🥋 MF Hutt Valley End-of-Year Social! 🎉-Hutt Valley,38 Marine Pde, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: 🥋 MF Hutt Valley End-of-Year Social! 🎉
events.venue: Hutt Valley,38 Marine Pde, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
🥋 MF Hutt Valley End-of-Year Social! 🎉
🥋 MF Hutt Valley End-of-Year Social! 🎉
Saturday 13 December, 10:30am – Hikoikoi Reserve, Petone (weather dependent)

Howdy Team! 👋
What an amazing year it’s been — we now have over 50 smiling, sweating, super students across our Petone and Trentham schools! The support from our students, parents, and community has been incredible — thank you all ❤️
Let’s celebrate with a fun, lightweight, and informal End-of-Year Social!

Plan for the day:
🥏 Round of Disc Golf (golf with Frisbees!)
🍔 Kai and picnic
🏊‍♂️ Optional swim (for the brave!)
💬 Jibber-jabber and good vibes
Bring a Frisbee, some kai to share (I'll check if there's a community BBQ available nearby and let you know), and your summer spirit — let’s wrap up the year together in style 🌞

Things I’m celebrating this year:
• Launching our schools with support from Aussie colleagues, family & fighting friends.
• Learning and implementing MF programmes.
• Watching students earn tips & belts (and those big smiles!).
• Seeing confidence, focus & dedication grow.
• Amazing support from MF parents and guardians 🙏.
• Leadership Programme success and our team’s goals.

Looking ahead to next year:
• Supporting students on their belt journeys.
• Getting into sparring and MF competitions.
• Helping team members become Accredited & Certified Instructors.
• Opening new schools (maybe two!).
• Growing our Parent Assistants, SWAT & Leadership teams.

Thanks for being part of my journey
Mr M

#gratitude #MFHuttValley #KarateFamily
