events.id: Reiki Level One - Wellington, New Zealand. Dec 13th & 14th, 2025..-Capricorn Spirit,103 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Reiki Level One - Wellington, New Zealand. Dec 13th & 14th, 2025..
events.venue: Capricorn Spirit,103 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Reiki Level One - Wellington, New Zealand. Dec 13th & 14th, 2025..
Discover the Gift of Reiki with Usui Reiki Level One

Usui Reiki is a gentle yet powerful method of natural healing, rediscovered by Mikau Usui over 100 years ago. It uses the flow of Universal Life Force energy to heal and rebalance the mind, body, and spirit. The beauty of Reiki lies in its simplicity and accessibility—everyone has the ability to connect with these healing frequencies. Reiki is a lifelong tool, ready to support you whenever you need it most.

In this Reiki Level One course, you will:
🌟 Learn how to perform a self-Reiki session and offer one-on-one Reiki to family and friends.
🌟 Receive the sacred Usui Reiki Level One attunement in person.
🌟 Begin a 21-day spiritual cleanse to integrate the energy shifts.
🌟 Study the history of Reiki, basic anatomy, chakra systems, and the frequencies of language and emotional states.
🌟 Gain practical tools to incorporate Reiki into your daily life.

This comprehensive course exceeds all standards set by Reiki NZ Inc. The training includes 12 hours of tuition spread over two days (both dates must be attended), with a 21-day integration period supported by ongoing guidance and a private Facebook group.

Includes:
✨ 12+ hours of expert tuition over 2 days
✨ Comprehensive manual and certificate
✨Cacao Ceremony to expand our hearts in preparation for our attunement
✨ Light healthy afternoon tea and herbal teas each day
✨ Access to a private Facebook group for support
Payment options, including plans, are available—please email me for details at .

Class size is kept small to ensure an intimate and personalized learning experience. A commitment to home study and self-Reiki practice is required for 21 days following the course.

🌟 When & Where:
📍 Capricorn Spirit, Willis St, Wellington
📅 Two days attendance required - 10.45am to 4.45pm, Saturday, December 13th and Sunday, December 14th.

🌟 About Your Teacher
Gina Noetica is one of New Zealand’s most experienced and dedicated Reiki Master/Teachers. Teaching all levels since 2008 and working as a professional Energy Healer (Quantum Energy Alchemy) since 2001, Gina brings a wealth of knowledge and a deeply intuitive approach to her courses. Her grounded, heartfelt teaching style empowers students to embark on their own journeys of healing and self-discovery.

I would be honoured to share this sacred practice with you.

Namaste,

Gina Noetica
Founder of the Centre for Expanding Consciousness
Professional Quantum Energy Alchemist & Reiki Master/Teacher, Consciousness Coach, Cacao Ceremonialist, CE5 Ambassador, Breathwork Facilitator.
📧
📞 022 413 6752

events.id: Christmas in the Quarters – Santa, Christmas activities, and Carols, at Waitangi Park-Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In

events.long_description:
Christmas in the Quarters – Santa, Christmas activities, and Carols, at Waitangi Park
We are celebrating Christmas with four free whānau-friendly events, in four different parts of the city this year!

🎅 Santa is coming to Waitangi Park, and he’s bringing festive cheer! Santa will do a walk-around Waitangi Park between 11am and 11.30am to greet the crowd. Meet Santa in his grotto between 11.30am and 5 pm, take a photo, and a selfie on his sleigh!

There will also be a range of Christmas activities between 11am - 5pm, including ice skating, the snowball globe, a foam pit, live music and entertainment, face painting, and caricatures. Plus a variety of food trucks will also be on site.

To wrap up Christmas in the Quarters be sure to stick around for Christmas carols with Nick Tansley & Friends at 5-7pm for a night of sing-alongs📍


Join us for four weekends of Christmas magic all around Pōneke!
🎄 Crafts at Midland Park on Saturday 22 November.
🎄 Music at Glover Park on Saturday 29 November.
🎄 Circus on Queens Wharf on Saturday 6 December.
🎄 Meet Santa at Waitangi Park and enjoy a range of Christmas activities on Saturday 13 December

Carols in the Park, 5pm – 7pm, Saturday 13 December.

Join in on the festivities 👉 https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/christmas-in-the-quarters

events.long_description:
Christmas on the Coast
Get ready to sparkle, Christmas on the Coast is back! Register now to be a float or stall for the 2025 Christmas Parade - www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/do-it-online/forms/register-your-float-or-stall-for-the-2025-christmas-parade/

Join us on Saturday 13 December, from 11am–3pm at Mazengarb Reserve for a festive family day filled with cheer.

At 11 am, catch the colourful Christmas float parade as it travels from Paraparaumu College along Mazengarb Road to the reserve, then stay on for an afternoon of festival fun.

Enjoy free activities like games, face-painting, live entertainment, a bounce zone, and visits to Santa’s grotto. Bring a picnic or grab a bite from one of our food trucks, and don’t forget to bring a can for the Kāpiti Foodbank collection.

For more info, visit www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/Christmas
________________________
There’s no rain date for this event.

events.id: Messiah-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Messiah
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s one of the great Christmas traditions — listening to a performance of Handel’s Messiah. Orpheus Choir Wellington, Orchestra Wellington, and four soloists join forces to bring this timeless masterpiece to life. A beacon of holiday joy for centuries, Messiah blends grandeur, beauty, and drama in equal measure. 
Under the direction of Brent Stewart, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work. From the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound to the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is an uplifting musical journey. Soloists include Emma Pearson, Maaike Christie-Beekman, Lila LJ Crichton, and Joel Amosa. 
Considered one of the greatest musical works of the 18th century, Messiah continues to endure over 280 years since it first premiered. Head to the Michael Fowler Centre to see why it continues to deliver.

events.long_description:
Summer in the Edible Backyard
Join me for a seasonal garden chat and Q + A about the summer food garden.

We'll be talking about the key things you can be doing to keep fruit trees and vegies in good health, and how to reduce pests + disease using my simple, practical ways. We'll focus on the soil, because that's at the heart of it - what to look for and how to respond to what you see.

Price includes afternoon tea.

Signed copies of my new book "Homegrown Fruit: A Practical Guide" will be for sale.

events.id: The Napier Escape-Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: The Napier Escape
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in December 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.

Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.

Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.

The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.

Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:

- A Deep Deco Dive: includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
- Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views: Travel by coach from Hastings to Crab Farm Winery near Bay View for a curated wine tasting and late lunch.
- Napier at your Leisure: Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!
events.description:
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in December 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes.
Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.

events.venue: Paremata Boating Club,110 Paremata Road, Porirua, Porirua Pa, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Mandala Yoga Studio
**Experience the Magic of Sound Healing with Claudio Escutia – First Time in Mandala Yoga**

Discover the transformative power of sound at *Mandala Yoga Studio* with the multi-instrumentalist **Claudio Escutia** in his first time **Sound Healing Experience** in Paremata. This is your chance to unwind, recharge, and immerse yourself in a deeply restorative sonic journey like no other.

### **An Evening of Deep Relaxation & Inner Harmony**
Claudio masterfully blends the resonant vibrations of **Gongs, Crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other sacred instruments**, creating an immersive soundscape that soothes the nervous system, quietens the mind, and opens the heart.

- **Feel the sound** as much as you hear it—every note washes through you, releasing tension and restoring balance.
- **No experience needed**—just lie back, breathe, and let the waves of harmonic sound carry you into deep relaxation.
- **A rare opportunity** to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing vibrations—right here in Paremata!

### **What to Bring?**
Bring your own yoga or camping mat, pillow and blanket for ultimate comfort. Come in cozy clothes, ready to melt into the sound.

### **Why You’ll Love This Experience**
✨ **First time ever in Paremata!** Don’t miss this exclusive event.
✨ **Perfect for stress relief, deep relaxation, and emotional renewal.**
✨ **Limited spaces**—these sessions often sell out fast!

### **About Claudio Escutia**
A world traveler and sound alchemist, Claudio’s journey has taken him from **Mexico City to Montreal, Kathmandu to Wellington**, studying classical guitar, jazz, and ancient sound healing traditions. His music is a bridge between cultures—blending **Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs, and Voice** into a meditative, heart-opening experience.

**Curious to hear his sound?**
🎶 **Listen here:**
[SoundCloud]( https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds) | [Instagram]( https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing) | [Facebook]( https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio)

**Don’t wait—secure your spot now!** 🌿
*Spaces are limited, and this one-of-a-kind experience won’t last long.*

📍 **Mandala Yoga Studio,110 Paremata Road,Porirua**
📅 **[Saturday 13th of December 5pm - 7pm ]**
💲 **[$49 ]** Early bird price of $45 for first 10 bookings.

*Come as you are. Leave transformed.*

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

What is Porirua parkrun?
It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.
(Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres) The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.
but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results.

events.id: TCPS The Control Room: Final Transmission-145 Victoria St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: TCPS The Control Room: Final Transmission
events.venue: 145 Victoria St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Control Room: Final Transmission
Presented by The Car Park Society
Saturday 13 December 2025 · 8pm · 149 Victoria Street, Te Whanganui-a-Tara
Final Transmission marks the closing of The Control Room, a social experiment and augmented reality art project by Māori-led collective 'The Car Park Society' that has traced the circuitry of power, colonisation, and collective resistance through the architecture of the city. This final gathering is the end of the broadcast, a chance to power down the system and celebrate the histories of communities buried beneath the streets.
Food and drinks will be served throughout the night, but this is a potluck and you are warmly invited to contribute to the table with kai, inu, or your own creative offering, art work or time. The evening will move between sound, conversation, and ritual, holding space to reflect, reconnect, and close the circuit together. There will be live music, kai, drinks, speakers, interactive Ai media, Māori library and hub of treasure hunts and maps, visual art activities, card and board-games, and decolonial tasks to make you think and feel more connected.
Come share in the final signal, chat to the 'Oracle' and hear what it has to say....Stay until the frequencies fade and always #StayVigilant.

events.id: Messiah-Michael Fowler Centre,111 Wakefield St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Messiah
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre,111 Wakefield St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Messiah
Celebrate the festive season with a magnificent performance of Handel’s Messiah on Saturday, 13 December, at 7:30 pm in the Michael Fowler Centre. Presented by Orpheus Choir Wellington and Orchestra Wellington, this timeless masterpiece has been a beacon of holiday joy for centuries, blending grandeur, beauty, and drama in equal measure.

Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work. From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.

Joining Brent is a stellar lineup of soloists. Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry. Mezzo-soprano Maaike Christie-Beekman adds depth and warmth with her rich, expressive voice. Rising tenor Lila LJ Crichton contributes freshness and flair, while Lexus Song Quest winner Joel Amosa grounds the quartet with his commanding bass.

Come and join us for an evening of musical brilliance that will have you saying, Hallelujah!
events.description:
Messiah Celebrate the festive season with a magnificent performance of Handel’s Messiah on Saturday, 13 December, at 7:30 pm in the Michael Fowler Centre.
Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work.
From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.
Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry.
Mezzo-soprano Maaike Christie-Beekman adds depth and warmth with her rich, expressive voice.

events.venue: 75 Darlington Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022
events.long_description:
The Rodrigo Brothers: End of Year GIG!
Rodrigo Brothers – End of Year GIG! 🎶

It’s the end of the year, come say hi, have a dance with us, and let’s celebrate everything that happened in 2025 the best way we know how… with MUSIC! 💃🔥🎸

We’re very excited to share this special night with you:
🎵 Three big sets (50 minutes each)
🎵 Rodrigo originals, Latin, rock & party vibes all night
🎵 Two 30-minute breaks to chat, mingle & enjoy free snacks 🍿

This night is extra special…
It will be our last gig with our beloved Maxime before he heads off to England ❤️🇬🇧
Come help us send him off with love, rhythm, and a full dance floor!

📅 Saturday 23 December
📍 Miramar Bowling Club
🕖 Doors 7PM • Music from 7:30–11:30PM
📝 Please sign in at the door (private club)

Let’s finish 2025 together,
Come celebrate the last gig of the year with us! 🌞✨

events.id: WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL-End of Bay Drive, Titahi Bay beach,Titahi Bay Boat Sheds, Bay Dr, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
events.venue: End of Bay Drive, Titahi Bay beach,Titahi Bay Boat Sheds, Bay Dr, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
Hi everyone - welcome to the WSKN Christmas SKISL / Paddle to Mana!

On Saturday 13th December we will have a Christmas event on Mana Island, departing Titahi Bay at 10am (so arriving at 9:30) getting to Mana around 10:40, keen ones can do stuff prior to lunch around 12:00, then there might be groups that head back at different time slots, but we can work that out on the day. Return could therefore either be 1:30 or 2:30 with the latest return to Titahi Bay being 3pm.

We've made this event later than the normal SKISL so that it's easier for folks to drive down from Palmerston North, and also because it is a lunch event.

The lawn on Mana is really nice, sheltered and pleasant and there are also good walks. Mana is of course a sanctuary so you must check your boats for any wildlife especially ants that may have gotten in past the hatches. Also we cannot have any fires

Plan B: If weather nukes Mana, we'll try for Green Point or Onehunga Bay in Whitireia Park by driving there.

Plan C: We will postpone to 21 December

Also check out other Workshops in Porirua.

events.id: 🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄-Petone Salvation Army,MTR Service NZ, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: 🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄
events.venue: Petone Salvation Army,MTR Service NZ, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄
"May I have this Christmas dance?" 🎄😊💃🕺 It's that time of year already! Come spread the Christmas cheer on the dance floor with us!

Come dance the night away with your like-minded friends, and loads of classic Salsa songs from years ago, as well as a “dash” of Bachata and a “sprinkling” of Kizomba…..

• One fantastic wooden dance floor with a mix of Salsa, Bachata, and Kizomba music

• Easy to find venue off a main street in Petone (72 Cuba St)

• Plenty of parking in surrounding streets

• On main bus routes (#83 from Wellington, or #110 from Upper Hutt), or short 8min walk from Ava Train Station

• Water station provided however bringing your own water drink bottle is recommended. Also, BYO soft drinks, fruit juices, non-alcohol drinks, etc. (NB/ No alcohol allowed on premises!)

• Please wear high heel/stiletto caps to prevent damage to the venue’s wooden floor – For example, from https://www.beclickless.com/pages/faqs

• Only goes until 10:30pm so get there early to have a decent "fix" of dancing and socialising 😊

• Only $10.00 at the door (cash), or bank transfer (preferably at least 24 hours in advance):

Account: 06-0507-0092784-05
Account Name: Kasia L Wypych
Particulars/Code/Reference: “Your 1st and last name” - Salsa Hutt – “date of Salsa Hutt party”
******* (If you have prepaid on the night, please take a screenshot and show proof of payment at the door).

• Invite your friends to this event…and see you there! 😊

💃🕺 From 7:30pm to 10:30pm

💃🕺 Petone Salvation Army
Corner of Cuba and High Sts, Petone, Lower Hutt (Entrance from High St)

Email Kasia on or ring/text on 021 141 8116 for more details.

events.name: FLASH WEEKENDER @ LOVE HERTZ
events.venue: Ohiro Road Apartment, 189 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We’re having an end-of-year flash weekend, to celebrate the re-brand and welcome our new resident artists, come say goodbye to 2025 with some tattoos…
We’ll have 7 of our artists plus two lovely guests working over two days, check the poster for which artists are working each day.
All artists will have fresh flash designs, priced and ready to go. As always, we’ll be tattooing limbs only for the event. You can check the socials in the next few weeks to see some previews of everyone’s designs.
This will be first come-first serve so best to show up in the morning and bags a spot, if you can’t make it til the afternoon then we’re just a phone call away to check in for availability.
If you’re not feeling getting tattooed, we’ll also have some new t-shirts and other bits n bobs for sale.

events.name: Girls Rock the Boys Wellington
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mt Victoria,The Hop Garden, 13 Pirie St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Girls Rock the Boys Wellington
POWERHOUSE WOMEN SINGERS: CLASSIC ROCK FROM THE BANDS OF MEN: A KICKASS LIVE BAND

Girls Rock the boys is back—bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage.
This time, it’s Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, with a stellar band behind them:
Andrew Richardson (drums), Matt Fitzpatrick (bass), Aslan Rowlands (guitar), and Duncan Haynes (keys).

We’re diving deep into the golden era of rock—Journey, Whitesnake, Boston, Foreigner, Rainbow, and Deep Purple, all delivered with the energy of a rugby pitch and the comfort of your favourite dressing gown.

Whether you’re waving your phone torch to Foreigner, headbanging to Rainbow, or playing air guitar to Deep Purple, you’ll find something to do with yourself in every “mini EP” set.

The band are amazing - the singers nail it, and we've added new songs!

Need a breather? The wonders at Underworld will sort you a drink and a plate.

Feedback from our last gig: “Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking—check them out!”

Come and see us - we love it when you do!

🎟️ Early bird tickets just $20. Door sales $30.

💔 A special shout-out to our inaugural bass player, Callum Black, who’s heading overseas. You’ve been an inspiration, Callum. We’ll work to do you proud.

events.venue: 24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We are celebrating Christmas with four free whānau-friendly events, in four different parts of the city this year!
Santa is coming to Waitangi Park, and he’s bringing festive cheer! Santa will do a walk-around Waitangi Park between 11am and 11.30am to greet the crowd. Meet Santa in his grotto between 11.30am and 5 pm, take a photo, and a selfie on his sleigh!
There will also be a range of Christmas activities between 11am - 5pm, including ice skating, the snowball globe, a foam pit, live music and entertainment, face painting, and caricatures. Plus a variety of food trucks will also be on site.
To wrap up Christmas in the Quarters be sure to stick around for Christmas carols with Nick Tansley & Friends at 5-7pm for a night of sing-alongs

Join us for four weekends of Christmas magic all around Pōneke!
Crafts at Midland Park on Saturday 22 November.
Music at Glover Park on Saturday 29 November.
Circus on Queens Wharf on Saturday 6 December.
Meet Santa at Waitangi Park and enjoy a range of Christmas activities on Saturday 13 December
Carols in the Park, 5pm – 7pm, Saturday 13 December.

events.long_description:

Join us on Saturday, 13 December, from 11am–3pm at Mazengarb Reserve for a festive family day filled with cheer.

At 11 am, catch the colourful Christmas float parade as it travels from Paraparaumu College along Mazengarb Road to the reserve, then stay on for an afternoon of festival fun.

events.long_description:
Denise Walker Dance Academy is proud to present 'Encore' 2025 - A Dance Spectacular!

Get ready to be swept off your feet! Take a journey with us full of tutus and tiaras as our amazing junior dancers take the stage at Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre. 'Encore' is a high-energy, feel good celebration of our favourites, bringing together the beauty of ballet, energy of jazz and the emotion of lyrical dance. Bursting with colour, creativity and joy - perfect for the whole family!

We are excited to be able to celebrate our year of dance with you so come along and support DWDA and enjoy this dance spectacular. Both shows 13th Dec and suitable for all ages. Book your tickets now and experience the magic of DWDA dance.

Under twos - free if seated on parent's lap.

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

events.name: Tākina Christmas Market
events.venue: 50 Cable St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tākina Christmas Market 2025
Christmas magic is returning to Wellington!

For two festive-filled days, the Tākina Convention & Exhibition Centre will transform into a glittering holiday wonderland—twinkling lights, joyful music, and festive cheer included.
Here’s what’s in store:
100+ stalls with handcrafted gifts, local makers, & festive treats
Live music and Christmas carols
Seasonal food & delicious drinks
Face painting, kids’ activities, and creative workshops
This year, we’re proud to support the Wellington City Mission. Bring along non-perishable food items and place them under the Tākina Christmas tree to help spread joy to families in need.
Entry / Give Back:
$2 entry per person (Kids under 12 FREE)
OR donate a non-perishable food item for the Wellington City Mission
Whether you're hunting for the perfect gift, enjoying festive treats, or giving back to the community, this is one magical market you won’t want to miss.
Dates & Times
Saturday, 13 December | 11:00am – 6:00pm
Sunday, 14 December | 10:00am – 4:00pm
Location
Tākina Convention & Exhibition Centre
50 Cable Street, Wellington (Opp. Te Papa)
Entry
$2 per person (Kids under 12 FREE)
OR donate a non-perishable food item
Let’s bring the magic back to Wellington—shop local, celebrate the season, and help support our community.
#TākinaChristmasMarket #WellingtonEvents #ChristmasInWellington #FestiveMagic #ShopLocal

events.id: Club Christmas Special-180 Wellington road, Paekakariki, Paekakariki-Facebook
events.name: Club Christmas Special
events.venue: 180 Wellington road, Paekakariki, Paekakariki
events.long_description:
HVMBC Members' Christmas Special!
Epic rides + BBQ + optional overnight camping
Location : Paekakariki
Date : Starting *SATURDAY*, 13th December, 12:00pm - Sunday 14th December
Did you read that? We start on *SATURDAY* at 12pm (ride starts at 1pm), with (maybe) another ride Sunday morning
Ride type: HVMBC Members' Christmas Special
Time/Grade: Usually a mixture, probably tough, plus an overnight camp
Staying at: Paekakariki Holiday Park
https://maps.google.com/maps?ll=-40.975121,174.961288&z=16&t=m&hl=en&gl=US&mapclient=embed&cid=12319556028368578755
Exact ride details to be confirmed (i.e. made up on the day), but will be epic and will include Whareroa Farm (including Capt. SMeeres track) and beyond.
__NOTE__!! For those wishing a cabin for the Saturday night, you *MUST* pre-book your accommodation at:
http://www.paekakarikiholidaypark.co.nz/
(or call them). They have a minimum number of cabins available, plus some tent sites.
We won't be making any bookings, and the place books up quickly, so if you want to stay Saturday night then make sure you log-in or call them and book ASAP.
Bring a change of clothes and something to sleep in if you plan to stay over.
Non-members are welcome to join the club!

events.id: Sapphic Somatics: A Queer Embodiment Workshop-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sapphic Somatics: A Queer Embodiment Workshop
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.long_description:
Somatic: Of or relating to the body, particularly the perception of physical sensations and internal experiences

What does it feel like to exist in a queer body? This workshop aims to help sapphic women and gender minorities find joy, freedom, and connection through somatic exercises that help you embody and embrace your queerness. You will leave feeling confident in your ability to take up space, tapped into your self-expression, and connected to the experiences of your sapphic community.

Here’s a rundown of what to expect:
- Opening Exercise: Guided somatic movements to loosen up your body
- Community Connection: Rotating conversations with other participants about queer embodiment
- Yoga Flow: Creative 30 minute class to explore presence and connect to your self-expression
- Guided Meditation: A relaxing combination of breathwork and visualisation to cultivate safety in your body
- Closing Connection: Gentle and grounding partner stretches (optional) and group reflections

No prior experience with yoga or somatic exercises necessary! All you need to attend is an open attitude, a desire to connect with your body, and a willingness to share your experience with other sapphics. Yoga mats and all other props will be provided. While this workshop dives into your embodied expression of sapphic identity/sexuality, none of the content is sexual in nature and the small amount of physical touch with other participants is completely optional.

The workshop is facilitated by Megan Edwards, creator of Golden Hour Gigs and a 500CYT trauma-informed yoga teacher. This event is intended specifically for queer women and gender minorities. No TERFS no SWERFS.

Content consideration: Because this workshop focuses on finding joy/pleasure/freedom in your body, it might not be suited for anyone experiencing intense dysphoria. With that said, you are welcome to explore discomfort and work on integrating challenging feelings. Megan is trained in movement techniques to lead you away from anything too activating and help you find safety in your body.

Accessibility: Awhi Yoga Studios has an elevator and is wheelchair accessible. There are plenty of gender neutral bathrooms and cosy spaces to rest if you need a break from the workshop at any time. If you want to attend but are concerned about the level of movement required, please email the organiser with any mobility questions at goldenhourgigz@gmail.com

events.id: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26-Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26
events.venue: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary

Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea. Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals. We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.

Please note open days are weather dependent and in the event of rain we will normally rearrange to the following saturday.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather. No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space. Sadly, dogs are not welcome as we have a lot of vulnerable animals on site. Depending on the weather, your clothing and footwear might get muddy, so please wear clothing that isn’t too precious.

If you have questions about accessibility please these questions email us before you arrive. Unfortunately, the sanctuary is not wheelchair accessible.

Make a day of it!- we are 5 mins away from some lovely river spots on the Ōtaki river and 20 mins from Ōtaki town and beach.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather.
No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space.

events.id: Death Cafe Newtown-7A Rintoul St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Death Cafe Newtown
events.venue: 7A Rintoul St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Death Cafe runs monthly on the 2nd Saturday.
Let's normalise our own demise! We are all going to die, let's talk about it. At a Death Café people - often strangers - gather to eat cake, drink tea and discuss death. Death Café is not a grief support group, or counselling session - instead it is a place to discuss death without expectations. The objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'.
For more information about Death Cafes generally, check deathcafe.com
For any pātai about this Death Cafe, email info@newtowncommunity.org.nz / call 04 389 4786

events.id: Foraged Basketry - December-65 Wallace Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Foraged Basketry - December
events.venue: 65 Wallace Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our ancestors, no matter where in the world they came from, knew how to weave baskets, nets and vessels from what they found around them. Join artist Hannah Schickedanz to rediscover the art of twined and woven basket-making, using grasses, Montbretia, Convolvulus and other foraged flora. You'll take home at least one small basket and a useful skill, enabling you to create baskets from any number of fibres found in nature.
Coeliac friendly afternoon tea will be provided, please let me know if you have any other dietary requirements.

events.id: L-Side NZ Debut Tour (WLG)-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: L-Side NZ Debut Tour (WLG)
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
L-Side NZ Debut Tour (WLG)
We are stoked to present one of DnB’s best for his first ever show in the capital, the one and only L-Side!

Hailing from São Paulo, Brazil, L-Side has been a mainstay in the drum and bass scene worldwide with releases on labels such as V Recordings, Hospital Records, The North Quarter and many, many more. Developing his own unique style, L-Side is known for his contrast of upfront and aggressive rolling basslines, merged with funk and soul samples and vocals, which has forged a beautifully fresh take on drum and bass.

On support we have some heavy hitters from our endlessly talented Wellington community: Pearly, Echotek, Edii & Gusty as well as Rhythm Output’s very own Gos & Fe joined by Timmy P.

Event runs 11pm-3am

events.id: Merry Hub-mas! Free Children’s Party-Ōtaki East Community Emergency Hub, Ōtaki Baptist Church, 2 Te Manuao Road, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Merry Hub-mas! Free Children’s Party
events.venue: Ōtaki East Community Emergency Hub, Ōtaki Baptist Church, 2 Te Manuao Road, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Christmas at Your Community Emergency Hub!

In an emergency, your neighbours are your best source of support — so come meet them in a fun, friendly and free way!

Families of all shapes and sizes are invited to join WREMO at your local Community Emergency Hub for a very merry time.

Here’s what’s in store:

- Christmas crafts
- Delicious candy
- “Disaster-ready” games
- A chance to learn about your Community Emergency Hub

Children under 14 must be supervised by an adult.

Come for the fun, stay for the catchups, knowing your neighbours is the best kind of preparedness!

events.id: Nutcracker High Tea-Hippopotamus Restaurant and Bar, Level 3, 90 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nutcracker High Tea
events.venue: Hippopotamus Restaurant and Bar, Level 3, 90 Cable Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
QTea twirls into a sun-drenched daydream with a high tea inspired by The Nutcracker. In partnership with the Royal New Zealand Ballet, we’re serving a festive fairytale where Christmas meets choreography – with a Kiwiana twist.

Perched above the harbour, QTea High Tea reimagines its plated treats into a sugar plum dreamland. Think raspberry-layered delights, golden pistachio choux, smoked salmon cups and piroshki that dance on the palate.

Sip in style and cheers to the season with The Mouse King’s Toast, Prosecco and Guignolet fizzing with festive sparkle. Craving something a little nuttier? Try The Storm Master’s Tipple. For pure summer magic in a glass, reach for the Sugar Plum Fairy Fizz.

events.id: Artists and their love of plants - Part 1 - Guided Walk-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Artists and their love of plants - Part 1 - Guided Walk
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
All over the world, and over centuries, artists have painted, wood-blocked and carved trees and other plants, and used them in other art forms. Many of these plants can be found in the Wellington Botanic Gardens. On this gentle 60-minute walk, starting and ending at the Founders’ Entrance in Glenmore Street, we will look at those plants and pictures of the artworks related to them. Artists will include Vincent van Gogh, Hiroshige, and New Zealanders Don Binney and Rei Hamon.
Meet at the Founders’ Entrance, Glenmore Street.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.
This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: 2025 Greytown Santa Parade-Main Street, Greytown, Main Street, Greytown, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: 2025 Greytown Santa Parade
events.venue: Main Street, Greytown, Main Street, Greytown, Greytown
events.long_description:
Celebrate the season with Greytown’s annual Santa Parade - an afternoon of festive fun, community spirit, and creative flair. The parade begins at 2pm on Saturday, 13 December 2025, bringing music, colour, and holiday cheer to the streets of Greytown. This free event is proudly presented by South Wairarapa Rotary.

Local businesses, schools, clubs, and community groups are invited to take part by entering a float. There’s no cost to register, and all entries are welcome. Prizes will be awarded across several categories, including Mayor’s Choice, Best Tractor or Farm Vehicle, Most Creative Concept, Best Business Representation, Best Youth Entry, and Best Overall Floats (1st, 2nd, and 3rd place).

After the parade, the festivities continue with Carols at Cobblestones from 3:30pm (koha entry). It’s a joyful celebration of connection and creativity in the heart of our region.

To register your float, scan the QR code on the event poster or contact the organisers directly.

events.id: Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two-Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Step into the magic of the season with Le Ciel’s Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two.

In this joyful, hands-on workshop, you and your partner will work together to build and decorate your very own festive gingerbread house. Our pastry chefs will guide you through every step — from assembling the spiced gingerbread walls to piping intricate icing details and adding those whimsical finishing touches.

Each station will be fully equipped with pre-baked gingerbread pieces, an array of colourful candies, royal icing, and everything you need to let your creativity shine. Sip on a comforting hot chocolate or mulled wine as holiday music fills the air, and create a show-stopping centrepiece to take home (if you can resist eating it first!).

Whether you’re looking for a fun date idea, a festive afternoon with a friend, or a family-friendly treat, this class is a perfect way to kick off the Christmas spirit.

$120 per pair | All materials included
Duration: 2 hours
Location: Le Ciel, 100 Tory street
Spaces are limited — book early to secure your spot for this festive favourite!

Includes:

Pre-baked gingerbread house pieces ready for assembly

Royal icing and a selection of edible decorations

A hot chocolate or mulled wine on arrival

Expert guidance from Le Ciel pastry chefs

A beautifully packaged gingerbread house to take home

Price: $120 per pair

events.id: In person Family Constellation Workshop in Wellington-Brooklyn-Facebook
events.name: In person Family Constellation Workshop in Wellington
events.venue: Brooklyn
events.long_description:
Join the Transformative Family Constellation Workshop in Wellington, Facilitated by Ale!
Are you noticing repeated patterns in your life? Struggling with relationships or workplace challenges or seeking a profound shift? This one-day workshop offers a powerful opportunity to address the root causes of life’s challenges on a deep, soul level through the wisdom of your family system.
Experience the extraordinary healing modality discovered by Bert Hellinger as you connect with the morphogenetic field of family systems. By representing a family member in a constellation, you’ll witness firsthand the astonishing insights and transformations this approach provides.
Family Constellation Can Help You:
Uncover and resolve relationship difficulties.
Break free from patterns of conflict or limitation.
Reveal the soul-level causes of allergies, illnesses, accidents, or infertility.
Gain clarity and healing around any life circumstance that concerns you.
No prior experience or special skills are needed—just an open heart and a willingness to explore.
Seats are Limited—Reserve Your Spot Now!
Don’t miss this unique opportunity to uncover the hidden dynamics of your family system and take a transformative step forward.
EARLY BIRD SPECIAL PRICE!
>>>BOOK NOW to get the early bird special price of $88 instead of $111! Only the first 5 participants save $23 with the Early Bird on each booking<<<
Please reach out to 0210332049 or shiningsoul.nzar@gmail to book your spot!
We're looking forward to having you at the workshop!
In service to life with deep love,
Ale

And special guest band “Butter Wouldn't Melt” - Americana bluegrass, and country influences with a distinctly New Zealand flavour will take the stage at 4pm.

events.id: Explore Chinese Traditional Festivals-11 Bunny St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Explore Chinese Traditional Festivals
events.venue: 11 Bunny St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for an engaging lecture that delves into the heart of Chinese traditional festivals! In this session, we'll take you on a captivating exploration of some of China's most significant celebrations: the Spring Festival, Lantern Festival, Qingming Festival, Dragon - Boat Festival, Qixi Festival, and Mid - Autumn Festival.
This lecture will not only provide a vivid introduction to these Chinese festivals but also offer an opportunity to compare and contrast them with New Zealand's cultural practices. You'll gain a deeper understanding of the rich tapestry of Chinese culture, its traditions, and the stories behind the festivals. Don't miss out on this cultural exchange!
See you there!

events.id: KinoFest goes Wellington - Greetings from Mars-Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: KinoFest goes Wellington - Greetings from Mars
events.venue: Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
KinoFest goes Wellington!
After a successful run in Auckland, the Goethe-Institut New Zealand is bringing KinoFest to Wellington with two special screenings.

On 13 December 2025, we present Greetings from Mars — a heartwarming and imaginative coming-of-age story.
Ten-year-old Tom is different: he hates change, loud noises, and anything red. When he’s sent to spend six weeks with his siblings at their grandparents’ house, he transforms the experience into a full-blown Mars mission. Along the way, Tom discovers unexpected courage, connection, and new sides of himself.

A tender and humorous film about family, neurodiversity, and the power of imagination — perfect for audiences of all ages.

The screening starts at 4:00 PM, but feel free to join us from 3:30 PM for snacks and drinks in the foyer.

Greetings from Mars: Family, 2024, 82 minutes
German with English subtitles
Suitable from 6 years of age.

events.name: Upper Hutt Santa Parade 2025
events.venue: Main St, Upper Hutt Central, Upper Hutt 5018
events.long_description:
Upper Hutt Santa Parade 2025
The 2025 Upper Hutt Santa Parade is set to be another exciting event, so mark your calendars for Sunday 14 December 2025! Rain or shine Main Street on Sunday 14 December 2025 from 3.00 pm.

What’s New This Year?
This year’s Santa Parade theme is Lights, Camera, Christmas! We all have a favourite Christmas movie! Bring your favourite Christmas movie to life with a Christmas movie themed float. Whether it’s Home Alone, the Polar Express or even Die hard...

It’s not too late to get involved!
We’d love to see your creativity shine in this year's parade! Whether you're a local business, school, or community group, we encourage you to design and enter a float to bring your movie to life. One thing though we need a sign card saying the movie title on your float.

An invitation is extended to all business and community groups operating in Upper Hutt to join this community event and enter a Christmas movie themed float in the Parade.

events.name: Queensgate Night Market
events.venue: Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations. The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 27th September 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

events.id: LE MAU-"Sāmoa mo Sāmoa"-Hutt City New Life Church,237 Cambridge Terrace, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: LE MAU-"Sāmoa mo Sāmoa"
events.venue: Hutt City New Life Church,237 Cambridge Terrace, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
LE MAU-"Sāmoa mo Sāmoa"
"Samoa filemu pea, ma si o'u toto ne'i ta'uvalea, a ia aoga lo'u ola mo lenei mea"- Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III

About this Event

TAUTUA DANCE PRESENTS.
LE MAU-"Sāmoa mo Sāmoa"
Event Location: Hutt City New Life Church
Join us for an inspiring production that highlights the journey of Sāmoa’s road to independence, a journey shaped by resilience and courage in the face of adversity. Feel the deep emotions of heartache and the joy of triumph as we celebrate our connection to the oceans and mountains. Experience the transformation from hiding our culture to embracing it with pride and determination.

Tautua Dance School invites you to embark on a powerful journey rooted in real stories of our people. Don’t miss this chance to be inspired—secure your tickets now and witness our amazing production.

TAUTUA!!! SAUUU IAAAA



Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:30 PM
SIVA AFI SHOWCASE
Host: TAUTUA SIVA AFI CLASSES
Info: All our Tautua Siva Afi classes will be opening our night with their class routines they've been working on for the last two terms. The classes that will be on display are: PORIRUA BEGINNERS, HUTT VALLEY BEGINNERS, WELLINGTON BEGINNERS, PORIRUA INTERMEDIATE and our TAUTUA COMPETITORS.


🕑: 06:30 PM - 08:00 PM
LE MAU- SĀMOA MO SĀMOA
Info: !!!!PRODUCTION TIME!!!!


🕑: 08:00 PM - 09:00 PM
TAUTUA DANCE SCHOOL'S ANNUAL PRIZEGIVING
Info: Our annual prizegiving, where we get to honour our students in every class and find out who our TAUTUA STUDENT OF THE YEAR is.

events.id: Cantina Comedy-Sunday Cantina, 31 Poplar Avenue, Raumati South, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Cantina Comedy
events.venue: Sunday Cantina, 31 Poplar Avenue, Raumati South, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Cantina Comedy is back at Raumati's entertainment hub, Sunday Cantina.

12 comedians will be walking under the spot light to bring you the LOLs. Who will it be? It could be an experienced comedian, a newbie, a local mirth maker or a touring trouble maker.

What you going to hear? Well rehearsed script, a work in progress, a brand new joke, puns, improv, props but it is all designed to make you laugh.

You can also get involved. Drop a topic in the jar and few comedians will try to blind riff off them as they are drawn at random. Could be comedy gold or a complete car crash.

Gather your mate, buy your tickets and book a table. Come early and grab a meal before the fun starts.

events.id: In the Rume with-17 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: In the Rume with
events.venue: 17 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It's here... Rume's very first large-scale event on Saturday 13th December in Porirua at Pātaka Art + Museum!
In the Rume with is an event designed for gals aged 17-35–a night of wholesomeness, curated spaces, and shared stories. It’s a parallel to our first online series where you'll be able to connect and talanoa in person with some of our featured women (announcing soon). 
Our heart is to build community for women through storytelling and connection. We believe there's room for everyone at the table and know that this will be a special evening where you can come and leave inspired.
You'll be free to enjoy the room at your pace, with immersive activations and surprise treats throughout the night. Of course we'll have yummy kai, snacks and drinks supplied by local sponsors. 
Get your besties together and make a gals night out of it!!! Don’t miss this opportunity to connect with gals in your community, learn from our beautiful features and have some fun before the end of the year. 
Tickets are very limited so get in quick! See you in the Rume 😍
P.S. check out our socials / website for more info!

events.name: Stagecraft Christmas Party
events.venue: Atlas House, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Calling all the Dames and Breeches parts for some silly pantomime fun this Christmas. Grab your lamp and a handful of beans, slip on your boots or glass slippers and pop on down to Stagecraft's annual Christmas party - panto style!
All are welcome to come and celebrate another year with your Stagecraft family. Some drinks and nibbles will be provided but please BYO anything you particularly want to share.
Costumes not required but always welcome and there may be a selection of silly items for you to play dress-ups with at the theatre too.
We will celebrate another great year for the Stagecraft community, but also take a moment to remember our dear friend Rodney Bane who left us this year - which we will do in true Rodney style ...
There will also be the annual awarding of the Marilyns, Stagecraft's own special thank you to some of the great people who support our theatre group.

events.id: Handel's Messiah-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Handel's Messiah
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrate the festive season with a magnificent performance of Handel’s Messiah on Saturday, 13 December, at 7:30 pm in the Michael Fowler Centre. Presented by Orpheus Choir Wellington in collaboration with Orchestra Wellington, this timeless masterpiece has been a beacon of holiday joy for centuries, blending grandeur, beauty, and drama in equal measure.

Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work. From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.

Joining Brent is a stellar lineup of soloists. Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry. Mezzo-soprano Maaike Christie-Beekman adds depth and warmth with her rich, expressive voice. Rising tenor Lila LJ Crichton contributes freshness and flair, while Lexus Song Quest winner Joel Amosa grounds the quartet with his commanding bass.

The Michael Fowler Centre, renowned for its superb acoustics and stunning architecture, provides the perfect setting for this extraordinary concert. With its sweeping choruses, unforgettable arias, and sheer emotional power, Messiah is the ultimate way to mark the festive season.

Come and join us for an evening of musical brilliance that will have you saying, Hallelujah!

Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work.
From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.
Joining Brent is a stellar lineup of soloists.
Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry.

events.id: End of Year Party Time with The Closet-125 Featherston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: End of Year Party Time with The Closet
events.venue: 125 Featherston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Save the Date: Saturday, December 13!

The rumours are true… after much soul-searching (and to give our neighbours a breather!) The Closet is taking a year off from Kiwiburn. BUT ~ don’t worry the closet doors aren’t closing just yet… we're throwing an end of year party for you all to keep the fruity vibes alive!
We're bringing the pre-burn heat early this year with an epic night at our fabulous friends Champagnaria bar Otto, and we want your beautifully creative minds to help create the party…
Theme TBD >>>>
We want YOU to dream up the wildest, weirdest, most wonderful party themes you can think of. Send us your ideas & the top picks will go to a public vote.
Winner scores two FREE tickets + a bottle of bubbles to pop at the party!
The Lineup so far is already looking epic:
• Seraph – delivering her signature melodic uplifting magic
• Tori – back with the booty-shaking, baddy bass we all crave
• More DJs to be announced soon!
While we won’t be fundraising for the Burn this time, we are raising funds to secure long-term storage for our fabulous clothes & infrastructure… So The Closet can return next year bigger, better, and even more fabulous.
Stay tuned. Start dreaming. Get ready to party like its the end of 2025!

events.id: Star Time | Album Fundraiser Show @ Meow-9 Edward Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Star Time | Album Fundraiser Show @ Meow
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Aotearoa’s very own Afrobeat Jazz powerhouse STAR TIME is back for one more spectacle before the year ends, and it’s going to be their most special one yet.
In 2025, Star Time have embarked on an unprecedented run of music releases and performances, including the release of their debut singles “Moto Moto” and Cannon”, which proved themselves to be ones to watch amongst the live scene here in Aotearoa.
Alongside these achievements, they spent four days in the studio composing and perfecting their upcoming album, ‘We Are Here’ which is set to be released in 2026. In order to successfully fund the release of this project, they are putting on the ultimate Star Time experience one last time to wrap up 2025.
This also marks the last show send off for their fellow saxophonists Jack Harris and Isaac Randel as they head overseas next month for good.
If you cannot make the gig, there are options to donate via the ticketing link which will give money directly to the band, but will not grant entry to the show.
Special guests to be announced.

events.id: mHz : Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 / Te Tumu-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: mHz : Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 / Te Tumu
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Mo H. Zareei aka mHz is an Iranian sound artist and researcher based in New Zealand. His practice spans electronic compositions, kinetic sound-sculptures, and audiovisual installations. Using custom-built software and hardware, his work often aims to uncover the beauty in the fundamentals of sound and light production, and reductionist audiovisual elements that draw inspiration from physical and architectural principles.
Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 involves a series of electromechanical instruments built to extend the territory of noise and glitch beyond the digital realm, while paying conscious homage to Brutalism: an unapologetic celebration of raw material through rigorous formalism, where noise replaces concrete. Despite its experimental raw materials, the formal structure of the work is established through purely grid-based and club-style rhythms and repetition is used to bring accessibility to noise.
https://millihertz.net/
https://vimeo.com/818597372
---
TE TUMU
Ka whakaputa mai au i Te Kore - From the Void I emerge. Ancient resonance future sound. Submerged dub rhythms and murky unprocessed bass with soaring taonga pūoro. Experimental, indigenous, slow dance.
$15 presales via UTR
$20 doors / $10 unwaged
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Girls Rock The Boys - Wellington-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Girls Rock The Boys - Wellington
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POWERHOUSE WOMEN SINGERS: CLASSIC ROCK FROM THE BANDS OF MEN: A KICKASS LIVE BAND
Girls Rock the boys is back—bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage.
This time, it’s Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, with a stellar band behind them: Andrew Richardson (drums), Matt Fitzpatrick (bass), Aslan Rowlands (guitar), and Duncan Haynes (keys).
We’re diving deep into the golden era of rock—Journey, Whitesnake, Boston, Foreigner, Rainbow, and Deep Purple, all delivered with the energy of a rugby pitch and the comfort of your favourite dressing gown.
Whether you’re waving your phone torch to Foreigner, headbanging to Rainbow, or playing air guitar to Deep Purple, you’ll find something to do with yourself in every “mini EP” set.
The band are amazing - the singers nail it, and we've added new songs!
Need a breather? The wonders at Underworld will sort you a drink and a plate.
Feedback from our last gig: “Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking—check them out!”
Come and see us - we love it when you do!
🎟️ Early bird tickets just $20. Door sales $30.
💔 A special shout-out to our inaugural bass player, Callum Black, who’s heading overseas. You’ve been an inspiration, Callum. We’ll work to do you proud.

events.id: Fine Signs Crazyman 2025-Hutt City,49 Waterloo Rd, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Fine Signs Crazyman 2025
events.venue: Hutt City,49 Waterloo Rd, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Fine Signs Crazyman 2025
Established in 1991, the Fine Signs Crazyman is the Wellington region's longest running multisport event. Based around the icon outdoor elements of Hutt City, this 56k scenic tour showcases the hills, beaches, harbour and river that make our Capital the outdoor wonderland that it is.

Scheduled for December 14th in 2025, you can take it on either solo or in a team. Options include the full multisport format (13k Kayak, 28k Mountain Bike, 13k Trail Run) or the duathlon (mountain bike/trail run).

This challenging but achievable event embraces all ages, abilities and backgrounds. In short, you'd be "crazy not to" contemplate the Crazyman... It's a "Hell of an event"!

events.venue: Ivy Bar and Cabaret, 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tired of your usual Christmas themed drag shows and craving something a little more twisted? Back from the dead, Ness Quick brings you Stigmata, the Resurrection. Reject holiday cheer and join us in a celebration of all things sinful, join us as we delve deep into the twisted minds of our artists. From the Devil himself, to his sexy seven sins, all are welcome at Stigmata. So leave the rosary beads and home, and make sure to book a confession with priest beforehand, and come down to Ivy Bar for an evening so ungodly, Saint Nicholas will be leaving coal in your stocking for the rest of your life.

Hosted by Ness Quick,
Featuring;
Cailiah
Faux Femme
Veronica Heart
Miss Gendered
Maxxine Goth
Rocky Rhodes

We strive to provide a safe space for all queer people from all backgrounds. If concerned about the venue, access or any other queeries regarding the show, please send an email to croi.osullivan@gmail.com. You are also welcome to reach out via my Instagram, @theonly_nessquick
Doors open at 9:30 for a 10pm start. No Stag Dos

events.id: L-Side NZ Debut Tour (WLG)-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: L-Side NZ Debut Tour (WLG)
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We are stoked to present one of DnB’s best for his first ever show in the capital, the one and only L-Side!
Hailing from São Paulo, Brazil, L-Side has been a mainstay in the drum and bass scene worldwide with releases on labels such as V Recordings, Hospital Records, The North Quarter and many, many more. Developing his own unique style, L-Side is known for his contrast of upfront and aggressive rolling basslines, merged with funk and soul samples and vocals, which has forged a beautifully fresh take on drum and bass.
On support we have some heavy hitters from our endlessly talented Wellington community: Pearly, Echotek, Edii & Gusty as well as Rhythm Output’s very own Gos & Fe joined by Timmy P.
Event runs 11pm-3am

events.id: Wine Zen - A symphony for the senses-Allan Scott Bistro,Blenheim, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wine Zen - A symphony for the senses
events.venue: Allan Scott Bistro,Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wine Zen - A symphony for the senses
Take a breath and let your senses lead you. Join us for Wine Zen at Allan Scott Bistro at Allan Scott Family Winemakers – a sensory journey into mindfulness, connection, and the quiet beauty of wine.

We begin with a grounding meditation and explore five mindful techniques that awaken each of our senses before heading behind the scenes on a private tour with owner and winemaker Josh Scott.

The morning concludes in the Bistro with a guided sensory wine and food pairing that deepens our appreciation for flavour, texture, and the stories within each glass.

Spaces are limited! Reserve your place for a morning of calm, curiosity, and connection among the vines.

events.id: Cooking Class: Sri Lankan cutlets-The Beer Engine,1 Potts Ln, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Cooking Class: Sri Lankan cutlets
events.venue: The Beer Engine,1 Potts Ln, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Cooking Class: Sri Lankan cutlets
Sri Lanka has been hit with devastating floods, and thousands of families have lost their homes and livelihoods overnight. 100% of this events proceeds will going to disaster relief in Sri Lanka.

Come join us, learn the art of Sri Lankan cutlet-making, eat well, and make a difference at the same time. Good food. Good people. A real impact when it’s needed most.

For any questions, please email

Can You Stop at One? (We dare you!)
A Sri Lankan cutlet is history disguised as a snack. European croquettes crash-landed on the island centuries ago, and Sri Lankans didn’t just borrow the idea — they rewired it. Fish and potato for thrift, chilli and mustard seed for heat, curry leaf and lime for brightness, all sealed in breadcrumbs and fried in coconut oil. One bite tells you everything about the island: layered trade routes, colonial collisions, ingenuity in the kitchen, flavour turned into defiance. It’s super-tasty — crisp, molten, impossible to stop at one.

Now you get to make your own and learn a bit about Sri Lankan culture.

We’re running a hands-on cutlet class where flavour is learned by instinct, not measuring spoons. You mix, taste, adjust, and chase that perfect balance of heat, comfort and citrus brightness. We bring every ingredient; you bring an appetite and the willingness to get your hands involved.

We’re being hosted by the crew at The Beer Engine — and their Yuzu Hazy is the move. Bright and citrusy, it slices through the richness and wraps around the spice in a way that makes you sit back and swear under your breath. When the frying’s done, we sit together and eat your creations with simple rice and Aiyō dhal. Big flavour, cold beer, good people. The kind of night food lovers remember.
events.description:
Come join us, learn the art of Sri Lankan cutlet-making, eat well, and make a difference at the same time.
Good food.
A Sri Lankan cutlet is history disguised as a snack.
Fish and potato for thrift, chilli and mustard seed for heat, curry leaf and lime for brightness, all sealed in breadcrumbs and fried in coconut oil.
When the frying’s done, we sit together and eat your creations with simple rice and Aiyō dhal.

events.id: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032,91 Ruapehu St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032,91 Ruapehu St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
Come and be held in a ceremony of sound. Sunday 14th, from 2:22 PM to 4:04 PM at Lotus Yoga, Papamaru, an immersive Sound Journey awaits you.

This is a time and space to breathe, release, and be nurtured by the deep vibrations of medicinal instruments including Didgeridoo, HandPan, Jaw Harps, Shamanic Drone Flute, Shamanic Drum, Mongolian Throat Singing (Sygyt and Khoomei), and more — all amplified and layered through a loop station.

Comfortably lying down, you’ll be guided on a relaxing, clearing, and rejuvenating inner journey. This transformative experience supports your nervous system, helping to release tension and restore calm and presence.

Benefits of Sound Healing
-Mental clarity and emotional balance
-Deep relaxation and revitalization
-Enhanced focus and memoryBetter sleep quality
-Strengthened immune response
-Boosted creativity
-Heightened self-awareness and environmental sensitivity

What to Bring
- Comfortable clothing
- A mattress, pillow, blanket, eye mask — anything to support your full comfort
- Water bottle
- An open heart

Event GuidelinesTo create a held and focused space:
- Please silence your phone before entering
- Arrive on time — we recommend 2:12 for a smooth, grounded start. Doors close at 2:22 PM sharp.

Please book your ticket, place limited !


This offering is part of the Kohael Project, where I (Justin) and fellow co-creators offer well-being practices in exchange for koha or donation — supporting personal transformation and collective healing.
More info : https://kohael.com/Live music and more : https://www.youtube.com/@kohaelproject/playlists https://www.instagram.com/kohaelproject/
Support the project and the Kohael Truck : https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/kohaelprojectonwheels

Thank you for reading, and see you soon

.With gratitude and love,
Justin

events.id: The Tui Express-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Tui Express
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Travel in style behind steam locomotive Jb 1236 “Joanne”, hauling our fleet of comfortable Ao carriages – complete with large panoramic windows, air conditioning, and heating.
Sit back and enjoy a scenic journey from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay, taking in the stunning coastal views and Kapiti Island as we head north through the Kapiti Coast and into the Manawatu countryside. The trip includes spectacular views of the Manawatu Gorge and the new Te Ahu a Turanga highway crossing the Tararua Ranges.
Our onboard buffet carriage will be open throughout the journey, offering a selection of food and drinks for purchase.
When we arrive at Mangatainoka, a short bus transfer (or an easy 10-minute walk) will take you to the Tui Brewery. There, you’ll enjoy a gourmet BBQ lunch served in the original Flagon Room, including a complimentary drink (beer, cider, or sauvignon blanc). Each guest also receives a Mangatainoka Passport filled with vouchers to redeem at the brewery.
Please select the lunch option when booking your train tickets.
⸻

Plimmerton 7.45am
Paraparaumu 8.25am

Mangatainoka 2.25pm

events.description:
Travel in style behind steam locomotive Jb 1236 “Joanne”, hauling our fleet of comfortable Ao carriages – complete with large panoramic windows, air conditioning, and heating.
Sit back and enjoy a scenic journey from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay, taking in the stunning coastal views and Kapiti Island as we head north through the Kapiti Coast and into the Manawatu countryside.
The trip includes spectacular views of the Manawatu Gorge and the new Te Ahu a Turanga highway crossing the Tararua Ranges.
Our onboard buffet carriage will be open throughout the journey, offering a selection of food and drinks for purchase.
When we arrive at Mangatainoka, a short bus transfer (or an easy 10-minute walk) will take you to the Tui Brewery.

events.long_description:
Bailamos Bachata! Christmas Dance Party 🎄
🔥 Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks 🔥


🎄Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party 🎄


We’re giving the Wellington teachers a much needed break, so the December Bailamos is going to be 100% social dancing.

Join us for an awesome night of bachata, along with a touch of salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

See you there!

events.id: Give Dragon Boating a Go – Free Sunday Sessions with Pōneke Watersports-43 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Give Dragon Boating a Go – Free Sunday Sessions with Pōneke Watersports
events.venue: 43 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
New to Wellington or just keen to try something new this summer?
Come paddle with Pōneke Watersports, Wellington’s largest dragon boat club!
Join our club paddle sessions and give it a go most Sundays until 14 December at the Wellington Lagoon.
Spaces are limited, so send us a DM with your:
- name
- email
- preferred date
- confirmation that you can swim 50m.
(9th Nov is booked out!!)

Meet at 8:15am for a quick intro, safety briefing, and to meet the crew. Then we’ll head out for a relaxed paddle around the lagoon and waterfront, back by 9:30am.
We’ll teach you everything you need to know.
Just bring:
Clothes you don’t mind getting a bit wet (no jeans)
Sun protection (hat, sunscreen, etc.)
Water shoes or jandals (bare feet are fine)
A good attitude and sense of fun
Ability to swim 50m (H&S requirement)
Dragon boating’s for everyone, from age 20+ to over 70! It’s a great way to get fit, meet people, and join a friendly community. Rain, wind or shine — we paddle either way.

Can't wait to see you there!

events.id: Ethereal Resonance - Sound Immersion-Globe Theatre,318 Main St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Ethereal Resonance - Sound Immersion
events.venue: Globe Theatre,318 Main St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Ethereal Resonance - Sound Immersion
Please note - *THIS IS NOT A SEATED EVENT*.


Ethereal Resonance - Sound Immersion - what is it?

It is a time out.... time for you to focus on self-care, on rest and relaxation as you let the ethereal sounds of the magical quartz crystal singing bowls wash over you.


Please bring with you:
- A yoga mat or equivalent, floor cushions, gravity chair, blankets, pillows, to make a warm and comfortable cocoon, as you will be laying or sitting on a hard wooden floor.

- Any special taonga, crystals, essential oils, drink bottle, journal to aid in your experience.


Kaupapa:
- The evening's focus is about *Intentional Rest and Relaxation* - leave your cares behind as you enter the whare.

- Shoes off - there will be an area set aside in the room for shoes.

- We are in Globe 2 and the doors will be open at 6.10pm.

- Choose a spot and settle in before 6.25pm.

- Short mihi whakatau, housekeeping items. Sound immersion 45mins.

- Interval break: stretch, make a cuppa (herbal teas and dark chocolate provided) in the foyer.

- Resettle - sound immersion 45mins to 1hr.

- Closing karakia (8.30pm).


Koha:
- $25.00 - tickets available from the Globe Theatre, Palmerston North (limited numbers).


If you have any specific questions about the evening, please don't hesitate to contact me on 027 424 7054. I look forward to connecting with you.

Ngā mihi, Jodi
