events.venue: Hippopotamus Restaurant and Bar, Level 3, 90 Cable Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hippo’s turning the New Year’s Eve celebration up a notch. We’re ready to toast the year that was (and is) the only way we know how — with a little harbour sparkle, a lot of flavour, and a healthy dose of Hippo charm.

Join us for a three-course set menu by Chef Antoine featuring your choice of one of three dishes per course. Each plate blends classic French technique with the best of New Zealand’s produce.

Kick things off with Champagne on arrival, dance to the beat of live music, and the kind of flavour that keeps the night flowing.

It’s time to celebrate new beginnings, old friends, new friends and the magic of being back together — the Hippo way.

Tickets are $119 per adult for a 1.5-hour session from 5:30pm – 9:30pm (last sitting), open until late.

Seats are limited. Book your spot and bring in the New Year with a little extra flair.

events.id: Grand New Year's Dinner Dance-Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Grand New Year's Dinner Dance
events.venue: Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
This traditional Tirohana event is back by popular demand.

Held in the elegant Grand Marquee with its French doors, clear window walls, sparkling lit ceiling and Italian fountain courtyard, guests will enjoy a seven course meal (dietary requirements catered for) accompanied by live music from the Neemia family, featuring New Zealand favourite, Drew Ne'emia.

The procession of the haggis is a highlight of the night, as is counting down to midnight and Auld Land Syne with party poppers and noise makers. Dance between courses or make new friends if you would like to share a table with others, or enjoy your own company with your favourite person or friends/family group.

Suitable for couples as well as small or large groups, this event sells out well in advance so please secure your table now and bring in 2026 with the Tirohana team.

Transfers via the courtesy shuttle available from accommodation in Martinborough.

events.long_description:
WELLINGTON NEW YEAR’S EVE 2026 BAR CRAWL | Wellington NYE 2026 Event
Don't Miss Wellington's Biggest Club Crawl of The Year, New Year's Eve 2026 on Wednesday, December 31st @ 4 Premium Clubs

About this Event


🎉✨ WELLINGTON NEW YEAR'S EVE 2026 CLUB CRAWL ✨🎉
Ring in the New Year at Wellington’s Biggest and Hottest NYE Club Crawl! Celebrate New Year’s Eve 2026 with exclusive access to 4 top venues on Wednesday, December 31st, 2025!
This upscale, high-energy club crawl takes you through Wellington’s premier nightlife destinations — all just steps apart. Experience the city’s vibrant party scene, hop between top venues, and celebrate the countdown in style at the final stop as you welcome 2026 in unforgettable fashion!
🎶 Enjoy Top-40, Hip-Hop, R&B, and Live Music
📍 Crawl Stops: TBA — Full lineup of venues to be announced soon!
🕙 Doors Open at 7:00 PM at the first check-in location (TBA)
🎟 Tickets start at $30 Early Bird – grab yours now before early bird prices are gone!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎊 Join Hundreds of NYE Revelers
🚫 No Cover for All Participating Clubs
🎆 Exclusive NYE 2026 Wristband for Club Crawl Access
📱 NYE Crawl Map for Easy Navigation 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Wellington’s Hottest Tracks
🥂 Celebration and Countdown to 2026 at the Final Venue


🚨 Get Tickets NOW Before Prices Increase! 🚨
⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 New Year’s Eve Club Crawl 3 Years Running! This isn’t just a night out — it’s the ultimate NYE experience where you and your crew kick off 2026 with unforgettable memories.
Meet new people, party across Wellington’s hottest clubs, and feel the electric energy that only a true downtown countdown can deliver.
🔥 Nonstop music, packed dance floors, and champagne at midnight — this is how Wellington celebrates! Don’t miss the city’s most anticipated NYE event. Grab your tickets, dress to impress, and let the countdown to 2026 begin!

🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a New Year to remember!
🎉 Let the WELLINGTON NYE 2026 CLUB CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money back in your bank! Guaranteed!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
📍 Check-In Venue: TBA
🕒 7:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM to check in and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:00 PM or explore other participating stops once announced.
OPTIONAL STOPS:
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: These are optional stops — you can visit any of them at your leisure between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM once they’re announced.
FINAL VENUES:
📍 TBA
🕒 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet here by 10:00 PM and stay for the massive NYE countdown party featuring live DJs, dancing, and a midnight champagne toast.
Please note: A Taxi/Uber/Lyft may be required for some stops. The crawl does not provide transportation or shuttle services between venues.
Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Optional Venue” at your convenience between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM or stay at the wristband venue. After 10:00 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate and ring in the New Year together (marked as ‘The Final Stop’ below).
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop, as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Also, wristbands are no longer available after 10:00pm at the first venue.


2025 CRAWL MAP AVAILABLE NOW:
TBA





TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated time at the scheduled venues before 10:00PM. Latecomers won’t be accommodated – no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can't make the check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband to ensure you don’t miss out.
Note Club Schedule: Each venues’s scheduled times are listed in the "DIGITAL BAR LIST." Wristbands (for entry) and any applicable drink specials apply only during these times.
Day-Of Check: Review the "DIGITAL CRAWL MAP" on the event morning for any last-minute details or venue changes.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18 years or older with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Responsible Drinking: Please drink responsibly. We promote a safe, fun environment, but remember, no one should drink and drive. Use designated drivers or rideshare services. Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication or inappropriate behaviour. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.

There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you acknowledge that you are attending at your own risk. Events Per Se, its affiliates, venues, staff, and organizers are not liable for any injuries, accidents, death, loss, or damage that may occur during the event.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you agree to these terms and conditions and accept the inherent risks involved in attending.

events.id: Time for Shenanigans on New Years Eve: CANCELLED-The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Time for Shenanigans on New Years Eve: CANCELLED
events.venue: The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Ring in the New Year at The Empire in Petone With The Shenanigans.

Watch Petone Light up with the Fun and laughter with the talented Band Shenanigans for an Unforgettable night of music, laughter, and dancing as Lower Hutt's biggest New Year's celebrations take over this Iconic Venue.
Be Sure to get in quick with Tickets only $25 it's sure to sell out fast.

From Live Music and A Dazzling Little Light show, this event will "to be sure" send you into next year with a smile.


So come and spend it with us.
Justin, Maurice, Paul And Tom.

And the Wonderful Crew at The Empire We plan to bring back a few of the Memories we all had of the Great Irish Bars we used to play in. Molly's, Kitty's, Murphy's law.

See ya soon Justin
"Tis our Luck to Know ya "

8.30 till 12.15 play time

Shenanigans are one of New Zealand's most accomplished and sought-after bands in Irish Traditional Music today. This young and exciting group creates a sound that is full of energy & innovation, whilst all the time remaining true to their traditional roots.

“Shenanigans was THE breakout band at the Gardens Magic in Wellington NZ".Their energy was infectious and the crowd response was incredible. They were able to connect to all ages, from Mohawked teenagers, to their grandparents. I had heard good things about them, but the musicianship, and stage presence playing live exceeded every expectation I had.” – Alan Thompson Director of Irish music Appreciation society 2013.

Shenanigans garnered much critical acclaim in recent years, even being compared to super groups such as by respected New Zealand Musician Magazine. Their meteoric rise in the music world was given a massive boost in 2011 when they were released their album Live 2005!. Shenanigans subsequently went on to receive the “Best live act on the Good Morning show” from well-respected Tv Presenter and were also named “Best Jokers” at The New Zealand Jokers Awards in 2012.

Following the tremendous success of their debut album “ballyscullymuckery”, the group’s profile was further raised with the release of their follow up title, “Live in your Lounge” in 2018.Nz Musician Magazine described it as having “so many good tracks, so much energy, a band in full control and having such fun yet well able to bring things down to a tearful pause”. Most recently Shenanigans was awarded “Top Band of few” by the a guy down the pub.


Shenanigans is one of New Zealand's hottest bands. Specializing in elegant live preformances, Shenanigans is the perfect choice for your event. Although based in Wellington, we perform regularly throughout the country; including Auckland, Christchurch, and Masterton. Shenanigans is a band seriously worth considering for the best possible wedding music that inspires non-stop dancing. In addition to weddings, we often play at charity events, corporate functions, catered affairs, and private parties. Shenanigans plays the best dance music ever written from the 1930's - present, which includes Irish Classics, Country, Rock-n-Roll, Ethnic, Group Participation, and much more. In addition, we keep our repertoire as cool as we can by constantly learning everyone's favourite songs. This hardworking Wellington wedding band spends a tremendous amount of time learning, reviewing, and ultimately perfecting the music required for each engagement. We play everything live without the artificial computerized support that most of our competitors rely on these days. You will notice that Shenanigans performs every song with a celtic fun twist. There is no better choice for wedding music.

events.long_description:
Trentham Memorial parkrun New Years Day parkrun
Is there a better way to start a New Year by clearing foggy heads from the night before than a 5km parkrun at the very start of the day?

We think not.

So come join us. Bring all the family. Bring all the friends. Bring all the visitors. Bring everyone. And start your day with a huge dose of endorphins and fresh air to help carry you through the next few hours before you fall back asleep.

And if you're not home for New Years, check out where else you could be doing a New Years Day parkrun in New Zealand
https://www.parkrun.co.nz/special-events/


Its almost certain there will be no Fig Tree Cafe post event breakfast as we're sure they'll be taking a well earned holiday to rest and recover before we start keeping them busy again in 2026. But please stayed tuned because we may be able to find somewhere else to feed us that is also nearby.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and hear stories of those who met sad, shocking and untimely ends. This tour traverses some of the older parts of the story where historic headstones mark the stories of lives lost too soon: accidents, murder, misadventure and those who fell by their own hand.
This tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions so is not suitable for everyone.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Gardens Magic-Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell-Wellington NZ
events.name: Gardens Magic
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell
events.long_description:
The Wellington summer nights just got warmer with the return of Gardens Magic. The capital’s talented musicians are on full display across January. The annual event, brought by Wellington City Council, presents a series of free concerts in the Botanic Garden Soundshell. 
Each year, a huge range of music genres is represented across three weeks. Choose from rock, folk, country and western, soul, jazz, pop, reggae and many more. Come early to grab a good picnic spot and sit back and enjoy the show with the whanau or a group of friends. Prolong your stay in the gardens by exploring the evening light display afterwards. The pathways near the Soundshell will be colourfully illuminated between 9 and 10:30pm every evening. During the day, the Botanic Gardens host a Kids Garden Trail and Kids Explorer Days. 
See the full 2026 programme online and keep an eye out for rain day announcements. This is your chance to join in on a beloved local tradition.

events.id: Maoli — Island Vibe Tour-Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Maoli — Island Vibe Tour
events.venue: Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Music with Hawaiian roots will ring out across Waitangi Park in early January. Maoli is heralded as one of Hawaii and Polynesia’s number one commercial recording artists. Led by singer-songwriter Glenn Awong, the group is known for crafting unforgettable music that transcends borders. As one of Hawaii’s most beloved bands, Maoli blends island reggae, country, soul, and contemporary rhythms. The resulting soundscape is sure to transform Wellington’s waterfront park into a summer party zone. 
Formed in 2007, Maoli has since risen to fame with heartfelt songs that connect deeply with listeners. Their journey from small Hawaiian venues to international stages highlights the group’s dedication to music and culture. Maoli’s new album, ‘Last Sip of Summer’, was released in 2025. Expect to hear Glenn’s smooth vocals applied to new songs as well as gems from the back catalogue.
Tickets available to the general public on Thursday, 6 November at 7pm.

Live Nation is thrilled to announce that rising alternative-pop and electronic artist Charlotte Plank will return to New Zealand in January 2026 for two special headline shows.

Fresh off confirmed festival appearances at Rhythm & Vines and Rolling Meadows, Plank will bring her signature fusion of drum & bass, alt-pop and “melantronic” storytelling to intimate venues in Auckland and Wellington.

The run begins Wednesday 7 January at Neck of the Woods, Auckland, before heading to San Fran, Wellington on Thursday 8 January.

General public tickets go on sale Friday 21 November at 12pm NZDT.

For complete tour and ticket information, visit livenation.co.nz.

events.id: Glass Bead-Making Taster - Ōtaki Beach-6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512-All Events In
events.name: Glass Bead-Making Taster - Ōtaki Beach
events.venue: 6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512
events.long_description:
Glass Bead-Making Taster - Ōtaki Beach
Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown the correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver. This class uses gas torches and molten glass.

Pre-made sterling silver findings are available to complete at least one pair of your beads into wearable earrings or a simple pendant on a cord.

Workshop fee $128 early bird $115 till 14 December.

events.id: UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion-Upper Hutt College,Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion
events.venue: Upper Hutt College,Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion
Luke Vilain here - I’m putting together a school reunion for our year. Key details:

Where - UHC fields (probably somewhere behind the astroturf, maybe near the pine trees if shade is needed) - Mrs Van Maren (who is now the deputy principal) has said we can use them 😊
When - Saturday, January 10th, from midday until the food
Food - please BYO picnic and drinks. I'll be organising some toilets and some spare water, as the school won't be open at that stage, therefore no staff to open up the facilities
Activity - it’ll be a relaxed day - with some “back to school” races (egg & spoon, sack race, that sort of thing)
Families / dogs / hangers on - if you’ve got kids, it would be great if you could bring them along – the more chaos, the better 😄

Please forward this event to people that you know that went to UHC! They don't need to strictly have been in the 2000 year, or even have stayed in school until 2000 - the point is to have people come together who haven't seen each other in a long time, but have a shared connection in our teenage years

I'll likely be reaching out to people asking for contact details (like your name, facebook profile, cell phone, vague location), so those that are happy to share with others can do so - I've had a couple people already mention that they'd like to follow up with people and reconnect after all this time. This will obviously be optional (the privacy act and all that 😄)

Really looking forward to seeing you all! Any questions please shout and I'll update the event 😊

events.name: SharePoint Online for Site Owners, 2-Day Training Course in Wellington
events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Please Note: All of our in-person public courses are hosted at wheelchair-accessible venues. If you require any specific assistance, please contact learn@3grow.net to discuss this prior to booking and we will do our utmost to help.
Course Code: SPOSO
Duration: 2 Days
Audience: End Users
Overview
This course is designed to build on the attendees’ existing contributor level knowledge in order to provide the skills to create and manage all aspects of their SharePoint Online sites.
Prerequisites
Delegates attending this course will have completed our ‘SharePoint Online for End Users’ 2-day introductory course, or will have otherwise gained the equivalent level of knowledge.
Module List
Module 1: Site Owner Responsibilities
Module 2: Creating and Managing Sites
Module 3: Site Customisation
Module 4: Permissions and Security
Module 5: Creating & Managing Lists & Libraries
Module 6: Advanced Document Management
Module 7: Power Platform Integration
Module 8: Creating & Managing Content Types
Click here for the full 'SharePoint for Site Owners' course outline

events.name: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃

events.id: Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
Get your kids ready for a fun, screen-free holiday programme full of mindful, holistic activities. Vegan kai will be provided daily too!

About this Event

At Mindful Kids we will explore nature, get creative cooking and crafting, play music and dance, do mindfulness exercises and more in a peaceful, safe environment. The programme has been crafted with care to give your kids the best experience and will be facilitated by a NZ qualified primary school teacher.
The programme will run for three Fridays over the course of three weeks as per details below.
Times: Drop off time: 8.30am - 9am; Pick up time: 3pm - 3.30pm
Dates: Friday 16th January, Friday 23rd January, Friday 30th January
Location: Bhakti Lounge - 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro Wellington
What to bring: A drink bottle, sun protection, weather-appropriate clothing, regular Medic*tion, and walking shoes.
Age range: 7 - 10 year olds
General daily schedule: Each day will run according to the following structure incorporating the daily theme as per below.
8.30 - 9am - Drop off time
9am - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story, circle time
9.30am - Activity
10.30am - Morning tea time
11am - Activity
12.30pm - Lunch time
1.30pm - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story
1.45pm - Activity
2.30pm - Afternoon tea and pack up time
3 - 3.30pm - Pick up time

Activities for each day: Check out the cool activities we will do each day!

Cooking and Crafts Day -16th January
Vegan cooking class - Learn to make sushi, sweets and more..
Masterchef Jr contest
Table decorating and restaurant designing
Arts and crafts afternoon
Nature Day - 23rd January
Nature treasure hunt at Central Park
Decorating pots and gardening
Nature hike
Fun at the playground and flying fox
Picnic at the park
Music and Dance Day - 30th January
Make your own instruments
Disco dancing with disco ball and lights
Dress up costume play
Music and dance games
Talent quest
Programme Facilitator: Our facilitator has a wealth of experience creating rich, engaging activities for tamariki in Aotearoa. As well as being a qualified primary school teacher for six years, she also has a degree majoring in Psycholgy and Spanish, experience running a yoga and wellbeing student club at Victoria University and experience being a school Sports Coordinator. Additionally, she has taught in schools in Spain, been the Positive Behaviour for Learning Team Leader and has initiated mindfulness sessions for teachers at various schools. She was the second in charge coordinator for a holiday programme in Nelson and is now excited to combine all of her skills and experience to give your kids the best experience possible at Mindful Kids.
We hope to see you and your kids soon! :)

Masterchef Jr contest Table decorating and restaurant designing Arts and crafts afternoon Nature Day - 23rd January Nature treasure hunt at Central Park Decorating pots and gardening Nature hike Fun at the playground and flying fox Picnic at the park Music and Dance Day - 30th January Make your own instruments Disco dancing with disco ball and lights Dress up costume play Music and dance games Talent quest Programme Facilitator: Our facilitator has a wealth of experience creating rich, engaging activities for tamariki in Aotearoa.
She was the second in charge coordinator for a holiday programme in Nelson and is now excited to combine all of her skills and experience to give your kids the best experience possible at Mindful Kids.

events.id: Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool
Missed the real deal? Live vicariously with Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool!

After a SOLD OUT Wellington show in early 2025 Insecure Delusion are back in the capital at the famous San Fran to give Tool fans a fix with their tribute to the greats - whether you missed out on the real deal or just want to get out amongst Tool fans again for a night of the best rock songs around - Insecure Delusion are ready to deliver this January 2026!

Rocking out from 9:00pm on Friday the 16th of January, enjoy the tunes that gave Tool a cult-like status amongst devoted fans. Playing fan favourites like The Pot, Stinkfist, Forty Six & 2 and others, it’s the perfect way to get your Tool fix whether you saw them in Auckland or didn't get the chance! It might seem crazy to run a tribute to the greats a couple of months after the legends themselves are here but these lads are a bit mad and they bring that energy to every show!

Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool take the stage with energy and passion for the genres and the musicianship that Tool is known for. An event not to be missed if you're a Tool fiend.

And just to make the night extra special, our friends from Down With The System will be opening with a killer set from the legends that are SOAD!

Earlybirds are available now but only for a limited ticket run! At only $25 per ticket (+ bf), your bank account will be thanking you. 🤘

"I’ve had the chance to see this band twice in Napier. They’re absolutely in keeping with Tool, powerful vocals, a fantastic drummer, and an all-round tight, talented group of guys. Great energy, great music, and genuinely good people." Rion R

"I was completely blown away by the tightness and musicality of these guys. All showcased amazing versatility on their chosen instruments. Would highly recommend to anyone who appreciates quality music. Thanks for an entertaining evening. Smashed it out of the park! " Micheal D


Please note: San Fran has a Supervised Licence meaning under 18s are welcome as long as they are supervised by a responsible adult (usually mum or dad).

events.id: A Century Celebration!-18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: A Century Celebration!
events.venue: 18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
A Century Celebration!
In 1926, at a meeting at the Accounts Chambers in Johnston Street, Wellington, Mrs JW Bell (and her husband) offered to lease three sections of her land for the purposes of establishing a tennis and bowling club in Titahi Bay.

Well Mrs Bell, thanks to your kind offer, we are still here 100 years later and don’t we have some stories and memories to share of those years gone by!

Over the course of Wellington Anniversary weekend (16-18 January 2026), we invite current and former members of the Titahi Bay Tennis Club to come and join us in celebrating this incredible milestone!

In coming months, we will update this post with more information about events planned for the weekend. In the meantime, please put this in your diary, share with friends, family, or perhaps use it as an opportunity to reach out to a former interclub team mate you haven’t seen or heard from in a while and tell them you’ll see them there!

We hope you can join us for what should be a great occasion!



(article : https://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/EP19270114.2.141)

Also check out other Sports events in Porirua, Workshops in Porirua, Meetups in Porirua.

events.id: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute-11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute
events.venue: 11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For over two decades, Tony Lewis has been turning heads and wowing audiences worldwide with his incredible portrayal of Britain’s greatest entertainer — Robbie Williams. Since debuting in Legends in 2002, Tony has performed across the globe, leaving crowds asking, “Is that really…?”
Based in Manchester, England, Tony first met Robbie in 2005, earning his idol’s approval when Robbie said, “I think it’s great, I’m really flattered! It’s bloody hard work being me!”
Three years later, Tony reached the finals of BBC One’s The One and Only, performing to over 7 million viewers each week. His uncanny resemblance and spot-on performance have led to countless TV appearances, promotional campaigns, and even official work for Robbie’s album Rudebox.
Tony has also appeared alongside stars like Simon Cowell, Olly Murs, Stephen Fry, and Ant & Dec — even helping prank Robbie himself on Saturday Night Takeaway!
His show captures all the greatest hits, from the early classics and swing favourites to modern anthems and a touch of Take That. With the looks, the moves, the voice, and the attitude — Tony Lewis truly is Robbie Williams!

events.id: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt-Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
events.venue: Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
This summer, three of Aotearoa’s most beloved bands hit the road for Ready To Roll, a brand-new touring show celebrating New Zealand music and sun-soaked good times. Featuring the legendary Th’ Dudes, iconic Mockers, and multi-platinum favourites Stellar*, the tour will bring timeless hits and unforgettable live energy to some of the country’s most picturesque summer locations.

Ready To Roll pays homage to the iconic TV music chart show that ran from the 1970s through to the 1990s. As New Zealand’s homegrown version of the Top 40 countdown, Ready To Roll became appointment viewing for generations of music fans, a showcase for both international chart-toppers and breakthrough Kiwi acts. It helped launch and cement countless careers while becoming a cultural touchstone in Aotearoa. Reviving the name for this tour nods to its legacy of celebrating great music and good times, a perfect fit for a summer series featuring three of the country’s most enduring and much-loved groups.

events.name: Butter Wouldn't Melt & Ari Leason at Vogelmorn
events.venue: Vogelmorn Bowling Club,93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Butter Wouldn't Melt & Ari Leason at Vogelmorn
Join us for an evening of heartfelt folk music, starting with Ōtaki-born singer-songwriter Ari Leason, whose soulful blend of indie folk and intimate storytelling shines through her debut album Hello Darling. Honest, vulnerable, and deeply authentic, Ari brings songs shaped by activism, travel, and a coming-of-age journey that resonates long after the last note.
Headlining the night, Butter Wouldn't Melt recently released their album Where the roots grow deep, which hit Number 3 on the Aotearoa Music Charts. This 5-piece folk band is made up of Andrea Reid (guitar and vocals) Nick Burfield (guitar and vocals), Marz Connelly (bass and vocals), Mikey Muggeridge (mandolin and vocals), and Cara Brasted (fiddle and vocals). Through powerful harmonies and upbeat instrumentals, they tie together folk, Americana, country, bluegrass styles to bring their own twist to New Zealand storytelling. As timeless as it is deeply personal, you won't want to miss this performance!

Doors: 6:30pm
Music: 7pm

All Ages
Entry Cover charge*
Unwaged $15
Waged $20
Support the Artists $30
*Guide only - booking fees may apply
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/99924/Butter-Wouldnt-Melt-With-Ari-Leason.utr

"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours. The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at ”

events.id: Summer Singing Retreat-2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Summer Singing Retreat
events.venue: 2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Start the new year with intention in a fun and inclusive environment. The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.
Spend the 2 days encircled by a community of like-minded people and focusing on your well-being through singing. Rest, connect, and restore. The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.
We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfillment and joy. And to make the event even more special, Lala will be cooking an authentic Malagasy dinner on Saturday night (an experience not to be missed).
Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands. ALL SINGERS OF ALL LEVELS OF ABILITY ARE WELCOME!!!
Jonathan will teach a mix of pop, folk and original songs, and Lala will teach a mix of songs from South Africa, Georgia, Madagascar and community songs.
If you are coming from out of town, the Home of Compassion offers some accommodation with reasonable rates which includes breakfast. Please contact them directly to enquire islandbay@compassion.org.nz
SCHEDULE
Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church. We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and dinner provided. Please BYO lunch.
Sunday 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay. We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and lunch provided.
The Iskand Bay Presbyterian Church and the Home of Compassion are within walking distance of each other.
Bring a water bottle, swimming togs if you want to swim in Island Bay during lunch time, and a picnic mat for eating outside.

events.id: Marlin’s Dreaming - Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Marlin’s Dreaming - Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.
Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits. 
Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, the starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.
Renowned for their tightly choreographed live shows, the summer tour will add the talents of Tiare Kelly (Benee) on the keys & vocals.  
“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington. As well as playing through our back catalogue, we also have new music to tease, that I’m really excited to try out live,” said Semisi Ma’ia’i frontman of Marlin’s Dreaming.
“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.”
As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.



San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

Wineful Dreams - Create your vision board for 2026
Start your Sunday with creativity, connection, and the taste of possibility. Join us for Wineful Dreams at Forrest Wines, a mindful vision board workshop designed to help you visualise the year ahead.

We begin with reflection and a grounding meditation, then design a personal vision board while enjoying Forrest’s wines and shared platters in a relaxed, inspiring setting.

As the session concludes, stay on for Forrest’s famous Sunday live music and let your vision flow into an afternoon of good wine, laughter, and summer vibes.

Spaces are limited: reserve your spot for a morning for dreaming, creating, and celebrating the beauty of what is to come.

events.id: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest-19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest
events.venue: 19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
HELLO BEACH LOVERS
The Waitārere Forest Long Lunch
- Sunday 18 January 2026
- book your tickets online
Get ready for one of the highlights of our Waitārere summer calendar - the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch is returning on Sunday, 18 January 2026, and it’s looking to be our biggest and best yet!
 Held beneath the towering pines of the Waitārere Forest, this annual event is all about community,   connection, and celebration. The Long Lunch has become a much-loved tradition for residents and visitors alike - a day to relax, share good food, and enjoy the easy-going Waitārere lifestyle that makes our beach so special.
We’re proud to announce that "Gareth Heard and the team from Unique Realty" are now our major sponsors for Long Lunch. Their generous support is helping us make this year’s event extra special, including an exciting $500 cash giveaway to one lucky ticket holder! You must be present on the day to claim the prize, so make sure you don’t miss out on what promises to be an unforgettable afternoon.
Early Bird Tickets: $15* per person (01 Dec - 11 Jan)
Standard Tickets: $20* per person (12 Jan - 17 Jan)
Gate Sales Tickets: $25* per person (18 Jan)
*Fee (per Ticket/Order) 3% + 30c
All tables and chairs are provided - bring your own plates, cutlery, glasses, drinks, and a plate of food to share. From homemade favourites to gourmet treats, the shared tables are always overflowing with creativity, flavour, and generosity.
And don’t forget - the Long Lunch is also a major fundraiser for our community. There will be raffles, auctions, and prizes throughout the day, so bring plenty of cash and help us raise funds for local projects that make Waitārere Beach an even better place to live.
This year’s fundraising focus:
The Upgrade of the Community House Preschoolers' playground on Rua Ave.
It’s more than just a meal - it’s a celebration of our people and our place. Whether you’re a full-time local or here on holiday, you’ll be part of something special: great food, great company, and great memories under the forest canopy.
So gather your friends, pack your picnic gear, and join us for the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch. Let’s make this a summer to remember - full of laughter, flavour, and community spirit.
See you under the pines
on Sunday, 18 January 2026!

events.id: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
He’s had an incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. Stewart Copeland is one of the great rock drummers. He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM). Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show. 
Stewart’s remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world fame between 1977 and 1986, and then again in 2007 and 2008 when the band was reunited. He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts. This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.
events.description:
He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM).
Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show.
He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame.
He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts.
This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.

Having already sold over 2.5 million tickets across Australia and New Zealand to date, Ed Sheeran’s Loop Tour sees the beloved singer returning to our shores with a brand-new live show that’ll follow the release of his new album, Play – out Friday 12 September.
Performing at Sky Stadium in Wellington Ed’s new live show promises to be filled with surprises, new music, as well as his biggest hits.

events.id: Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
Relax and restore in a gentle Reiki Circle designed to balance your energy, calm the mind, and nurture inner peace

About this Event

Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
A soothing Reiki Circle designed to provide gentle biofield support. This session invites relaxation, balance, and heart coherence using a hands-off, consent-based approach. You’ll feel the nurturing energy flowing as you connect with yourself and others in a warm, welcoming space.
Plus - your ticket includes an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert!
This workshop is perfect for anyone experiencing:
•⁠ ⁠Stress and overwhelm
•⁠ ⁠Wired-and-tired fatigue
•⁠ ⁠Overthinking and mental clutter
•⁠ ⁠Sleep disruption
•⁠ ⁠Heaviness in the chest
•⁠ ⁠Creative blocks
Whether you're a beginner or familiar with Reiki, you are warmly welcomed.
What to expect:
•⁠ ⁠Arrival Ritual and Consent: Settle into the space and establish your intention.
•⁠ ⁠Guided Breath Arrival: Begin with a gentle breathing exercise to ground yourself.
•⁠ ⁠Group Reiki Session: Experience a soothing hands-off Reiki session accompanied by a soft soundscape.
•⁠ ⁠Quiet Reflection: Take time to integrate your experience in a peaceful environment.
•⁠ ⁠Grounding Tea: Enjoy a cup of tea to nourish and ground you after the session.
What to bring:
•⁠ ⁠Warm layers and socks
•⁠ ⁠Water bottle
•⁠ ⁠Small towel
•⁠ ⁠Optional eye mask or light scarf
•⁠ ⁠Journal and pen
•⁠ ⁠If you tend to feel cold, consider bringing a blanket
Pre-class prep:
•⁠ ⁠Eat a light meal 2 hours before the class.
•⁠ ⁠Hydrate well throughout the day.
•⁠ ⁠Avoid alcohol and recreational substances for 24 hours prior, ideally 3 days before
•⁠ ⁠Limit caffeine intake 4 hours before class.
•⁠ ⁠Arrive 10 minutes early for intake.
•⁠ ⁠If you have health conditions, check with your provider before attending.
•⁠ ⁠Feel free to email Lynn at hi@lynofuro.co.nz with any questions or concerns.
Contraindications and safety
Reiki is gentle and typically safe, but it's essential to note that it does not replace medical or mental health care. If you have acute psychiatric distress, unmanaged seizures, or are recovering from surgery, please consult your provider first. Inform Lynn if you are wearing a pacemaker or under medications.
Aftercare
After the session, we encourage you to drink plenty of water, nourish yourself with healthy lighter food, engage in simple movement or a short walk, and journal your insights. Emotional waves may continue for 24 to 48 hours, so please reach out if you need support.




Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!


Meet Lynn, your facilitator:
Lynn is an integrative somatic coach and Reiki practitioner dedicated to supporting individuals in navigating corporate burnout, chronic pain, and stress. Her approach is gentle and accessible, making spiritual practices approachable and friendly to the nervous system.
Questions before you join? Email hi@lynofuro.co.nz, and Lynn will support you.



Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
Host: Lynn

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!

events.id: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed Irish band Beoga will make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in January 2026, performing two intimate headline shows in Auckland and Wellington.
Known for their adventurous spirit and willingness to chart new musical territory, Beoga have redefined the possibilities of Irish traditional music. Their global reach was cemented through collaborations with Ed Sheeran on the record-breaking ÷ (Divide) album, including the smash hits “Galway Girl” and “Nancy Mulligan.” The former has now surpassed 1.4 billion streams on Spotify alone.
After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June. The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.
With a GRAMMY nomination, international tours, and collaborations with some of the biggest names in music, Beoga have established themselves as one of Ireland’s most exciting and genre-blurring acts. Their sound fuses accordion, fiddle, keyboards, guitars, and vocals into a vibrant, modern take on Irish roots music that feels both timeless and new.

San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

Join us for a behind-the-scenes tour of Wellington's iconic St James Theatre and The Opera House. Discover hidden stories, architectural splendour, and rich theatrical history as you step behind the velvet curtain and explore two of the city's most beloved performance spaces. Led by expert guides, this tour takes you on a journey through over a century of theatre magic. Tread the boards in the footsteps of legendary performers. events.name: Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit
events.venue: 2351 state highway 3, Sanson, New Zealand 4479,2351 SH 3, Sanson 4479, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit
Pilates is unique in its total body approach to movement. It gives you balance, strength and flexibility, emphasizing the deep postural muscles of the abdomen and back.
All these skills and principles lay a foundation for good riding – Posture, Postural Support, and Body Awareness and Body Control are tools a rider needs in the saddle.
Through carefully designed movements, the correct abdominal and back muscles engage to align the spine maintaining good posture while the horse is moving.
This allows the rider to stay in self-carriage, balanced over the middle of the horse. Suppleness of shoulders, and minimal gripping with legs is then possible.
Many Pilates exercises also develop balance in the muscles of the hip joints to promote maximal range of motion. Many riders have had falls and injuries that contribute towards imbalance which can be fixed with Pilates.
With the rider being balanced and pain free the horse can perform better making the riding relationship harmonious.
Booking is essential
$85.00 per session
$15.00 Arena fee
Payments are due16th January 2026 5pm
Once booked & paid you own it, if you have to cancel please do so before the 16th so we can find someone else, if you have already paid you will receive a refund on filling your spot.
Any cancellations from 16th Jan to time of session there will be no refund given.

events.long_description:
Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
🌸 Silent Retreat – A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection

Hosted by Lisa Conroy from Living the Sweet Life & Tracey Crandall from CharlieRae/TraceyLidene Art

📍 Lotus Yoga & Retreat Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu (a short stroll from the train station)
🗓️ Saturday, 24th January 2026
🕐10.00am - 3.00pm
💰 $125 — all materials provided
🥗 Light refreshments available throughout the day (BYO lunch)
✨ Event Link: https://facebook.com/events/s/silent-retreat-a-day-of-calm-c/1831388837742351/?

Shhh… can you hear it? That gentle whisper calling you back to yourself? 💫
Join us for a day designed to quiet the noise and awaken your inner calm through creativity, meditation, and mindful stillness.

You’ll be gently guided through soulful experiences — from sound bowls and meditation to creative journaling, intuitive art, and sacred self-care. This retreat is your space to exhale, reflect, and simply be. Surrounded by nature, a pond and birdsong.

✨ What’s Included:
🌿 Begin your day with a guided meditation and soothing sound healing
🌿 Infuse your crystal of intention — your quiet companion for the day (and it goes home with you)
🌿 Wander between creative stations at your own pace:

* Write a letter to yourself 💌
* Connect with nature through leaf rubbings & botanical sketches 🌸
* Create an intention or dream page from magazines 🌈
* Try teabag art, intuitive breath drawings, and mandala inserts 🎨
* Pull a symbol stone and reflect on what it means to you 🪶

Your beautiful journal (included) will grow with colour, words, and meaning as the day unfolds.

🌸 Pampering & Peace
Because we all need a little nurturing...
🩷 Foot soak stations (ahh, yes please!)
🩷 Self-pampering including warm stones to hold and melt away tension

Prompts to guide your day:
💫 Inspirational gentle prompts
💫 A space to leave little love notes of encouragement to be shared at the end

A gentle, soul-soothing day to rest, create, and reconnect — surrounded by stillness, soft energy, and kind hearts.
✨ Spaces are limited for this intimate experience.

Contact for further information or to book your place.

🪷Tracey Crandall -
🌸Lisa Conroy -


With Creativity, Sparkle & Soul,
Tracey & Lisa
CharlieRae & Living the Sweet Life

👯‍♀️ Meet your co-creators:
Tracey Crandall and Lisa Conroy are two creative souls who live for colour, connection, and sparking joy. Together, they blend art, play, and nurturing rituals into experiences that lift you up, light you up, and leave you glowing inside and out.

events.name: The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged
events.venue: 118 Tory Street, New Zealand 6011,Garibaldi Club, 118 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged

In the early 70s Cripple was one of the first bands to fall under the influence of The Velvet Underground, a signature ingredient of the Dunedin sound. Lou Reed’s remarkable songwriting - songs like “Sweet Jane” and “I’m Waiting for the Man - found a natural home at the heart of Cripple’s set.

The Velvet Glove reunites three members of that band - John Dodd (Midge Marsden, The Chaps, Skin and Bone), Chris Nichol (The Dunstan Rangers, The Zimmermans) and Lindsay Gregory (The Dunstan Rangers, Heaven Bent). They’re joined by Martin Durrant (Sneaky Feelings, The Zimmermans) and Bill Nichol (Baby) for a one-off performance at The Undercurrent.

Be sure you’re there when The Velvet Glove breathes fresh life into two sets of classic songs from The Velvet Underground catalogue.

The Undercurrent, Saturday January 24.
Doors at 7.00pm
Band at 7.30pm
$20 at Under the Radar (link coming soon!) and the Door.

Snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

We’ll see you there ☆

events.id: Reels for Meals: The Choral-52 Beach Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Reels for Meals: The Choral
events.venue: 52 Beach Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
January's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is The Choral.
The Choral is a 2025 British historical drama film co-produced and directed by Nicholas Hytner and written by Alan Bennett. Set in 1916, during World War I, in the fictional town of Ramsden, Yorkshire, the film follows the members of the local choral society which recruits a group of teenage boys and girls for a performance of Edward Elgar's The Dream of Gerontius, a work chosen because it was not written by a German.
Starring Ralph Fiennes, Roger Allam, Mark Addy, Alun Armstrong, Robert Emms, and Simon Russell Beale.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.

events.id: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
A safe, supportive space for men to connect, share openly, and build authentic community through honest conversation and mutual respect

About this Event

Men’s Circle: Authentic Relating
A supportive space for men to come together, connect, and explore life’s challenges in community. This circle welcomes men at all stages — whether you’re navigating change, looking for connection, or simply want a place to be heard.
Engage in open, honest conversations and experience the kind of connection that’s rare but meaningful. There’s no expectation to speak — your presence alone is valued. The circle follows a respectful, non-judgmental format, prioritizing safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
After the circle, stay for a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a simple way to extend the sense of community and connection. This gathering is offered on a non-profit basis.





Join us after this free event for an optional plant-based dinner and dessert for only $15 (or $5 for students).





Meet Andre and Sri Jiva, your hosts
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.





Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
Host: Andre

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Optional Plant-based dinner and dessert!

Experience deep rest and renewal through a guided Yoga Nidra practice that cultivates openness, light, and creative flow for body and mind

About this Event


Yoga Nidra: Cultivating Openness and Inner Light

This months’s Yoga Nidra practice is designed to cultivate openness, joy, and creative flow. In this session, you’ll be guided into a state of profound rest while exploring the theme of light and expansion—inviting a sense of spaciousness in both body and mind.
Through gentle verbal guidance, you’ll be encouraged to embrace openness, fostering connection, inspiration, and a joyful presence. The experience is complemented by soothing sounds, comforting visuals, and a serene environment that support your journey into inner calm and renewed energy.
This practice is accessible to all levels—no previous experience required. Allow yourself to rest, recharge, and expand into a lighter, more creative state of being.
Plus - there’s an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!





Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!



Meet Emma, your host

With a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga certification and a background in the corporate world, Emma brings both groundedness and empathy to her teaching. Her approach is slow, intentional, and centered on creating a space where your body feels safe to relax and release

events.id: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip-Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip
events.venue: Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.

Also check out other Trips & Adventurous Activities in Wellington.

events.id: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself-5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself
events.venue: 5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The day is designed to stretch and grow you! In the whakatauākī of Tā Apirana Ngata (Ngāti Porou), E tipu, e rea, he exhorts us to 'grow and flourish'. Grow and flourish! More than survive, get by, do ok. Flourish! This day will explore ways to fully engage with the beautiful moemoeā this whakatauākī speaks to.
E Tipu, E Rea
E tipu e rea mō ngā rā o tō ao
Ko tō ringa ki ngā rākau a te Pākehā
Hei ora mō te tinana
Ko tō ngākau ki ngā taonga a ō tīpuna Māori
Hei tikitiki mō tō māhunga
Ko tō wairua ki tō atua, nāna nei ngā mea katoa
Grow and branch forth for the days destined to you
Your hands to the tools of the Pākehā for the welfare of your body
Your heart to the treasures of your ancestors as adornments for your brow
Your spirit to God, who made all things
— Sir Apirana Ngata

You may like to think about how the day can help you align your professional work-based objectives (often expressed as KPI’s) with your personal vision, mission and goals.
The aims of the Course are to:
1. To host a mana ake wānanga exploring your unique future;
2. To bring together a group of people interested in creating rangatiratanga in their lives;
3. To draw from mātauranga Māori to support participants to create a 12-month personal strategic plan (drawing on moemoeā, pūrakau and pūtake);
4. To facilitate learning using Māori learning and teaching styles;
5. To connect people to the power of lifelong learning; and,
6. To add to the network of dedicated, Treaty based nation builders who have the goal of 'Becoming a CEO' on their radar for themselves or someone they know, whether that be at the personal, whānau, hapῡ, iwi or organisational level.
Our programme is interactive and delivered through a range of teaching / learning techniques which also include: facilitation; small group discussion; critical analysis; reflection; and, reporting back.

events.long_description:
A Very (late) Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas
New date! 30 January, 2026. So this will be 'A Very (late) Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas'.

NAUTICAL GAMES /// BEST DRESSED PRIZES /// SINGALONG SHANTIES /// XMAS-TYPE STUFF

Your work Xmas-party is going to be lame or cancelled so slap a $2 shop Santa's hat on 2025 and have a sing with Aotearoa's Most Seaworthy Shanty crew.

Prepare to be hit by a wave of joy and merriment as the Full Wellington Sea Shanty Society Experience transform the Abandoned Taproom into a shanty wonderland.

We got shanty booklets for all ye faithful and merch for Xmas presents.

If there's one thing we can all agree on in this country, it's that Xmas needs more sea shanties!

Only Te Upoko o te Ika show for 2025. New EP out in April 2026.

🎅🎅🎅

WELLINGTON SEA SHANTY SOCIETY

Aotearoa New Zealand's Most 'Sea Worthy' Shanty Group™ have been belting out traditional and original sea songs from Aotearoa, France, Spain, the UK and more, since time immemorial (2012).

The W.S.S.S have toured Aotearoa and France multiple times and are known for their rowdy and participatory live shows. They've performed at Paimpol (one of the world's largest shanty festivals), Splore, Albany Folk Festival (Aus), Quebec Sea Shanty Festival (Canada) and a shipload of other festivals in NZ, France & Canada. Their new EP 'Sea Shanties of the 70s, 80s, & Today!' has just recently surfaced to complement their 'Now That's What I Call Sea Shanties' series. Another must-listen is 'Ahoy!' - a French/English album made with Nantes amis Croche Dedans.

events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 3
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

events.long_description:
Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
📍 Dowse Square & Lower Hutt Town Hall
📅 Saturday, 31 January 2026
🕚 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Join us for a colourful, family-friendly Lunar New Year Festival in the heart of Lower Hutt!

Hosted by Viet Hub NZ, this outdoor cultural festival celebrates not only Vietnamese Tết but also embraces the wider Lunar New Year traditions of diverse communities across Aotearoa.

Come and experience a day full of music, culture, food, and community connection as we gallop into the Year of the Horse!

⸻

🎭 What to Expect:
• Outdoor Cultural Market: Delicious food stalls, handmade crafts, community booths, and more
• Live Performances: Lion dance, drumming, cultural music and dance throughout the day on the Town Hall stage
• Cultural Games & Activities: Try your hand at Vietnamese folk games, calligraphy, lantern making, and storytelling
• Exhibition Space: Discover real stories of migration and belonging through our Immigrant Storytelling installation
• Traditional Costume Photography: Indoor photo area with Vietnamese and Lunar New Year-inspired costumes
• Children’s Zone: Face painting, interactive games, and family workshops
• Lucky Draw & Spot Prizes!

⸻

🎟️ Tickets:
• Free General Admission – Registration encouraged for updates & giveaways
• Optional Donation – Support our community initiatives and annual cultural programmes

Every ticket holder goes into the draw for a lucky Lunar prize!

⸻

💛 Why Attend?

This is Lower Hutt’s largest and most inclusive Lunar New Year celebration – welcoming all ages, all cultures, and all walks of life. Whether you’re reconnecting with your roots or exploring new traditions, there’s something here for everyone.

⸻

📢 Stay Connected:

Follow us on Facebook￼ or visit www.viethubnz.org￼
📧 Contact us:

⸻

This event is proudly supported by local businesses, volunteers, and the wider Hutt community. Proceeds support Viet Hub NZ’s year-round cultural, educational, and community programmes.

events.id: Coven: Butch-Sweet Axe Throwing Co. (Sweet Axe Throwing Co. Wellington),60 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Coven: Butch
events.venue: Sweet Axe Throwing Co. (Sweet Axe Throwing Co. Wellington),60 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Coven: Butch
For butches and butch lovers! This night sets to make two things clear:

1. We love butches!
2. Get enough sapphics and queers in a room and anything can become a competition

Join us for axe throwing, games, kai, and as always at our events impeccable vibes. Spot prizes for the best butches, drink on arrival, and a room full of hot babes? Need we say more, so get your fits checked and grab your ticket before they go. This event has limited capacity.

Not a butch? No problem, all butch and butch appreciating Coven members of all flavours welcome.

No dress code! Come as you are, celebrate butch fashion or your queer identity and expect a fun chill night with your community.

More info about Coven:

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
This event is located on the ground floor. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly to the Whisky & Wood team at

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!

events.id: PADI Advanced Open Water Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Wellington 5026, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: PADI Advanced Open Water Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Wellington 5026, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
PADI Advanced Open Water Course
“Your Next Step in Underwater Adventure”
Exploration excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water
course is all about. And no you don't have to be "advanced" to take it - it's designed
so both new and experienced Open Water Divers can sign up and develop better
diving skills and techniques straight away!

The Advanced Open Water Diver course helps you increase your confidence and
build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water. It’s also a great
way to get more diving experience under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
This course builds on what you've learnt and develops new capabilities by
introducing new dive activities and ways to have fun scuba diving. You will complete
5 different types of dives to build your confidence and develop your dive skills. The
dives include the basics of Deep Diving Underwater Navigation - and your choice of
Peak Performance Buoyancy Naturalist Fish Identification Wreck (weather dependant)
Enriched Air * Photography or Night during winter.

Complete the theory online then join us for a weekends diving. After the 5 dives
over the weekend you will qualify as a PADI Advanced Open Water Diver. This is the
minimum requirement for many of our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the
PADI Rescue Diver course.

If you have any questions please call so we can help you.
events.description:
PADI Advanced Open Water Course “Your Next Step in Underwater Adventure” Exploration excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water course is all about.
And no you don't have to be "advanced" to take it - it's designed so both new and experienced Open Water Divers can sign up and develop better diving skills and techniques straight away!
The Advanced Open Water Diver course helps you increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water.
It’s also a great way to get more diving experience under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
This is the minimum requirement for many of our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.
