events.id: SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH-Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH
Banished Music, Whammy Bar, and Valhalla are proud to present the long-awaited New Zealand debut of experimental post-metal trio SUMAC.
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.

SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band. Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation. In 2024, the band released their critically acclaimed album The Healer, a sweeping, transformative work spanning four monumental tracks. The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.

The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career. It’s dense and invigorating, highlighting the band’s dexterity, creativity, and clarity of purpose. - Pitchfork

Soon after the release SUMAC teamed up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother to release The Film, a boundary-pushing collaborative album. Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary.

SUMAC’s work has always been about transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment.
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.

Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.
SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band.
Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation.
The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.
The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career.

Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary. 

SUMAC’s work has always been about transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment. 
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.
events.description:
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.
SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band.
Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation.
The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.
The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career.

events.id: Ludovico Einaudi-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ludovico Einaudi
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
His music has been performed live on an Arctic ice-floe and as soundtracks for Oscar and Golden Globe-winning films. Italian pianist and composer Ludovico Einaudi is returning to Wellington with a new album to explore with audiences. The Michael Fowler Centre will be filled with Ludovico’s special mix of neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock, and experimental styles. His modern soundscapes are renowned for being able to cross artistic and generational boundaries. Because of this, he has become one of the world’s most-streamed classical music artists. 
Ludovico began composing in the 1980s for theatre and ballet. He has since gone on to write for film and television and produce multi-million-selling albums. His most recent is ‘The Summer Portraits’. Written in 2025, it is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer, and family holidays. Here, he returns to the lush full-band textures of earlier works. You’ll get to hear this first-hand, so don’t miss your chance.

events.id: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026-Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026
events.venue: Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora!
Electricity and electrification are seen as the significant enablers for decarbonisation of our nation. The Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) | Te Whatunga Hiko programme aspires to meet the challenges the electrical power system will face as we journey towards sustainable decarbonisation.
Our vision is to provide an infrastructure paradigm through a hybrid AC/DC transmission and distribution system that meets the needs of tomorrow’s efficient, low-carbon, reliable and resilient electrical power system.
Funded as part of the New Zealand Government’s Strategic Science Investment Fund (SSIF) on Advanced Energy Technology Platform (AETP), the research team is investigating what the future electrical power system might look like.
Hear about the team’s latest achievements as we approach the final phase of the programme.
Attendance is in person at Victoria University Wellington.
Ngā mihi nui,
Prof. Neville Watson,
Science Leader
The detailed programme will be circulated closer to the event.
 More information on the research can be found at https://www.fan.ac.nz/
If you have any questions, please contact futurearchitecturenetwork@canterbury.ac.nz

events.id: Malcolm Todd tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Malcolm Todd tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours & Laneway
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

events.venue: 166 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.
Book your team for this in-person training, which your regional manager will present.
If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.

events.id: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.

events.id: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox-34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
Join the Mystic Muses, award-winning singer/songwriters Melissa Cox (NZ/USA) and Celia Farran (USA) for an unforgettable show featuring Celtic music of the past, present, and future - Enya, Sinead O'Connor, The Cranberries, Loreena McKennitt, traditional tunes, lore & legends, sea shanties, and haunting original songs by Melissa and Celia.

-- Meet the Muses --

MELISSA COX: Multi-instrumentalist and award-winning songwriter Melissa Cox conjures a one-woman storm of Celtic tradition, tribal beats, and celestial synths to create an ethereal, danceable Elvish EDM dream. Using her looping pedal, she layers tin whistle, electric mandolin, piano, synths, drum beats, and her haunting voice to create performances reminiscent of Enigma, Enya, and Loreena McKennitt. A seasoned touring artist and classically trained vocalist, she pushes Celtic and World music into the 21st century with raw energy and fearless, honest lyrics. http://www.melcoxmusic.com

CELIA FARRAN: “A cross between an Earthy Enya, Joan Baez, and Tina Fey.” She dishes up the most delicious concoction of the silly and sacred, delighting audiences across the globe. With rusty red locks and twinkling eyes, she casts a spell of enchantment upon her listeners, bringing deep and resonating experiences to audiences across the globe. With powerful, heart-felt vocals and wacky comedic improvisations, the audience never knows what will happen with Celia on stage. http://www.celiafarran.com

events.long_description:
UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
Book Soon for this special day workshop and explore and unleash the power of your Voice and Astrological Archetypes!!

We are blessed that Alignment Coach and Healer, Clare Babbage is visiting the Wellington Region from Napier, and collaborating with Voice Empowerment Coach and Healer, Bryony Rogers from Heartsong Healing, in this exciting, unique offering.

This workshop is a specially designed, transformative full day experience of Embodied Astrological Archetypes and Conscious Sound and Voice Practices.

BOOK HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

On the date of the full moon, the energies of the sun and the moon stand face to face — illuminating both our outer expression and our inner world.

In astrology, the sun represents our fullest expression, our vitality, and the way we are here to shine. The moon reveals our emotional landscape, our inner rhythms, and often the fears that arise when we dare to live that full expression. Together, they form a powerful dialogue between structure and flow, logic and emotion, masculine and feminine.

In this workshop, Clare will guide you into an embodied exploration of your own sun and moon, inviting you to feel these two archetypes within your body and notice where they support, resist, or balance each other.

Bryony will lead you into vocal practices that bring these energies into sound and voice — giving expression to what is often left unspoken. Through voice, you’ll release what holds you back and discover new harmony between your inner and outer selves.

This full moon is the perfect moment to unleash the voices of your sun and moon — and to step more fully into clarity, balance, and authentic expression.

The timing of this workshop gives you a unique opportunity to tune into these planets and benefit from their placement in the collective astrology.

The workshop will begin with the opportunity to explore powerful, enjoyable, accessible Voice Practices which open, align and strengthen your expression - and create physiological changes in your energy field.

We will then directly, bodily experience the energies of each of the Celestial Bodies through Embodied Astrology, guided by Clare.

We will integrate these energies, through further Voice Practices, including improvisation, healing chants and songs.

These two modalities will be carefully interwoven in an enjoyable, rich day's workshop that will benefit all participants.

There will be guided space in the workshop to integrate the energetic shifts and discoveries of both the Voice Practices and the Astrology.

This special workshop takes place on Saturday February 7th, 10am-4.30pm - we hope you can join us

At the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Paraparaumu.

INVESTMENT:

Your investment for this day is $233. Shared lunch.
Some concessions are available - please contact us by email .

Payment by card here - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

Please contact us with any questions at all.

events.id: Danny Bhoy-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Danny Bhoy
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Danny Bhoy, New Zealand’s favourite Scottish comedian, is returning to The Opera House with his new show ‘Dear World’. His easy-going and intimate style of comedy brings banter and anecdotes that are sure to make you cackle. In ‘Dear World,’ Danny brings a thespian flair to the stage. “This is the sequel to my 2015 show ‘Dear Epson…’ My favourite ever show. It’s a hybrid of stand-up and theatre, but really that just means I get to sit down for bits of it.” 
Danny has been honing his craft and touring the world for over 25 years. Having built an impressive following in Australia, Canada and New Zealand, he knows his audience well and never shies away from playfully picking them apart. Described by The Montreal Gazette as “One of the most sparkling wits in the world,” and by The Age as having “unsurpassed storytelling”. This one-night-only show is sure to be one to remember.

events.id: Pasifika Festival's Shooting Star Programme presents: Taula-12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Pasifika Festival's Shooting Star Programme presents: Taula
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Show title: "Taula (Anchor)"
Wellington City Council's Shooting Star Programme proudly presents an original theatre production, which debuts at the Hannah Playhouse on Saturday 7 Febrary 2026! This production centres themes of identity, belonging, the passing down of cultural traditions and the importance of family, both present and past. The story follows young people navigating their identity whilst figuring out their place in Educational spaces. Taula is performed by Māori, Pasifika and Asian rangatahi who are emerging and aspiring actors. Join us for a 50-minute show followed by a short talanoa/chat afterwards.
Bookings required due to venue seating capacity - all tickets are free.
More about The Shooting Star Programme:
Following on from a successful pilot programme in 2025 Étū rere pā‘ata - The Shooting Star Programme is back. Part of the Wellington Pasifika Festival, this programme sees a group of young Pasifika actors create a show which tells Pasifika stories. This performance is their theatre debut. The Shooting Star programme brings new artforms and performers to the Pasifika Festival, upskills a new cohort of Pasifika and Māori performers and celebrates Pasifika art. Created by Karl Kite Rangi with support from WCC City Events and with assistant directors Meilani Payne and Maddy Vai-Little.

events.name: Amitayus Retreat - free event
events.venue: 174 Albert Street, New Zealand 4410,174 Albert St, Hokowhitu, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Amitayus Retreat - free event
Long life, merit and wisdom.
In this special retreat we have the opportunity to increase our lifespan, merit and wisdom through the special meditation practice of Buddha Amitayus.

Our human life is our most precious possession because it gives us the opportunity to improve ourselves and attain the supreme happiness of enlightenment.
We therefore need a long and healthy life. To engage successfully in spiritual practice we also need wisdom, as well as the merit or good fortune that gives our mind the strength to support the growth of inner realisations. Amitayus is the Buddha of long life, merit and wisdom.

By engaging in Amitayus practice, we can develop these qualities and eventually attain the deathless state of enlightenment.
We can also use this practice to help remove obstacles endangering the lives of others, especially our close friends and family.

SESSION TIMES
10 – 11.15am
12 – 1.15pm
3 – 4.15pm

DETAILS
There is no cost and you can attend as many sessions as you like.
Coffee, tea and snacks are provided. Please bring your own vegetarian lunch if you are staying for the whole day.

events.id: The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026-Shorland Park,17 Reef St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
events.venue: Shorland Park,17 Reef St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
Details to follow closer to time, but already got a few new ideas for the 2026 edition.

***

Description from Inaugural 2025 Edition FYI:

I would like to acknowledge the support of The Island Bay Festival, which will be celebrating its 40th year of bringing the community together this year, and thank them for giving me a space in The Park this Sunday at The Day in The Bay to showcase and celebrate The Italians of Island Bay, their history and their contributiion to the community, business and culture.

#supportlocal
#celebratelocal
#celebratecommunity
#islandbayfestival

The majority of Island Bay Italians are Neapolitan from the hill top town of Massa Lubrense and surrounds on the Sorrentine Peninsula, followed by Sicilians from the small volcanic island of Stromboli in the Aeolean sea.

When you think of The Italians of Island Bay you might think of their involvement and contribution to the Fishing and Food (and related) Industries, but it goes much wider than that..

In alphabetic order as to not to offend. NB: list a work in progress.

- academics
- accountants
- artists
- authors
- builders
- cinema
- electricians
- exporters
- film makers
- financial advisors
- fishermen
- footballers
- hairdressers
- hoteliers
- importers
- journalists
- lawyers
- lecturers
- lawn bowlers
- management consultants
- martial arts instructors
- mozzarella makers
- musicians
- olympic medalist
- opera singers
- photographers
- plumbers
- poets
- property developers
- public servants
- publishers
- quantity surveyors
- realaters
- restauranteurs
- scholars
- seamstresses
- secretaries
- retailers
- tailors
- teachers
- tomatoe growers
- volunteers
- wine makers
- wholesalers

Books that will on display:

- Alle Fine del Mondo by Paul Elenio
- Le Famiglie Strombolani by
- Food & Family by
- Family Business by Vincent Moleta
- Angelina by Gerard Hindmarsh
- Unsheltered by Clare Moleta
- Umberto Saba : poetry & prose selected & translated, with notes by Vincent Moleta

Just a few days to go till the big Day in the Bay on Sunday. I'm unexpectedly in Perth for family reasons, so have had to piece this together organically long distance, with the help and contribution of my mum's childhood girlfriends from The Bay, for which I'm extremely greatfull.

My Back-Story:

On my mother's side I'm double 4th generation Strombolana-Kiwi and 2nd generation Dutch-Kiwi on my father's side (RIP).. thus my long and unusual name..

Rosina Maria Giuseppina van der Aa.

All 4 of my biz-nonni (great grandparents) bravely sailed to the ends of the earth (alle fine del mondo) in search of a better future.

My maternal great grandfather (Bartolo Barnao) and his elder brother(Giuseppe) initially fished and slept under their fishing boat in Makara, before returning with their Strombolane wives who were also siblings (Giuseppina and Maria Concetta Pirera) to set up shop literally (a fish shop) in Palmerston North before then moving to No 64 The Parade Island Bay when my Nonna Rosina was 17 circa 1934.

My paternal great grandparents (Angelina Criscillo and Vincenzo Moleta) along with Vincenzo's brother (Antonino) and Angelina's cousin (Rosa) settled and tamed D'urville. My Nonno (Leslie George Moleta) spotted my Nonna (Rosina Elvira Barnao) at the Zino-Toscano wedding where she was a bridesmaid. They had two children, both named after their grandparents as was the tradition. My uncle Vincent Bartolo and my mother Maria Josephine The rest as they say is Family Business..

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: SS Penguin Tour (Feb 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: SS Penguin Tour (Feb 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
On the 12 February 1909, the SS Penguin sank in Cook Strait in a raging southerly storm with the loss of 72 lives, one of the worst maritime disasters in NZ history.  Many of those who died were woman and children, as their lifeboats capsized in the wild sea. 
Although the Captain was heavily criticised, it is still not clear what the ship hit nor where, as the wreck of the Penguin has never been located. 
The tragedy stunned Wellington and a day of mourning was called for 16 February.  The city came to a standstill as many of those who died were brought up to Karori Cemetery for burial in a long procession of cabs and lorries.
To commemorate this tragedy the Friends will be undertaking a guided tour of most of the Penguin graves on Sunday 8th February. 
The tour duration is approximately 2 hours long.
This tour is suitable for people with moderate fitness. The route mostly follows paved surfaces but there are some areas of unevenness. Surefootedness is required.

Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you one hour before the tour start time by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Lagwagon ‘30th Anniversary of HOSS’ NZ Tour 2026-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Lagwagon ‘30th Anniversary of HOSS’ NZ Tour 2026
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
California punk legends Lagwagon are heading back to Aotearoa in early 2026 to celebrate 30 years of their iconic album HOSS. This tour is all about reliving the raw energy and spirit of the '90s punk scene that HOSS helped define. 
Fans can look forward to hearing HOSS performed live in full - every track, start to finish - plus a bunch of fan favourites from their extensive catalogue. From the punchy riffs of "Violins" to the heartfelt "Razor Burn," it's a rare chance to experience the album that solidified Lagwagon's place in punk history.
Known for their high-energy, no-frills live shows, Lagwagon delivers the kind of performances that get the crowd moving and singing along. Whether you've been a fan since the '90s or just discovered them, this tour promises a night of pure punk rock.


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
With 21 published nonfiction books, you’ll likely have come across Bill Bryson’s work. One of his most famous books, ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything’, has been given a major rewrite. He takes to the stage at The Opera House to talk about his new findings. 
In ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0’, Bill updates the book with the latest scientific research on the Earth and the universe. In the live show, you’ll hear about planetology, astronomy, particle physics, the Big Bang, quantum mechanics, and evolution. Throughout his career, the journalist and author has covered a wide range of subjects, including travel, the English language, and the human body. This rare chance to see him live promises forays into many of these areas. All conducted with his usual theatrical flair. 
Bill Bryson has a quest to understand everything that has happened from the Big Bang to the rise of civilisation and what humans are today. Join him as he shares the latest major advances in science.

events.id: Wellington Gypsy Fair-Frank Kitts Park,68 Jervois Quay, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Frank Kitts Park,68 Jervois Quay, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

events.id: Enchanted Park-Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Enchanted Park
events.venue: Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Enchanted Park
Free fairy fun in the forest!

Bring the whānau for an enchanting afternoon in the Gums Loop Meadow at Wainuiomata Regional Park. This special summer event invites tamariki to explore nature, get creative, and learn about the native wildlife that calls this forest home.

Help us build a fairy garden in the forest where North Island brown kiwi live. Kids can paint rocks or create their own fairy doors. There will be facepainting and outdoor games. You're encouraged to bring fairy costumes and picnic lunches to enjoy in the meadow.

Our knowledgeable park ranger will be there (with fairy wings on) to answer questions and share stories about the park’s natural heritage.

The Remutaka Conservation Trust and Forest & Bird be on hand to teach tamariki about the kiwi who live in this park and the conservation work happening in the area.

Event Details:

Aimed at: Children aged 4–10

Accessibility: Tracks suitable for prams

Dogs: Allowed on a lead

What to bring: Picnic, costumes, and creativity!


Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of our regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Wainuiomata Regional Park is a special place for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater sources, preserves ancient native forests, looks after historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers, like the Remutaka Conservation Trust, play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.id: The Very Best of Deacon Blue-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Very Best of Deacon Blue
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Scottish pop-rock icons Deacon Blue are heading to The Opera House in 2026. The visit coincides with the band’s 40 anniversary and the release of its eleventh studio album, ‘The Great Western Road’. New Zealand fans can expect a curated setlist blending arena-sized classic anthems and intimate surprises.
Deacon Blue is known for emotionally-charged performances and enduring hits like Dignity, Real Gone Kid, I’ll Never Fall In Love Again, and Fergus Sings the Blues. Audiences are sure to have a dynamic live experience in a concert spanning the band’s full career. Songs will range from the soulful grit of acclaimed debut album ‘Raintown’ to newer releases. ‘The Great Western Road’ reflects the band’s journey across four decades of music making with honesty, warmth, and a renewed sense of adventure.
With a reputation for crafting unforgettable live moments,
Deacon Blue’s 2026 tour will be 40 years strong, and more poignant and potent than ever.

events.id: HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026
HED P.E.
Still ‘Broke’ Australian Tour 2026
with NONPOINT

📆 Live at San Fran, Wellington on Saturday 14 February

— 𝐎𝐧 𝐒𝐚𝐥𝐞 𝐍𝐨𝐰 —
➥ bit.ly/hednon26well
__________________________________________

(HED) P.E. return to shake New Zealand to its very foundations and they are bringing NONPOINT with them

Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good; which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.

Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent” RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.

Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.

Debuting in New Zealand for the first time and with an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.

This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through Australia with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!

events.id: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve-Taputeranga Marine Reserve, 61 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
events.venue: Taputeranga Marine Reserve, 61 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington
events.long_description:
Dive into Taputeranga Marine Reserve and take part in a free snorkeling event this summer!

Beginners welcome! We provide all the necessary gear and experienced guides to ensure your safety and enjoyment in the water. Participants just need to be at least eight years old and confident swimmers. Those under sixteen must be accompanied by an adult.

Registrations open at 9.45am. Come down to book a snorkel time for the day, as spots may fill up quickly. Bring your togs, towel, refreshments and make a day of it exploring the activities and environment at Taputeranga Marine Reserve.

This free event is brought to you in partnership with Greater Wellington Regional Council.

Cancellations/Postponements:

Events are weather dependent. Stay updated by checking the Mountains to Sea Wellington Facebook event listings for any cancellations, postponements, or location changes.

To get to Taputeranga Marine Reserve:

We encourage attendees to leave cars at home and use alternative transport where possible. Locals- please come on foot or bring along your bikes/scooters! For those further afield, the number 1 bus drops you right to the event from the Wellington Train Station. Map your journey here

Accessibility:

Island Bay Beach is accessible by beach wheelchair. The nearest accessible toilets are in Shorland Park. There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers. Please see a staff member on arrival if the Surf Club parks are full. We have a variety of options to enable a more comfortable experience in the water,including flotation aids and 1:1 support from our trained guides. Please get in touch with us at events@mtsw.org.nz in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance. We love helping people to experience our marine environment!

The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves. Adventure Activity Certified - AA0534.

Photos: Kristine Zipfel
events.description:

There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers.
Please get in touch with us at events@mtsw.org.nz in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance.
The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves.

events.id: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good;  which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.
Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent”RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.
Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.
With an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.
This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through New Zealand with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!

events.id: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 1 2026-Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 1 2026
events.venue: Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
STEAMS is an integrated approach to learning topics of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society that fosters critical thinking, problem solving, communication and collaboration. Its aim is to teach real world skills through engaging methods whilst allowing individuals to be creative. This involves immersing tamariki into projects and activities that develop innovation and champion curiosity. STEAMS is not ‘play based learning’ but focused learning through an integrated hands-on approach allowing children to take risks and explore their own curiosity in a subject without time barriers.
At the Ministry of Inspiration we offer STEAMS learning each term for Year 1-8 students. Once a week students will attend a class at Waterlea Racecourse, Blenheim on TUESDAY or THURSDAY. STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) start at 9am and finish at 2:45pm on TUESDAY. Little STEAMerS operates from 9-12 on THURSDAY. STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) operates on THURSDAY from 9am to 245 pm. 
Inquiry, collaboration, and an emphasis on process-based learning are at the heart of the STEAM approach. Each term the classes will have a focus which drives the learning and our amazing teachers create opportunities to help each student develop their understanding, improve their skills and gain knowledge in a range of topics.
Students who participate in STEAM learning:
· think outside the box
· feel safe to express innovative and creative ideas
· feel comfortable doing hands-on learning
· take ownership over their learning
· work collaboratively with others
· understand the ways that science, maths, the arts, and technology work together
· become increasingly curious about the world around them and feel empowered to change it for the better.
When does it meet, and where?
The school is held during school terms.
STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) TUESDAY, 9-245.
STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) THURSDAY, 9-245
Little STEAMerS (ages 5-6) THURSDAY 12-3.
Location:  Waterlea Racecourse, enter off of Linton St.
How much does it cost?
The students come for a paid three-week trial-as a new student you pay for that through Humanitix.
If both family and teacher feel there is a good fit for the child in the class, they continue for the rest of the term. You are then invoiced for the full term less the amount paid for the Trial.
Payment is by term, with a cost of $73 incl. GST We have a limited number of scholarships available that are awarded on a term by term basis for those with financial need for 25% off. 
Little STEAMerS is $30 incl. GST.
Will my child’s school mind that they miss a day per week?
You will need to inform the child’s school that he or she will be at STEAMS School one day per week. To date we have not encountered any issues around accommodating a child’s participation in STEAMS School, and many of the region’s schools are very supportive of the programme. Once enrolled, you are encouraged to inform the teacher and office staff that your child should be marked present for the day they attend STEAMS School, as they will be attending an academic school as opposed to being absent due to illness or other reasons.

events.id: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand-48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand
events.venue: 48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) is a psychological intervention initially developed for emotional disorders. It is now widely used in supporting people to deal with the challenges of physical ill-health. Professionals from various backgrounds can learn to use a simplified CBT skills set, and use of these skills enables them to be more effective in managing aspects of their patients’ distress.
The training is a mix of theory, skills demonstration and skills practice, giving participants a better understanding of the applicability of the skill set in their area of practice and providing some skills to take away. Training sessions are spaced to allow participants to use their new skills in their clinical practice. Each participant reflects on their learning and their work with a specific patient, and the whole group reflects on lessons learned. In this way, learning remains rooted in participants’ clinical practice. These CBT courses are consistently evaluated highly by participants.
The Course
Teaching will be commenced with 2 days of in person sessions. 19th and 20th Feb 2026 at Mary Potter Hospice, Wellington and subsequently 2 sessions on-line via Zoom. These will be either 18th or 19th March an 22nd or 23rd April 2026.
Attendance at all sessions is mandatory to complete the course.
The courses cost is $850 per person (incl GST).
The Trainers
Kathy Burn was a Clinical Nurse Specialist in Palliative Care who went on to train in CBT and to develop the CBT service at St Christopher’s Hospice, London. She now works in CBT in chronic pain, and she teaches and supervises CBT trainees at the institute of Psychiatry, London.
Kathryn Mannix was a Palliative Medicine Consultant and CBT therapist. She developed ‘CBT First Aid’ to enable palliative care clinicians to adapt skills from CBT into their clinical practice. She is an author. There are insights into her use of CBT in her books With the End in Mind and Listen.
Terms and Conditions
Attendance: In order to create a learning community for each course, it is important that each person on a course attends every session and is able to join in the discussions by keeping up with the course. By accepting a place on a particular course, you agree to attend all the sessions, to arrive on time, and to work alongside your group members during the session to support each other's learning. Each session builds on the last, and you'll be asked to put your new learning into practice in- between sessions. Building learning groups in this way means we can't add new trainees after a course has begun.
We are not able to run catch-up sessions for sessions missed. If you miss sessions, you may be asked to withdraw from the course and no refunds will be given.
Refunds/Canellations: Once you sign up and pay, we won't be able to refund your payment unless we can reallocate your place to another person before the course begins. The deadline for cancelling your place is 28 days before the day and time of the first session. If you cancel and we can fill your place with another person, we'll offer you the choice of a refund or a place on a future course, if places are available. We will do our best to fill your place, but we can't promise this. Refunds will incur an administration fee.
Dates and Times of Sessions: all dates and times are given in NZ time, and this varies over the year. It is up to you to check the correct time in your time zone: you may find this website useful to check your own time zone with Auckland NZ time on each specific date: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/
Trainers: we have a team of trainers, all of whom are experienced CBT therapists and trainers, and all are familiar with applying CBT in physical health settings. Different sessions may be taught by different trainers, or by 'guest appearances' by some of our team. The team of trainers will ensure there is continuity of content and of learning as the course progresses.
Special circumstances: Sometimes, life events appear unexpectedly. If something unexpected prevents you from attending, please let us know as early as you can, and we will give consideration to how we might be able to support you to continue your training if that is what you wish to do.

events.id: Wankernomics — Just Touching Base-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wankernomics — Just Touching Base
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email? Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post? You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk. Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution. ‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.   
The shows are hilarious and include many ‘oh-my-god-that’s-exactly-what-happens-at-my-workplace’ moments. You’ll get a demonstration of the buzzwords, bureaucracy, banality, and baloney of modern working life. You’ll get tips on how to speak at work, how to look like a genius in meetings, and how to get promoted by simply dropping the phrase ‘360 degree all-hands ideation session’ into an email to your boss. 
So, pop some time in the diary for an outcomes-focused, value-added, best-practice, deep-dive into the realities of the working world.

Te Huarahi Passionfest is a grassroots festival for young adults chasing after Jesus and justice in Aotearoa. It’s about camping under the stars, worship and kōrero, music and art, shared kai and whanaungatanga.
We want to form a new generation of Jesus-followers who care deeply about people and creation. Alongside you will be families and older adults who’ve walked this path for decades — cheering you on and sharing the journey.

events.name: Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day
events.venue: Queen Elizabeth Park,Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day
A summer celebration on the Kāpiti Coast!

Bring the whānau and join us for a fun-filled day at Queen Elizabeth Park next to beautiful Whareroa Beach. We’re celebrating 25 years of Greater Wellington’s summer events in your regional parks.

Explore the heart of this beloved park. Enjoy activities like:

Historic tram rides through the park

Face painting and crafts for the tamariki

Artisan Craft Market will be onsite with stalls and food trucks with delicious treats

Live performers Fairy Cat and her fairy friends will bring their magic.

This is your chance to experience one of our most iconic regional parks, known for its WWII U.S. Marines Camp history and wetland restoration projects. Pack a picnic, relax by the beach, and make a day of it!



Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Queen Elizabeth Park is more than just a beautiful coastal space—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater and wetlands, restores native habitats, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners, mana whenua, and volunteers play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.name: Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Riverbank Park,42 Riverbank St, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:
Next month, 26th September, 11:00 pm, Papamoa Gypsy Fair in Tauranga
This October, 3rd October, 11:00 pm, Gisborne Gypsy Fair in Gisborne
This October, 10th October, 11:00 pm, Havelock North Gypsy Fair in Havelock North
Also check out other Music events in Upper Hutt, Entertainment events in Upper Hutt.

events.id: Earth Tongue-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Earth Tongue
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fresh off the announcement of their forthcoming third album Dungeon Vision, Aotearoa’s heavy-psych duo Earth Tongue return home this February for a run of six exclusive shows across the country. The tour comes off the back of the band’s whirlwind international touring cycle and gives fans the earliest chance to hear brand-new material. 
The first show lands on the day of Dungeon Vision’s release, playing at the Turner Centre, Kerikeri on Friday 13 February. They’ll follow that up in Auckland’s Double Whammy on Saturday 14 February and then Last Place, Hamilton on Sunday 15 February. The duo then travel south for a run in Dunedin at Pearl Diver on Thursday 19 February, Space Academy in Christchurch on Friday 20 February before heading to Wellington on Saturday 21 February to finish the tour at the iconic San Fran. 
Guitarist Gussie Larkin and drummer Ezra Simmons have been based in Berlin, writing and recording Dungeon Vision with Los Angeles garage-rock icon Ty Segall who together have captured Earth Tongue’s most immersive and ambitious work yet. With anticipation building after unveiling their towering title track ‘Dungeon Vision’ and its handcrafted, cinematic music video - Earth Tongue edge fans toward a set of shows which bring a fully realised Dungeon Vision experience.  
Earth Tongue - Dungeon Vision (Official Music Video)
With their world-building aesthetic, relentless energy and cemented spot as one of our most electrifying psych-rock acts, Earth Tongue are sure to provide an unforgettable show - celebrating the release of their most visionary record to date. Don’t miss them playing in Aotearoa this February.

events.id: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026-Blenheim, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026
events.venue: Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Climate Action Week 2026 - Agenda
Dates: February 2026 - 23rd - 27th February
Theme: Leading by Doing: Local Businesses, Local Solutions, Collective Action
Each day features:
Morning: Local Business Story Sessions (Curated stories for our business community to get inspired with raw, honest and authentic stories)
Midday: Action Design Workshops (Crafting Plans & Solutions)
Afternoon: Immersion Experiences and Hands-On Field Visits (Applied Learning & Practical Support)
Day 1 - Water, Risk and Resilience 
Morning: Marlborough businesses facing water risks (horticulture, viticulture, manufacturing, nature, tourism) share adaptation stories: irrigation shifts, stormwater projects, water reuse innovations.
Midday: Business-specific water risks and trials of resilience-building solutions.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to diverse water initiatives across the region
Day 2 - Circular economy & waste
Morning: Circular leaders (including wine, food and beverages, building, construction, fisheries, nature) show how they have reduced waste, repurposed byproducts, or created new revenue streams from "waste."
Midday: Waste Challenge Mapping: Identify business-specific waste streams + select 1 trial action for next 6 months.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to waste initiatives and innovative approaches across the region
Day 3 - Nature and Biodiversity 
Morning: Farmers, viticulturists & landscapers share regenerative planting, biodiversity corridors, and ecosystem services initiatives.
Midday: Biodiversity on Your Site Toolkit Workshop — Co-design biodiversity plans for business properties (guided by local ecologists & farming leaders)
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to nature, land and biodiversity initiatives across the region.
Day 4 - Energy & Carbon
Morning: Businesses share their real decarbonisation journeys: EV transitions, renewable installations, process efficiencies — including the unexpected savings, costs and impacts.
Midday: Carbon Reduction Sprints — Design quick-win carbon actions + long-term projects with support from energy consultants and local peers.
Afternoon: Site visits to Carbon and Energy initiatives across the region
Day 5 - Taking the courage to act
Morning: Businesses share how they initiated climate actions, including failures, lessons, and unexpected wins.
Midday: Climate Action Map Workshop — Business leaders build their tailored action roadmaps (guided by peers + facilitators).
Afternoon: Immersion to unique businesses focussed on climate resilience
Immersion Experience Hosts Confirmed
Yealands Estate Winery
Carbonscape
Wineworks
Climate Action Marlborough has had the support of Yealands Estate Wines from its inception and we are super grateful to have their support for Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026. They are committed to influencing the Marlborough business community, driving collaboration that impacts climate resilience, education, health and wellbeing of a thriving region and growing our regions expertise.

events.id: Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026-National Library of New Zealand, Tiakiwai Conference Centre,70 Molesworth Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, Tiakiwai Conference Centre,70 Molesworth Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026
Join us in Wellington, New Zealand this summer for a gathering of leading researchers and practitioners working on complex systems.

About this Event

Nau mai haere mai ki tēnei hui!
Ka mihi mātou ki ngā mana whenua o tēnei takiwā, ki a Taranaki whānui, me ngā hapū, iwi iwi katoa kua tau i kōnei, me ō rātou mahi whakahirahira, mahi tiaki i ngā taonga o ēnei whenua.
Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, is the capital city of Aotearoa New Zealand. Māori have lived in Te Whanganui a Tara for 800 years. We acknowledge Taranaki whānui, and all the peoples who have lived here, and their close relationship with the lands and waters.


The Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026 will explore cutting-edge knowledge of complex systems and complexity, and how this knowledge is being used to better understand systems and drive system change. It will be held in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand, during summer in the Southern Hemisphere.
The theme for the conference is ‘Understanding complex systems: Theory, practice and impact’.

Our programme, including speakers, can be viewed here

Following the success of previous symposia in 2023 and 2024, this event will continue to foster interdisciplinary, cross-sector and cross-society collaboration in complex systems thinking, research and action. In 2026, the symposium will integrate the latest insights from complex systems science with the pressing concerns facing communities, businesses, and policymakers today. A particular focus will be how complexity science has evolved and how it is informing contemporary actions and solutions for prosperous, resilient, equitable and democratic societies – amid growing global challenges.
The symposium will explore complexity through a rich interdisciplinary lens, bringing together philosophical and epistemological perspectives alongside practical insights from fields including artificial intelligence, infrastructure, health, education, climate, and the environment, and cutting-edge insights from Māori and local communities. Attendees will engage with understandings of complexity, examine innovative methods and tools for working within complex systems, and discuss the implications for public policy, governance, leadership and Indigenous system change.
This inclusive, supportive event is essential for anyone interested in understanding the trajectory and practical applications of complex systems knowledge — including researchers, leaders, policymakers, innovators, changemakers, practitioners, and students. Whether you’re deeply experienced in complex systems research or newly curious about its potential, the symposium will provide valuable insights, networking opportunities, and inspiration.


We are taking expressions of interest (EOI) for an optional pre-event workshop on Monday 23 February, also held at the National Library. Will we notify you of the agenda and ticket price closer to the date
The Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026 will take place on 24–25 February 2026 at the Tiakiwai Conference Centre, National Library of New Zealand, Wellington.



Optional pre-event workshop
10am-5pm Tiakiwai Conference Centre

D ay 1
9am-5pm Symposium, Tiakiwai Conference Centre
5pm-6pm Networking Cocktail Hour
6pm-9pm Dinner, Thistle Inn

D ay 2
9 am - 5pm Symposium, Tiakiwai Conference Centre

events.id: Amble | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Amble | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Amble, the critically acclaimed three-piece folk group hailing from Ireland, today announce their return to Australia and New Zealand in February 2026, in support of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie.
Irish trio Amble harness a rare magic threaded into the fabric of their novelistic folk.
Originally hailing from the West Region of Ireland, the group—Robbie Cunningham (lead vocals/guitar), Ross McNerney (mandolin/bouzouki), and Oisin McCaffrey (vocals/guitar)—have unassumingly gone from quitting their day jobs in rural Ireland to the doorstep of an international breakthrough, buoyed by over 100 million streams and sold-out shows around the world.
Amble’s debut album, Reverie, set for release on Friday, 23 May this year, showcases Amble's signature sound: relatability, intimate storytelling, and authenticity seamlessly blended with no-frills acoustic instrumentation, serene soundscapes, and heavenly natural harmonies.
The album, recorded live in various studios between Ireland and Los Angeles, captures the spirit of the band's early days.

events.id: The Music of Greece-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Music of Greece
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marking its Aotearoa debut, the Hellenic Music Ensemble brings the unforgettable soundscape of Greece to life in a landmark global tour. The group will be under the direction of acclaimed composer and conductor Panos Liaropoulos. This 21-piece orchestra honours the genius of Greece’s most iconic composers: Mikis Theodorakis (BAFTA-winning ‘Zorba's Dance’) and Manos Hadjidakis (‘Never on a Sunday’). 
The orchestra will be joined by legendary voices Manolis Mitsias, Giannis Haroulis, and Natassa Bofiliou. Together, they’ll bring the quintessential melodies of Greece to the Michael Fowler Centre. This one-night-only show is part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. Soar through a century of song — celebrating the soul, poetry, and passion of Greece.

When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.

events.id: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course-24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course
events.venue: 24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

events.id: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington-200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington
events.venue: 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you looking to enhance your story-sharing skills and visitor engagement?

This workshop is a foundational step towards mastering interpretation and transforming visits into unforgettable experiences. Perfect for those working in museums, galleries, parks, zoos, heritage sites and tourist attractions.
Designed and presented by Lynda Burns this workshop offers a full day of immersive learning. With decades of experience as a practitioner, trainer, and mentor across Aotearoa and abroad, Lynda brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise and is a leader in the field of interpretation.
Throughout the day, you will: 
Experiment with new ideas and skills.
Share your existing knowledge with like-minded professionals. 
Explore the role of place interpretation in visitor experience. 
Learn how to reach the hearts and minds of visitors through meaningful story-sharing. 
Take a closer look at visitor demographics and behaviours. 
Discover the steps to start your interpretation projects, including research, goal setting, media choices, budgeting, and collection analysis. 
Gain basic project management tips to get things done efficiently. 
Explore how to work alongside iwi, stakeholders and managers. 
Please bring actual project ideas or content research to trial what you have learned throughout the day. This hands-on approach ensures that you get to test your new skills and leave with actionable insights. 
"Lynda recently facilitated a workshop on guiding for our team at Cornwall Park. Her amazing, tailored response to our programme has vastly improved the visitor experience and how we interpret this place. Our guides love the new skills they have learnt and are enjoying updating the entire programme of park-led walks.”
- Charlotte Taylor Visitor Experience 2IC Cornwall Park
Join us for this incredible opportunity to enhance your professional skills and elevate your visitor experience. 
Friday 27 February
9.30am-5pm
Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021
Tickets:
Non member $250
INNZ Member $215
Student/unwaged $190

Morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea will be provided, and all dietary requirements will be accommodated. Please let us know if you have any accessibility requirements.

Discover highlights from our Auckland Interpretation 101 workshop

events.long_description:
Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ
UK pop rockers Transvision Vamp are bringing those glorious hits to NZ in February - their first tour here since 1991!

Formed in 1986, Transvision Vamp quickly rose to fame. Their songs Baby I Don’t Care, Revolution Baby, I Want Your Love, The Only One, and If Looks Could K*ll, were all NZ chart hits.

Joining original Transvision Vamp's Wendy James and Dave Parsons onstage are guitarist Alex Ward (The Thurston Moore Group) and James Sclavunos (Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds) on drums.

Says Wendy James: "I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand, moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun."

events.venue: Pollard Park,Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:

events.id: Slow Burn — photography symposium-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Slow Burn — photography symposium
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To celebrate the upcoming Te Papa exhibition Slow Burn | Ahi Tāmau, we're hosting a day of collegial conversation about contemporary photography in Aotearoa. Slow Burn highlights the contribution of women and non-binary photographers, drawing on over a decade of research and collecting.
Held on opening day, this symposium begins with a special opportunity to view the exhibition before the museum opens to the public, followed by a keynote presentation from Natalie Robertson — a leading photographer, moving-image artist, and Associate Professor at Auckland University of Technology. Her practice centres her ancestral river, Waiapu, exploring how "lens-based practice can contribute to iwi-based aspirations for environmental reinvigoration".
Across a series of discussions with Aotearoa photographers, we will explore key threads in contemporary practice — including collaboration, process, and evolving photographic culture — offering insights into the ideas and relationships that shape photography today. We'll close the day in the galleries, with a performance of photographer Ann Shelton’s work The physical garden.
Open to photographers, curators, researchers, students, and anyone with an interest in photography, this event invites participants to connect, reflect, and share.
Tickets $60 (waged) / $40 (unwaged) with lunch included.
Assisted listening
An assisted listening system is available for this event. This allows you to stream the audio from the event directly to your hearing aid or smartphone headphones using the free WaveCAST app. More information can be found on our website, including how to set this up ahead of your visit. Feel free to email us at publicprogrammes@tepapa.govt.nz if you need assistance.
Image: Tia Ranginui, The tangi of Rūaumoko, 2023. Purchased 2024. Te Papa (O.052215)

events.venue: 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts proudly partners with APRA AMCOS NZ (Australasian Performing Right Association NZ) to present Songwriters Speaks 
Featuring acclaimed songwriters as they share the stories behind their waiata and compositions, offering personal insights into where the words come from. 
Hosted by Festival Co-Director Tama Waipara MNZM, this event brings the abundance of their musical kete for all to enjoy. 
Soulful singer-songwriter MAJIC and Torres Strait “guitar virtuoso” Chris Tamwoy unite for their Aotearoa debut. Prolific as individual artists, they collaborated through APRA AMCOS NZ SongHubs, resulting in the recent release of their bilingual waiata “Malu Tangata”.
One of Aotearoa’s most exciting new artists, rapper and singer-songwriter MĀ brings her genre-blending sound to Tāwhiri Warehouse. Seamlessly fusing neo-soul, jazz, and hip hop, you can catch her performance at 10pm on Saturday 28th Feb - buy tickets here
Don't miss MAJIC and Chris Tamwoy's debut performance at Māoriland on Saturday 7th March - buy tickets here
and you can catch MĀ back at Tāwhiri Warehouse at 10pm - buy tickets here

events.name: Leftfield tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: MG Live & Frontier Touring
MG Live and Frontier Touring proudly announce Leftfield – one of electronic music’s all-time greatest acts – with very special headline shows for 2026 as they continue their celebration of their 35th anniversary (36 at the time of writing).
Speaking on the shows, Neil Barnes shared, “It will be 36 years since I released the first Leftfield track, ‘Not Forgotten’, and 31 years now of Leftism. It feels like the perfect time to celebrate and I’m so pleased that finally we get to come back to New Zealand and Australia. Let’s make it unforgettable. Can’t wait to see you there!”
Leftfield’s most recent release was a collection of remixes of ‘Full Way Round (Ft Grian Chatten)’, and they have also been touring across the UK and Europe throughout 2025 to bring their 2022 album This Is What We Do to life.
“Pure Genius? It wasn’t far off.” — The Times (live review in 2025)

events.venue: Karapoti Classic,18 Karapoti Rd, Craigs Flat, Upper Hutt 5372, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Gazley Škoda Karapoti Classic
Established in 1986, the Gazley Škoda Karapoti Classic is the event that kick-started mountain biking Down Under.

Based in Upper Hutt's spectacular Akatarawa Ranges near Wellington, this ol-school adventure ride combines a huge but achievable challenge on trails that are both historic and scenic.

Karapoti really is the one race on every mountain biker's wish list. The Classic 50k is the ultimate, but the 20k Challenge & Kids 5k are great intro's to the Karapoti experience. Entries are limited to 1000 starters, so enter now at https://www.karapoti.co.nz/.

events.id: Avalanche City + Mountain Boy tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Avalanche City + Mountain Boy tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Fresh off a completely sold-out 2025 New Zealand tour, Avalanche City returns with a renewed creative spark and a live show that highlights the heart of Dave Baxter’s songwriting. Since breaking through with the global hit Love Love Love, followed by another #1 hit Inside Out, Baxter has become known for his warm, cinematic indie-folk.
His performances are intimate, engaging, and full of the storytelling that has earned Avalanche City a devoted following.
Joining the tour is Mountain Boy, an NZ Folk-Rock artist who has made waves internationally with their EP From The Dust and self-produced debut album The Days. Mountain Boy has toured with The Paper Kites, Ziggy Alberts and Boy & Bear and sold out headline shows locally. If you were lucky enough to attend a show in the Avalanche City 2025 sold out NZ tour, you may have caught a glimpse of his multi-instrumental genius, on this tour he will be returning with a full set.
Audiences can expect a powerful blend of fan favourites and new material, an evening shaped by honesty, connection, and the unmistakable charm of Avalanche City + Mountain Boy

events.id: TEIWA — Rob Ruha with the NZSO-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: TEIWA — Rob Ruha with the NZSO
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Silver Scroll-winning Māori artist Rob Ruha and the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra are joining forces for TEIWA. Here's your chance to experience everything from waiata you’d hear on the marae to exhilarating stadium anthems, The music of Aotearoa is sure to comes to life in a performance of tribal futurism that ignites the senses. Special guests TOA (Te Taumata O Apanui) will bring the unmistakable power of haka to the stage. The Michael Fowler Centre will be bursting with musical confluences and mana .
The NZSO and Rob Ruha will premiere new waiata at the event. Audiences will also hear Ruha’s most loved tracks that will have the whole house moving. After a sell-out Matariki performance with the Auckland Philharmonia, this ‘mighty celebration’ (The New Zealand Herald) is sure to be a programme highlight of Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts.
