events.id: Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall,Tutanekai Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall,Tutanekai Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.

Also check out other Festivals in Paraparaumu, Arts events in Paraparaumu, Business events in Paraparaumu.

events.id: The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 10th & 11th March 2026-8 Customs Street East, Auckland Central, Auckland 1010-Humanitix
events.name: The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 10th & 11th March 2026
events.venue: 8 Customs Street East, Auckland Central, Auckland 1010
events.long_description:
1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations)
Tues 10th March
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Tues 10th & Wed 11th March
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council

events.id: Lloyd Cole - Palmerston North-Globe Theatre,312 Main Street, Palmerston North, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Lloyd Cole - Palmerston North
events.venue: Globe Theatre,312 Main Street, Palmerston North, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Lloyd Cole - Palmerston North
Lloyd Cole announces a run of solo shows throughout New Zealand in March 2026, proudly presented by Plus1.

His elegant solo live performances in recent years have been predominantly acoustic, but for these concerts he has decided to go electric.

The performance will run the gamut from his masterful debut with the Commotions ‘Rattlesnakes’ right up to 2023’s acclaimed ‘On Pain’ touching on all points in between.

Says Lloyd: “In 1999, in retreat from mainstream ambivalence, the idea of becoming a troubadour was perversely alluring. Two acoustic guitars, a suitcase, and a round the world ticket. It took a while for me to become comfortable with it, but The Folksinger Show became my staple.

"And then, somehow or other, twenty-five years were gone, and now I find myself approaching the end of my career, and wanting to be seen more as just a singer, who wrote a body of work, very little of which one would reasonably label ‘folk’. So I’m back with my Telecaster, my Princeton amp, and my solo show is now electric.”

events.id: The King's Singers-2 Hill Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The King's Singers
events.venue: 2 Hill Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
C L O S E H A R M O N Y
For over half a century, The King’s Singers have been synonymous with impeccable blend, radiant tone, and joyful music-making. Formed in 1968 by six choral scholars from King’s College, Cambridge, the group quickly earned an international reputation for their unique approach to “close harmony” — a seamless weaving of voices across centuries and styles. Today, their performances continue to enchant audiences from London to Los Angeles, and now, back in Aotearoa.
This bespoke programme, created especially for their March 2026 tour, offers a journey through The King’s Singers’ remarkable musical history. Beginning with their earliest repertoire from the late 1960s, the evening will move through Renaissance sacred music, English folksong, jazz standards, pop classics, and contemporary works. Expect Byrd alongside Billy Joel, madrigals alongside The Beach Boys, Disney magic alongside dazzling new arrangements from the songwriters of today.
The concert also carries a special significance — it will be one of the final New Zealand appearances for long-standing baritone Chris Bruerton. A proud Kiwi, Chris has been a cornerstone of The King’s Singers for over a decade, touring the world and helping shape their modern sound. His farewell tour offers Wellington audiences a rare chance to celebrate his artistry on home soil.
A highlight of the night will be the “Something Borrowed” segment, where the ensemble will present a pair of songs chosen especially for Wellington — a personal gift to the local audience, performed in their signature style.
With wit, warmth, and unparalleled musicianship, The King’s Singers promise an evening that is both a celebration of their legacy and a showcase of their continuing innovation. Whether you’ve followed their journey for decades or are hearing them for the first time, Close Harmony at Wellington Cathedral will be a night to remember.

events.id: GLORIA - A Triple Bill-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: GLORIA - A Triple Bill
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Witness a show in honour of the renowned choreographer and dancer, Douglas Wright. The New Zealand Dance Company and Co3 Contemporary Dance Australia will restage his masterpiece, ‘Gloria’. Set to Vivaldi's legendary score, performed live by the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and Voices New Zealand. A celebration of life, dancers will fly, twist, and turn among the grandeur of the historic St James Theatre.
‘GLORIA - A Triple Bill’ was originally performed at the 1992 Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. This contemporary trans-Tasman collaboration honours one of Aotearoa's most prolific dance talents. Producing more than 30 major touring works in his life and dancing across the globe, Douglas Wright was a celebrated performer and creative until his death in 2018.
The evening will also feature two new creations. ‘A Moving Portrait’ by Raewyn Hill is an intimate, meditative reflection on ageing and grace. ‘Lament’ by Moss Te Ururangi Patterson will take audiences on a powerful journey through memory and resilience. The performance honours the whakapapa  of contemporary dance in Aotearoa.
‘GLORIA - A Triple Bill’ is exclusive to Wellington. It's presented as part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts 2026.

events.id: All in for Arts: He waka toi e eke noa nei tātou – TE WHANGANUI A TARA WELLINGTON 2026-Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix

events.long_description:
All in for Arts: He waka toi e eke noa nei tātou is back in March 2026 and we’re bringing the good vibes to a town near you. 
Together with Creative New Zealand Toi Aotearoa, The Chartwell Trust, and Stuff, we’re gathering business minds, young creatives, community leaders, artists and arts champions for a morning of kōrero, connection and creativity over coffee. 
These events are free, and everyone is welcome – even if you haven’t felt creative in years!
The details:
Date: Tuesday 12 March 2026
Time: 7:30AM-9:00AM
Venue: Parliament Banquet Hall
Our mission is to unlock the creative potential of Aotearoa and show what’s possible when imagination leads the way. Be in the room to find out what it’s all about. 
A huge mihi to Creative New Zealand, The Chartwell Trust, and Stuff for making this journey possible.

events.id: Ocean Film Festival World Tour - Wellington Thurs 12 Mar 26 6:30pm-10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Ocean Film Festival World Tour - Wellington Thurs 12 Mar 26 6:30pm
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Immerse yourself in a breathtaking 3-hour journey through the world's most spectacular marine environments. The Ocean Film Festival World Tour presents an extraordinary collection of short films that capture the raw beauty, untamed power, and majesty of our oceans.
These carefully curated films showcase stunning cinematography from surface to depths, transporting audiences into underwater realms and atop towering waves. Experience the ocean through the eyes of passionate divers, fearless surfers, dedicated swimmers, and pioneering oceanographers who live for the sea's call.
Featuring spectacular underwater scenes, heart-stopping wave sequences captured from impossible angles, and intimate portraits of ocean adventurers, each film is a visual masterpiece.
Through compelling narratives and breathtaking footage, the festival celebrates both the ocean's majesty and the remarkable creatures that call it home. The Ocean Film Festival World Tour is an unforgettable celebration that inspires audiences to marvel at the sea's beauty while fostering a deeper understanding of our connection to these precious marine ecosystems.
Find out more at https://www.oceanfilmfestivalworldtour.com/
SORRY NO REFUNDS : SEATING IS NOT ALLOCATED.
ONE SCREENING ONLY IN WELLINGTON
Photo credit: EvieWilderness

events.id: Ten Thousand Hours-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ten Thousand Hours
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Multi-award-winning contemporary circus company Gravity & Other Myths make their Wellington debut with Ten Thousand Hours. It’s an adrenaline-fueled celebration of sweat, strength and skill that promises to “shock, awe, and delight” (Glam Adelaide). 
This whānau -friendly spectacular explores physical skill; how it’s obtained, perfected, and how it can transform lives. Accompanied by live percussion, each gravity-defying leap, hold, and fall tells a story of discipline and discovery. The show offers a rare glimpse into the countless hours and dedication needed to achieve the extraordinary. The show had sell-out performances at the 2025 Edinburgh Fringe. Ten Thousand Hours is a performance unlike any other in the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts programme.

events.id: Ko au Te Taiao-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Ko au Te Taiao
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ko au te taiao helps us all to form robust understandings of who we are – as both descendants and future ancestors – in living relationship with this beautiful land. We will:
explore the rhythms of the maramataka and ways we can organise teaching practices in relation to it with Kaupapa Māori Learning Specialist, Leroy de Thierry.
observe the characteristics of mamaku, ponga + whekī, (tree ferns) and consider their whakapapa with Curator Botany, Leon Perrie.
consider how to relate to mātauranga Māori in ways that honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi + imagine rich inquiries in relation to the online resource, Ko au te taiao with Head of Learning, Sarah Hopkinson.

events.long_description:
Havelock Mussel & Seafood Festival 2026
Marking its 22nd year, the Havelock Mussel & Seafood Festival has been an integral part of Marlborough's vibrant summers and is back Saturday the 14th of March!

Indulge in the freshest catches straight from the ocean and savour the mouthwatering flavours of Marlborough's finest seafood delicacies.

Experience live music from kiwi legends & local artists, cooking demonstrations from local experts and Celebrity Chef, fascinating industry displays, and a Kids Zone to keep the little ones entertained. And, of course, be part of our Guinness World record attempt for mussel opening!

For our out-of-town festival-goers, worry not! We have arranged convenient transport options as ticket add-ons, ensuring a safe journey to and from the event.

More than just a festival, we are a community-minded, not-for-profit event with a mission to celebrate and support the local seafood industry.

By joining us, you contribute to a cause that gives back to the heart of the local community.

Let's celebrate the bounty of the ocean together!

Tickets Live 1st November - www.havelockmusselfestival.co.nz

events.id: UPCHUCK: Australia & New Zealand 2026-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: UPCHUCK: Australia & New Zealand 2026
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
If you’ve been waiting for a band that hits hard, means it and leaves nothing behind, this is it. I OH YOU and MG Live are pumped to announce provocative punk powerhouse Upchuck are bringing their explosive live show down under. The ferocious five-piece from Atlanta will make their Australian and New Zealand debut next March, with shows in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington, as well as a featured set at Victoria’s Golden Plains festival.
The tour follows the release of their blistering third album – and Domino debut – I’m Nice Now, out now here. Produced and mixed by Ty Segall, the album is a bold evolution of their sound – a raw, urgent and emotionally charged statement of survival and resistance. Formed in 2018 by a crew of Atlanta skaters in their early 20s – KT (vocals), Mikey Durham (guitar), Hoff (guitar), Ausar Ward (bass) and Chris Salado (vocals/drums) – they quickly became hometown legends. Their debut Sense Yourself (2022) and Ty Segall-produced follow-up Bite The Hand That Feeds (2023) cemented their fearless reputation. Early singles Freaky and Facecard earned praise from punk icons Iggy Pop and Henry Rollins, who both played tracks on their radio shows, while support slots for Faye Webster (who calls Upchuck “her favourite band”), Amyl and the Sniffers, Soul Glo, Osees, King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard and a breakout Coachella 2024 performance further solidified their status.
A fierce lineup of local acts will join Upchuck around Australia and New Zealand. Captivating fourpiece Blue Diner kick things off in Brisbane on Wednesday 4 March; Post-punk rockers Xiao Xiao open in Sydney on Friday 6 March with secret guests in tow! Punk Naarm trio CLAMM bring their raw and visceral sound to Melbourne on Wednesday 11 March, while Aotearoa rockers DARTZ take over Auckland on Friday 13 March and Wellington on Saturday 14 March with their signature fiery live set! Like your punk loud, honest and unfiltered? This is the tour you’ve been waiting for. Don’t miss Upchuck’s debut down under.


MG LIVE TERMS OF SALE

https://mg.live/termsofsale
events.description:
I OH YOU and MG Live are pumped to announce provocative punk powerhouse Upchuck are bringing their explosive live show down under.
The ferocious five-piece from Atlanta will make their Australian and New Zealand debut next March, with shows in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington, as well as a featured set at Victoria’s Golden Plains festival.
Produced and mixed by Ty Segall, the album is a bold evolution of their sound – a raw, urgent and emotionally charged statement of survival and resistance.
Punk Naarm trio CLAMM bring their raw and visceral sound to Melbourne on Wednesday 11 March, while Aotearoa rockers DARTZ take over Auckland on Friday 13 March and Wellington on Saturday 14 March with their signature fiery live set!
This is the tour you’ve been waiting for.

events.id: Iron & Wine tickets-Meow, Te Aro, Wellington-Ticketek
events.name: Iron & Wine tickets
events.venue: Meow, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours
Handsome Tours is proud to present the return of Iron & Wine!
Iron & Wine, the moniker of singer/songwriter and film studies lecturer Sam Beam, returns to Australia for the first time since 2018 – this time as soloist in a captivating run of shows in capital cities and festival appearances, drawing from his transcendent and illuminating folk sounds.
Known for his deeply burnished vocals, keen melodic sensibility, and introspective, free-flowing lyrical point of view, Iron & Wine is one of the preeminent artists and collaborators of the first wave of indie folk. Following his most recent EP release of covers, Making Good Time – a collaboration with Ben Bridwell (Band of Horses), and his 2024 full length album Light Verse, Iron & Wine come to Australia off the back of a huge US tour with award-winning trio I’m With Her and Seattle favourites Band of Horses.
For more than a decade, Iron & Wine has crafted a body of work spanning seven studio albums, numerous EPs and singles, each marked by atmospheric arrangements, poetic storytelling, and Sam Beam’s singular voice. From modest beginnings with The Creek Drank the Cradle, through the rustic beauty of The Shepherd’s Dog, the bold explorations of Kiss Each Other Clean and Ghost on Ghost, to the reflective resonance of Beast Epic and the orchestral sweep of Light Verse, Iron & Wine has earned acclaim for its capacity to move between the hushed and the grand with elegance and emotional clarity.
Iron & Wine will perform solo, playing stripped back music from his expansive catalogue including songs from latest album Light Verse, fan favourites from his collaborations with Calexico and I’m With Her, and the cinematic gems such as the slow dance soundtrack from Twilight.

events.id: Voices New Zealand presents: Ara Hura — A Visionary Journey-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Voices New Zealand presents: Ara Hura — A Visionary Journey
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aotearoa’s most influential choral conductor has made her mark across multiple choirs in New Zealand and beyond. The huge contribution of Dr Karen Grylls is celebrated in ‘Ara Hura — A Visionary Journey’. 
It’s fitting that this Aotearoa Festival of the Arts concert involves the choir Dr Grylls founded 28 years ago. Voices New Zealand debuted with a concert at the same festival in 1998. It has gone on to build a reputation for excellence in the music world. For this celebratory concert, the choir is joined by taonga pūoro artist Horomona Horo, leading instrumentalists, and a chamber ensemble from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra. 
The concert centrepiece is Robert Wiremu’s Re-imagined Mozart: Erebus. The programme also features a new commission from Takerei Komene, as well as waiata by Ngāpō and Pimia Wehi. This highlights Dr Grylls’ pioneering collaborations that reshaped Aotearoa’s choral landscape. Her expertise as a choral clinician is sought internationally, and she regularly conducts masterclasses and workshops in Wales, England, North America, Canada and Australia. 
This marks Dr Grylls’ final appearance as Music Director of Voices New Zealand. It’s a rare opportunity to celebrate her vision, artistry, and legacy.

events.id: CubaDupa--Wellington NZ
events.name: CubaDupa
events.description:
One weekend every March, CubaDupa takes over some of Wellington’s central city streets for an epic party.
The free annual festival brings a carnival vibe to the end of the summer.
It offers live music, street theatre, dance, parades, and other cultural experiences.
CubaDupa is New Zealand’s largest outdoor arts and music festival.
It takes place over two days on Cuba Street and the surrounding roads, right in the heart of Wellington.

events.id: Grace Petrie-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Grace Petrie
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
UK protest singer Grace Petrie has become a force on the international folk scene, known for her razor-sharp lyrics, fierce politics and laugh-out-loud wit on stage. Often compared to Billy Bragg, she writes songs that rally, comfort and cut straight to the bone, tackling themes of feminism, queer identity and social justice with passion and bite. 
Since touring New Zealand in 2020 with The Guilty Feminist, Grace has won a loyal following here, drawn to both her firebrand politics and her disarming charm. Her breakout single Black Tie became a queer anthem, streaming over 1.2 million times and drawing praise from MOJO, The Observer and The New Yorker.
Her latest album Build Something Better, produced by Frank Turner, topped the UK folk charts and confirmed what fans already knew: Grace Petrie is one of Britain’s most vital, uncompromising and entertaining songwriters.

events.id: Menopause The Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Menopause The Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Described as the ultimate ladies’ night out, Menopause the Musical has been delivering laughs across the globe for 10 years. Now the fun-filled musical about ‘the change’ returns to Wellington for one night.  
Set in a department store, four women meet by chance while shopping for a black lace bra. Though they couldn’t be more different, they quickly discover a shared bond over memory loss, hot flushes, night sweats, and mood swings. What follows is a hilarious, heartwarming musical told with love, laughter, and the greatest hits of the 60s, 70s, and 80s. The laughter-filled 90-minute production gets audiences out of their seats dancing and singing along to clever parodies of beloved pop classics. 
Winner of over 40 Tony Awards, Menopause the Musical has entertained more than 17 million fans worldwide. It’s been translated into nine languages and performed in more than 500 cities. The show’s enduring appeal lies in its honesty, hilarity and heart. It celebrates women everywhere and turns shared experiences into shared joy.

events.id: The Rocky Horror Show-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Rocky Horror Show
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Dust off your corset, strap on your heels, and get ready to Time Warp like it’s 1973. After a 15-year hiatus, The Rocky Horror Show is back. The musical, written 50 years ago by New Zealand national treasure Richard O’Brien, stars a phenomenal West End cast. This high-energy stage spectacular features all the catchy songs you know and love: Sweet Transvestite, Dammit Janet, and the pelvic-thrusting, showstopper Time Warp. 
The show follows two squeaky-clean college kids, Brad and Janet. The couple find themselves stranded outside a mysterious mansion. Inside awaits the fabulous and flamboyant Dr Frank’n’Furter, and a wild adventure full of fun, frolics, frocks, and frivolity. 
The Rocky Horror Show is the longest continuously running contemporary musical in the world. It has thrilled over 35 million theatregoers, been staged in 30 countries, and translated into 20 languages. Get dressed up, let loose, and be your fabulous self at the biggest glitter-soaked party in town.

events.name: Soiree at the Zoo; A Night for our Whanau and Animals
events.venue: 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, New Zealand 6021,Wellington Zoo - Manchester Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Soiree at the Zoo; A Night for our Whanau and Animals
Are you ready to take a walk on the wild side? Be a rebel with a cause?

Join Ronald McDonald House Charities® New Zealand (RMHC® NZ) and Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo for our joint fundraiser, 'Soirée at the Zoo: A night for our families and animals.’ RMHC NZ and Wellington Zoo have a long history of working together in the community. We wanted to secure the future of the work we do by hosting this fundraiser, as we approach nearly a decade of partnership.

We are excited to bring you an epic night of glitz, good vibes and an action-packed live auction with some fabulous prizes, all to raise much-needed funds for RMHC NZ and Wellington Zoo. 🌟✨

📅 Date: 22 November 2025
🕕 Time: 6.30pm – 11.00pm
📍 Location: Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021

🎟️ BUY TICKETS NOW to secure your spot and get ready to:
• Explore the zoo after hours
• Enjoy delicious canapés with a complimentary welcome drink
• Feel the electric excitement of the live auction and raffle
• Let your hair down and hit the dance floor with some choice local music
• Mix and mingle with your friends and some familiar Wellingtonian faces
• Be captivated by the journey of a local RMHC NZ whānau and Wellington Zoo
• And much more!
By attending our Soirée, you'll be making a real difference as all proceeds raised will be shared equally between RMHC NZ and Wellington Zoo.

🏡 Every day, RMHC NZ provides families with a child in hospital a ‘home-away-from-home'. RMHC NZ supports over 4,400 Kiwi families every year, keeping them together during their toughest times.

Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo welcomes families using RMHC NZ services to the Zoo for free, through our community partnership. Each year, over 400 adults and kids come to spend time with animals in nature. The zoo is a place of healing for over 250,000 people each year, including whānau from RMHC NZ.

Get ready for an unforgettable evening that makes a real impact! With only 150 tickets available, make sure you seize the day and secure yours!

We can’t wait to see you there!

events.id: The Datsuns-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: The Datsuns
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Time has rolled on, and so has the clan DATSUN. After years of wrangling riffs across distant lands, marinating in sonic experiments, and rebuilding the clan’s percussive backbone, they return to their homeland with fire in their strings, fury in their rhythms, and rock & roll coursing through every vein.
 This tour marks the clan’s first full assault across Aotearoa since 2018, kicks off in March 2026, promising joyous savagery, riffs honed to perfection, and the raw energy that only The DATSUNS can deliver. The tour sees the clan’s Scandinavian drummer Adam Lindmark (Dead Lord) taking up the thundering seat, joining lead string wrangler Christian, Phil on the rhythmic weavings, and Dolf conjuring hooks across hemispheres, bringing a lifetime of Datsun lessons to the stage.
 Audiences can expect the full sweep of The Datsuns’ catalogue, from the anthems that scorched their early path to the first sparks of their eighth studio album, set to arrive in 2026. The first taste, ‘Ugly Leather’ – accompanied by a blistering video, old fire, new fuel, same unrelenting inferno.

Joining them are DJs T & Sugah and Krakota. Along with an impressive production team, they’ll transform Shed 6 into an otherworldly experience. Expect a kaleidoscope of colours, lighting effects, and projections to dance to.

events.id: EC-MENz Summit 2026-189 Ohariu Valley Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: EC-MENz Summit 2026
events.venue: 189 Ohariu Valley Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
EC-MENz vision is for men fully participating at all levels of Early Childhood Education to represent the diversity of our society in Aotearoa.
The EC-MENz Summit 2026 is kindly being hosted and supported by Childspace.

Tāne, wāhine, and irawhiti are warmly invited to participate in a special day of high quality, affordable professional learning. This celebration of gender diversity in ECE will be held in a safe and supportive environment and is a fantastic opportunity to meet others in the profession, share your own story, and be inspired.
Gender Steretoypes in ECE - Mike Collin and Max Christie
What can gender stereotypes teach us about teaching and learning?
Early childhood education relies on diversity within teaching teams. Yet, gender stereotypes often shape how we see ourselves and each other as kaiako. This interactive session invites educators to explore the hidden assumptions that influence teaching roles and team dynamics. In this session, Max and Mike will unpack how stereotypes impact collaboration and how every kaiako adds unique value to teaching teams. Participants will leave with practical strategies to challenge bias, strengthen team culture, and celebrate the richness of varied approaches in ECE settings.
Autism NZ - Thecla Moffat
Men can change the dynamics of play in ECE benefiting autistic tamariki
Male kaiako often bring more energy in the ECE setting with an emphasis on more physical activity, outdoor play, "rough and tumble" play, and positive risk-taking, which appeals to both boys and girls and provides a different dimension to play than may be beneficial to most autistic tamariki. We now know that through fun and engaging interactions kaiako help enhance the autistic tamariki pivotal capacities for later learning. In this talk kaiako will get to know how men in ECE with their positive energy can make a difference through play for autistic tamariki in their centres. The kaiako will be given a few strategies of how to do that and some ideas to encourage tuakana-teina (peer play) between autistic tamariki and their non-autistic peers will be shared.

events.id: Matt Maltese | Meow Nui, Wellington-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Matt Maltese | Meow Nui, Wellington
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Matt Maltese | Meow Nui, Wellington
⏰ Pre-sale starts Thur 30 Oct at 11am (local)
⏰ General tickets go on sale Fri 31 Oct at 11am (local)
⚡️ Sign up for pre-sale access
PRE-SALE: https://bit.ly/MM26_ps_DNU

Handsome Tours are proud to present Matt Maltese on his highly anticipated return to Australia + New Zealand this March!
The tour follows the release of his sixth studio album Hers – his most insular and intimate record yet, and his first fully self-produced effort since his acclaimed 2019 LP Krystal.
Existing in a twilight world, Hers pairs heartfelt songwriting and dry witticism with the gentle quiver of strings, a flourish of woodwind and the sound of a creaking old piano. It captures Maltese at his most personal, trading irony for honesty and humour for vulnerability.

Much like kindred spirits Randy Newman and Father John Misty, beneath Maltese’s sumptuous melodies and classic pop craftsmanship there’s always a lyric that stops you in your tracks – sometimes breaking your heart, sometimes making you laugh. Across the album’s eleven tracks, Maltese’s trademark wit is still present but wielded with restraint, often emerging through self-deprecation and quiet revelation.

Having first established himself in 2018 with his debut Bad Contestant, Maltese has since evolved into one of the UK’s finest young songwriters. The albums that followed cemented his reputation for transforming the mundane into something dream-like, his piano harmonies, playful lyricism and quintessentially British wit resonating around the world.

In late 2024, Maltese embarked on a headline tour across Asia, Australia and New Zealand, following sold-out runs through the US, Europe and the UK – including his biggest performances to date at The Wiltern in Los Angeles and London’s Electric Brixton. With Hers, he now steps into an even bigger chapter: playing to larger rooms than ever before and connecting with an audience that continues to grow from Sydney to São Paulo, Jakarta to Tokyo.

Audiences can expect an enchanting live experience that blends Maltese’s new material with an favourites spanning his six-album catalogue – poetic, wry, and unashamedly human.

events.id: For Singing's sake Festival-211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: For Singing's sake Festival
events.venue: 211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join community choirs from the Wellington region for a day of singing, sharing, and learning , all while having fun getting to know each other. Experience the magic of mass singing and the energy of performing for and cheering each other. Our song leaders for the inaugural year of this Festival are Susie Hardie (Hutt Valley Community Choir, Andrea Robinson (Khandallah Singers), and Lala Simpson (Wellington Community Choir and Kotaba Voices). We will start the day as a mass choir to learn 3 songs for our combined performance, then in the afternoon we will present a FREE public concert featuring each choir and our mass choir. We are looking forward to singing with you!
Please bring: a drink bottle, keep cups, comfortable clothing for rehearsals, performance attire for the concert, and your own lunch.
Schedule for the day:
10 am -arrivals and first combined rehearsal 
11:00- morning tea break (provided)
11:15 – Combined rehearsal (sectional)
11:40– combined rehearsal
12:30– lunch (Please bring your own)
1:00 – combined rehearsal and individual choirs practice getting on and off stage
2:00- break
2:30 – concert begins
4:00 – finish

An ELECTRIC SIX show outrageous, irreverent, decadent, bizarre and a lot of fun!

events.name: Peach PRC — Wandering Spirit Tour
events.venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Peach PRC is celebrated globally for her emotionally rich, unfiltered and vulnerable songwriting. Now the Australian pop sensation is coming to Wellington with a solo show that presents her magnetic personality and irreverent sense of humour. The Wandering Spirit Tour will help cement her reputation as one of Australia’s most influential new-gen pop visionaries. Peach has cultivated a deeply engaged community by pushing pop into bold and theatrical territory. 
With over 230 million streams across her discography and over 2 billion social views, Peach has established a large presence in the music world. Her debut EP ‘Manic Dream Pixie’ debuted at #1 on the ARIA Album Charts and won Music Act of the Year at the TikTok Awards in 2023. Rolling Stone magazine says of her rise, “Peach PRC is absolutely living her best life — and she’s bringing her fans along for the ride.” Joining Peach PRC in her Wellington concert are US pop newcomer, Maude Latour and Sydney pop artist, Salty.

events.id: FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL-309 Rapaura Road, Rapaura 7273, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL
events.venue: 309 Rapaura Road, Rapaura 7273, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram

events.id: Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026-Maclean park Paraparaumu Beach,12A Marine Pde, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026
events.venue: Maclean park Paraparaumu Beach,12A Marine Pde, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026
We’ve checked the tide timetable – Anchor your calendar now to take part in the 2026 Web Genius Kāpiti Run for Youth on Sunday 29 March 2026 – Raising funds for rangatahi in Kāpiti since 2011 while having fun strolling or running along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Kāpiti Run for Youth is a lively, family-friendly event focused on fostering community spirit and supporting organisations that encourage and uplift local young people. RAIN or SHINE, get ready to have fun!

We know Kāpiti Run for Youth helps to support amazing community work done by local fundraising partners. We have 13 incredible fundraising partners you can choose to support and raise funds for. We are very proud of them all and the work they do to uplift the youth of Kāpiti. Each partner brings something unique to the table, from providing essential resources and mentorship to creating spaces where young people can thrive. By supporting rangatahi through education, creativity, employment, and well-being initiatives, they ensure our youth are not just supported but empowered to reach their full potential. Our partners are creating a brighter tomorrow for the young people of Kāpiti!

In the beginning Kāpiti Run for Youth was created by Web Genius as their way as a local business to ‘give back’ to the community so, more than a decade on we can proudly say the event is sustainable and is popular with all sorts, young and old, the fit and not so fit. Kāpiti Run for Youth has raised $280,003 for rangatahi since inception in 2011. In 2025 the event raised $25,531 which was remarkable.

Kāpiti Run for Youth will be open for sign up early in January 2026 >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/signup

At that time, we will be seeking individuals and teams to get together to walk or run from Paraparaumu Beach (Maclean Park) to Raumati Beach and back. For those choosing the 12km walk or run, they will do two circuits of the course.

Choose your adventure – a 6km or 12km run or walk along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Whether it's a leisurely stroll or a mad dash to be the first across the finish, you choose the event that suits you best, and which of our amazing fundraising partners you're going to raise funds for. On race day grab your dog and your mates and head down to the beach for fun, family and fitness. Registration takes place from 8.30am to 9.45am with a briefing at 9.45am and all walkers and runners starting together at 10am.

Once your profile is set-up online, let your family, friends and work mates know so they can sponsor your efforts. We encourage every participant to raise $20 through sponsorship instead of paying an entry fee. All entrants receive regular campaigns to motivate their sponsorship efforts along the way.

Kāpiti Run for Youth prides itself on being a sustainable, family-friendly event that is all about supporting each other and having fun. Join your community for a feel-good morning on the beach. Your fundraising makes a difference in the lives of our young people! BYO sunhat, sunscreen, and water on the day, and there are sponsored spot prizes, treats for the kids, certificates for participating and free Paekākāriki Mini Pops for everyone at the end.

Checkout our FAQs over on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/faqs

Closer to the event, go to our website to sign up or sponsor someone that you know who is participating >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/search

All registrations and sponsorship are handled securely and confidentially on the Kāpiti Run for Youth website that is powered by Raisley and supported by Stripe online payments.

---------------------------------------------

BUSINESS SPONSORSHIP
Platinum $1,000+, Gold $500, Silver $250, Bronze $125 is available for businesses who want to support the underlying work of this event and rangatahi youth of Kāpiti. In 2025 we were grateful to 58 local business sponsors to the value of $15,125 that can be viewed on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/sponsors

Sponsorship for the 2026 campaign will open late in January 2026

---------------------------------------------

FUNDRAISING MODEL
We focus on returning as much money as we can back to the Kāpiti community to those working with rangatahi. All funds raised are split 70% to the official Fundraising Partner chosen by the participant at the time of registration and 30% is retained towards running and promotion of the event.

FUNDRAISING PARTNERS
Birthright Kāpiti, Challenge for Change Kāpiti, Kāpiti Basketball Association, Kāpiti College, Kāpiti Kindness Trust, Kāpiti Youth Support, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets Kāpiti, Ōtaki College, Paraparaumu College, The Shed Project Kāpiti, Whirlwind Kāpiti, Work Ready Kāpiti, ZEAL Kāpiti >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/fundraising-partners

---------------------------------------------

WELLNESS UPDATE
We operate within the Event Sector Voluntary Code. Please don’t attend if you are feeling unwell.

REGISTRATION DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth carries comprehensive Public Liability event insurance for a period of 48 hours that includes set-up, pack-down and during the event. We maintain an Accident & Incident Register at the Registration Gazebo and local GP, Paraparaumu Medical Centre, handle any medical emergency on the day of the event. We dial 111 if there is an incident beyond their resources.

We remind participants to take self-responsibility and those they are with when on the beach course and to alert officials as needed. It is important to listen to all instructions given on the day of the event at the pre-course briefing, and to report any incidents however minor they may seem. To report an incident, dial 027 244 9585.

PHOTOGRAPHY DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.

---------------------------------------------

IN-KIND EVENT SPONSORS
24/7 Fitness, Beach FM, Captured By Friday Photography, Coffee to Die For, Kāpiti Business Projects, Kāpiti Chocolate Factory, Kāpiti Law, Kāpiti Party Hire, NZME, Paekākāriki Pops, Peter Jackson Plumbing, R-Line, Shoe Clinic, SignCraft Kāpiti, Speedy Signs Kāpiti-Porirua, Wellington Water Filters & Kāpiti Pure Water and Founder, Web Genius.

CAMPAIGN MANAGER:
Helene Judge | 027 244 9585

Also check out other Workshops in Paraparaumu, Sports events in Paraparaumu.

events.id: Soweto Gospel Choir-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Soweto Gospel Choir
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The sound of close harmony singing from South Africa is set to ring out across the St James Theatre in March. The Soweto Gospel Choir is a 30-member ensemble that blends African gospel, spirituals, reggae and American popular music into rousing concerts. For its Wellington concert, the choir will present songs and anthems from Nelson Mandela’s Freedom Movement in South Africa and the Civil Rights Movement of Dr Martin Luther King’s America. There will also be contemporary classics. Hear songs by legendary artists Elvis Presley, Sam Cooke, Cynthia Erivo, Stevie Wonder, and Aretha Franklin. 
Since it formed in 2002, the Soweto Gospel Choir has performed around the world. The choir is dedicated to celebrating the unique and inspirational power of South African Gospel music. It’s won numerous awards, including three Grammy Awards for Best Traditional World Music Album.

The choir is dedicated to celebrating the unique and inspirational power of South African Gospel music.

events.id: David & Shimna @ Newlands-9 Batchelor Street, Newlands, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: David & Shimna @ Newlands
events.venue: 9 Batchelor Street, Newlands, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This dynamic guitar & violin duo are re-united for a series of sizzling shows across New Zealand in 2026. Shimna will be back from Belfast, Northern Ireland & this tour marks a special reunion, a chance to bring their close harmonies, infectious fun vibes, and exquisite guitar and fiddle playing back home to New Zealand where it all began!
Seated Show
Intimate Setting
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s
Saturday 28th March at Kingston House
Doors open from 6:30pm / show starts at 7pm (8:45pm finish).
Tickets are VERY limited - don't miss out!
What people are saying:
“Seriously sublime stringwork. World-class melodies.”
“Amazingly written and performed piece that kept me glued through to the end.”
“Great guitar riffs and performance – your two voices are so nice together.”
"OMG I love you guys"
David & Shimna are an acoustic guitar and violin duo whose music has been described as “absolutely beautiful… perfectly played… fragile yet powerful.” Their sound blends intricate guitar work, lyrical fiddle, and close vocal harmonies into a powerful yet vulnerable experience for all present.
David is based in Auckland, while Shimna has been living in Belfast, Northern Ireland since March 2025. This tour marks a special reunion, a chance to bring their music back home to New Zealand and share it in the way it’s meant to be heard: up close and personal in a town near you.
This summer, they’ll be touring small halls and community spaces across Aotearoa, bringing their songs to places most musicians don’t usually go. Each evening is an invitation: a night of stories, connection, and an experience intended to stay with you long after the music has ended.

events.id: Bic Runga & The NZSO-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Bic Runga & The NZSO
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
More than 60 classical musicians will collaborate with Bic Runga and her band for a special concert in Wellington. Bic Runga & the NZSO is a concert of songs from Bic’s much-anticipated new album ‘Red Sunset’. The performance will also feature a selection of hits and best-loved songs spanning the artist’s extraordinary 31-year career.   
This is the only leg of the ‘Red Sunset’ tour featuring orchestra, so expect the songs to be transformed by the powerful accompaniment. Also involved in the show is Bic’s partner, multi-instrumentalist Kody Nielson of The Mint Chicks and Unknown Mortal Orchestra fame.   
Bic Runga (Ngāti Kahungunu) is a multi-award-winning singer-songwriter. The youngest inductee into the New Zealand Music Hall of Fame, she shot to fame in 1996 with the single ‘Drive’. Her 1997 debut album ‘Drive’, including the hit ‘Sway’, won the Tūī for Album of the Year. Over her career, she has won 20 Tūī awards — the most for an Aotearoa solo artist, including Best Female Vocalist four times. 
A New Zealand Order of Merit recipient for services to music. Bic is also acclaimed for her collaborations and live performances with other music icons, such as Tim and Neil Finn, Sir Dave Dobbyn and Anika Moa. She’s also inspired and influenced a new generation of New Zealand musicians. Lorde described her as “New Zealand music royalty” when she performed on stage with Bic in 2019.

She’s also inspired and influenced a new generation of New Zealand musicians.
Lorde described her as “New Zealand music royalty” when she performed on stage with Bic in 2019.

events.id: The Pogues — Rum, Sodomy & the Lash 40th Anniversary-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Pogues — Rum, Sodomy & the Lash 40th Anniversary
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s been 35 years since The Pogues were in New Zealand, and 40 years since the release of their most famous album. Now is your chance to hear them live singing songs from their iconic 1985 album ‘Rum, Sodomy & the Lash’. Not only will you get the full album, but there will also be other much-loved favourites. Hear A Pair of Brown Eyes, Dirty Old Town, A Rainy Night in Soho, and plenty more. 
Helping bring this re-creation to life are original members James Fearnley, Jem Finer and Spider Stacy. There is also a special lineup of acclaimed guest vocalists, Daragh Lynch, Iona Zajac, and John Francis Flynn. Together they’ll present a soul-stirring celebration of one of modern music’s most enduring legacies. 
The Pogues formed in 1982 and fused punk with traditional Irish music. They originally called themselves Pogue Mahone. This phrase is an anglicisation of the Irish for póg mo thóin, meaning “kiss my arse”.

Hear A Pair of Brown Eyes, Dirty Old Town, A Rainy Night in Soho, and plenty more.

events.id: Ultra New Zealand-Wellington Waterfront-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ultra New Zealand
events.venue: Wellington Waterfront
events.long_description:
It’s entertained fans across six continents. Now, for the first time, Ultra Music Festival is coming to New Zealand. Arguably one of the most recognisable brands in electronic dance music, Ultra is coming to Wellington for an exclusive stop-off. Known for delivering an epic combination of electronic music talent and impressive stage productions, the festival will take place along the capital’s picturesque waterfront on Friday, 10 April 2026. 
The one-day festival will span three world-class stages, with a fourth dedicated to local drum and bass artists. Along with Wellington’s calm autumn weather, Ultra is expected to attract up to 20,000 people from across the country, as well as Australia and beyond. Previous headline performers at Ultra events include David Guetta, Calvin Harris, Skrillex, Tiësto, Armin van Buuren, Martin Garrix, Deadmau5, and Charlotte de Witte. 
The 2026 lineup will be announced on 10 December, with tickets being available on 17 December.

New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous travelling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!

events.id: Mountain Goats | Meow Nui, Wellington - VENUE UPGRADED!-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Mountain Goats | Meow Nui, Wellington - VENUE UPGRADED!
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Mountain Goats | Meow Nui, Wellington - VENUE UPGRADED!
UPGRADED TO MEOW NUI DUE TO OVERWHELMING DEMAND

Handsome Tours are proud to present The Mountain Goats!

Veteran indie-rock storytellers The Mountain Goats will make their long-awaited return to Australia and New Zealand in April 2026, with performances in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide, Perth, Auckland and Wellington. This eagerly-anticipated tour represents the band's first visit to Australia in 9 years (2017) and their first trip to New Zealand in 16 years (2010).

Fronted by prolific songwriter and novelist John Darnielle, The Mountain Goats are revered the world over for their sprawling catalogue of twenty-three studio albums released between 1994 and 2023. This tour announcement coincides with the band today unveiling album number twenty-four, 'Through This Fire Across From Peter Balkan' - to be released 7th November 2025 on Cadmean Dawn Records (the band’s own label).

Produced by the Mountain Goats’ multi-instrumentalist Matt Douglas, Through This Fire Across From Peter Balkan is a full-on musical that stands as the most conceptually detailed and musically elaborate project in the band’s ever-expanding catalogue. It features appearances from The Replacements’ Tommy Stinson, harpist Mikaela Davis, musical theatre royalty Lin-Manuel Miranda (Tony Award-winning ‘Hamilton’, Disney’s ‘Moana’ & ‘Encanto’), and the band’s new bassist Cameron Ralston.

Don’t miss one of indie rock’s most enduring and beloved bands as they make their long-overdue return to our shores!

events.id: Helmet 2026 | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Helmet 2026 | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
HELMET ANNOUNCE RETURN TO AOTEAROA IN APRIL 2026
"Helmet stripped away the excess, dialled in the precision, and redefined what heaviness could sound like without succumbing to clichés." Pitchfork
NYC Noise Rock Instigators Helmet return to Aotearoa / New Zealand for two shows in April 2026. Playing Wellington’s San Fran on Saturday 11 April, followed by The Powerstation in Auckland on Sunday 12 April. 
Tickets on sale Thursday 2 October 12pm from helmetmusic.com
Helmet has built a reputation as one of the most commanding forces in the underground scene. Born at the dawn of the rage-filled 90’s, Helmet fiercely holds space for multiple generations of alternative fans seeking the vital energy of hostile riffs and inventive metronomic groove. With a refusal to fit neatly into a genre, Helmet’s music creates an atmosphere best known live; part industrial, part hip-hop, part existential sermon. 

Formed in 1989 in NYC by Page Hamilton, Helmet has been crushing stages for over three decades. In that time they have only come to Aotearoa / NZ a handful of times, most recently in 2023 during their sold out Best of Helmet 1989-2023 tour, with 13th Floor declaring “a complete evening of essential music from one of heavy music’s most essential bands.” With 35 years of rocking behind them, Helmet are at the top of their game. Don’t miss Helmet in New Zealand next April. Tickets on sale Thursday 2 October, 12pm 
HELMET 
New Zealand April ‘26
Presented by Eccles Entertainment, 95bFM, Under The Radar

Sat 11 April 
San Fran | Wellington
helmetmusic.com
Sun 12 April 
Powerstation | Auckland
helmetmusic.com

events.id: Joanne McNally — Pinotphile-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Joanne McNally — Pinotphile
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
She’s a comedian boasting stage, television, and podcast success. Joanne McNally heads to The Opera House in Wellington for a new stage show. Pinotphile displays the Irish comic’s wry wit and sense of the absurd. Hailed by Variety as One to Watch, McNally has been keeping herself busy since her last tour by ruining men’s lives (and her own). For Pinophile, she’s still single, still unfertilised, and laden with irreverent, ridiculous and hilarious war stories. Join Joanne for a wild ride as she navigates situationships, revenge, frenemies and rejection. The Irish Examiner describes her trademark style as ‘joyously nuts’. 
You may have come across Joanne as a co-host of the award-winning podcast My Therapist Ghosted Me. She’s also had riotous appearances on Taskmaster, The Jonathan Ross Show and The Big Fat Quiz of Everything.

events.id: NZ Brewers Fest-25 Blenheim Street, New Zealand 5014,25 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: NZ Brewers Fest
events.venue: 25 Blenheim Street, New Zealand 5014,25 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
NZ Brewers Fest
NZ Brewers Fest is moving to April!
Lining up with Fresh Hop season, we will be bringing the all the incredible beers, outstanding entertainment and delicious kai you expect, with a fresh hop twist!

Save the date and watch this space for more info, coming soon!


Drinks!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!

Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!

New for this year! Step into our cocktail bar for some seriously scrumptious spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some delicious drops just for you.

We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.

Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy every craving.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

Entertainment!
Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling.

Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint.

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!
🎃 R18

events.name: Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall,Tutanekai Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
Get ready for a day of love, celebration, and unforgettable inspiration at the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026 – the Kapiti Coast’s premier event for anyone planning a wedding, special event, or milestone celebration. Taking place on Sunday, 19 April 2026, from 10am to 3pm at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, this vibrant expo brings together over 40 of the region’s top wedding and event professionals, all in one beautiful space. Best of all? Entry is completely FREE!

From breathtaking florals and stunning venue styling to expert celebrants, creative photographers, world-class entertainment, and delectable food and drink offerings, this expo has it all. Whether you’re newly engaged, planning a birthday bash, organising a corporate event, or simply love all things celebration, the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is your one-stop destination for inspiration and expert advice.

This year’s expo promises an immersive experience packed with exclusive show-only offers, giveaways, and dazzling live performances on the Main Stage. Meet the creative minds behind Kapiti’s most iconic celebrations, explore dreamy decor ideas, and uncover the latest wedding and event trends that will help you bring your vision to life. Our hand-picked exhibitors are the best in the business, offering fresh ideas and tailored solutions to make your event truly unforgettable.

But that’s not all – your free ticket also unlocks exclusive deals across the Kapiti Coast. From boutique shopping and cosy cafes to scenic stays and local attractions, our Explore Kapiti program gives you access to fantastic discounts and experiences from our local business partners. Simply show your expo ticket to take advantage of these offers while you’re in town.

The Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is proudly brought to you by Kapiti Castles, experienced event organisers who understand how to make moments magical. With a deep love for creativity, community, and connection, we’ve crafted this event to help you dream big and plan with confidence.

So don’t miss out – grab your free tickets today and join us for an extraordinary day of discovery, excitement, and inspiration. Whether you're planning a wedding, a party, or something truly unique, this is where your perfect celebration begins.

Also check out other Business events in Paraparaumu, Exhibitions in Paraparaumu, Workshops in Paraparaumu.

events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours
Handsome Tours are proud to present Sleaford Mods 2026 Australian & New Zealand Tour
This will be Sleaford Mods first time back to Australian and New Zealand soil since May and June of 2023, where they performed at events like Sydney's Vivid LIVE and Hobart's Dark Mofo.
“We took a year off ’cause I needed to get my nails did, and now we’re itching to get back out there and play live”, says Sleaford Mods' Jason Williamson. “We released a new single Megaton last month, it’s an absolute banger so we’re buzzing to play that live for the first time. Who knows, we might have a few more new tracks to drop by then. Either way, it’s been a while since we toured, and we’re gagging for it.”
Sleaford Mods has partnered with PLUS1 to support War Child. $1.15 inc GST from every ticket sold will help War Child to protect, educate, and stand up for the rights of children affected by war.
www.warchild.org.uk

events.id: Faultline Ultra--Wellington NZ
events.name: Faultline Ultra
events.long_description:
Calling all athletes on foot or bike. National and international competitors are invited to test their endurance at Faultline Ultra. For runners and mountain bikers, it’s a dream come true — the ultimate stamina challenge set against the wildly beautiful Wellington landscape. 
In April 2026, the hills and trails around Wellington offer six possible routes for athletes to push their limits. Beginning with 6-kilometre and 12km tests, the routes grow in length to 25km, 53km, 103km, and a colossal 161-kilometre challenge. You choose the length depending on your ability. 
The fault lines around Wellington have pushed and pulled the land to create soaring peaks, rugged ridgelines, and bush-clad hills. Athletes can choose trails that wind through Wellington City, Karori, Porirua, Belmont, the Hutt River Trail, and Kāpiti. Sign up and compete — you’re likely to get the best after-match stories you will ever tell.

events.id: King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s a global phenomenon hailed as the most electrifying celebration of the King of Pop’s music. ‘The King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience’ makes its way to New Zealand — and Wellington — for the first time. If you never had the chance to see Michael Jackson live, this is the closest you’ll ever get. From the famous moonwalk to the spine-tingling vocals, every moment of this production channels the spirit of the King of Pop at his peak. Witness the power of hits like Billie Jean, Thriller, Beat It, Smooth Criminal, and plenty more. 
The star of the show is TJ Cappola. His stunning vocals and commanding stage presence make for a flawless embodiment of Michael Jackson. With sold-out performances across Australia and Asia, thousands have been mesmerised by his performance. Backing TJ is a live band and world-class dancers. The replica costumes and cutting-edge lighting and visual display make this more than just a show — it’s an experience.

events.name: One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend
events.venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The One New Zealand Warriors and Sky Stadium are proud to invite you to the Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
This exclusive experience will give the biggest Rugby League fans a unique opportunity to get closer to the action than ever before as the One New Zealand Warriors return to Sky Stadium on ANZAC weekend 2026. With a jam-packed schedule of behind-the-scenes access, enthralling events, and an epic showdown on the Saturday, it’s bound to be a weekend you won’t forget.
What’s Included:
Friday Night Welcome
Kick off the weekend with some of the biggest Warriors fans in the country! Start in the Warriors changing room, feel the hype build, and then emerge through the players tunnel with pyrotechnics, smoke, lights and music - experience entering Sky Stadium just as the teams themselves do. The entourage will then move up to Sky Stadiums’ premium lounges for snacks, a cash bar, and a Q&A from some legendary ex-Warriors.
Saturday Match Day Hospitality
Enjoy the Anzac Day match and entertainment with fellow Warriors fanatics from the comfort of one of our premium lounges. Included is a premium food offering, private seats with epic views and dedicated bar facilities.
Hosted by Warriors Legends
Throughout the weekend you’ll also be in the company of some of the Warriors greats. You’ll have ample opportunity to ask questions, get insights, tips and tricks, or hear a play by play of some of your favourite Warriors action moments straight from the source.
Exclusive Prizes
Be in to win some exclusive signed Warriors merchandise and other spot prizes over the course of the weekend as a cherry on top of a fantastic Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
Don’t miss out! We expect tickets to go quick, so call up your mates and lock it in today.

The King of Pop Show: Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience
Get ready for the ultimate thrill! Experience Michael Jackson like never before with TJ Cappola's electrifying live concert: Beyond Imagination! Feel the magic of the King of Pop as if he was performing right in front of you.

If you never had the chance to witness Michael Jackson live, “The King of Pop Show – Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience” offers the closest experience to reliving the legendary artist’s magic. This dynamic show continues to captivate audiences across Australia and Asia with its sold-out performances.

This spectacular and powerful show captures all the excitement of Michael performing live in concert. From the electrifying energy to the iconic dance moves and unforgettable hits like “Billie Jean,” “Thriller,” “Beat It,” and more, audiences are transported to the peak of MJ’s career.

TJ Cappola’s remarkable portrayal, vocals and persona, supported by a live band, professional dancers, replica costumes and a state-of-the-art light show and visuals that will leave you in awe! This experience is a true homage to the King of Pop that fans won’t want to miss. It’s a thrilling opportunity to immerse oneself in the music and spectacle that defined Michael Jackson’s unparalleled legacy.

events.long_description:
Cringeworthy - Trippin’ in the ‘90s - Opening
Following the success of Cringeworthy ‘50s, ’60s, ‘70s and ’80s this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a 'rad' mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.

The ‘90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, grunge and country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as Silly Love Songs, and Killing Me Softly.

What's the time, Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today.

“A fantabulous blast from the past, high energy, fun and a belly full of laughs!”

“A unique blend of uplifting vocals, brilliant choreography and personality personified!”

Starring Andrea Sanders, Kali Kopae, Devon Neiman, and Mackenzie Htay - get ready to party like it's 1999, cos Backstreet’s back!

events.id: Fat Freddy’s Drop-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Fat Freddy’s Drop
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Doing it for the love of music, Fat Freddy’s Drop takes to the Michael Fowler Centre stage in May 2026. They’ll be there for two nights performing their ground-breaking debut album, ‘Based On A True Story’. The tour will mark the first live performances since the sudden death of founding band member Chris ‘MU’ Faiumu.
Lead singer Dallas Tamaira says, “It’s important for us to honour the intentions we had with MU and playing this album live is part of that.” ‘Based On A True Story’ was independently released in 2005. It became Aotearoa’s longest-charting album with 111 weeks in the Top 40. It also won eight NZ Music Awards and took out Giles Peterson’s Worldwide Music Awards in the UK.
Twenty years later, and the band’s unique funk and roots style has become a defining sound of Aotearoa. “[Based On A True Story] was the band’s first full-length studio album and its success was the springboard for what has been an incredible journey together,” explains saxophonist Scott Towers. “We want to pay tribute to the music, to MU, and the band he established. And, of course, to play to our fans around the world who have supported us through everything.”
